column1: CLEVELAND -- Buck Showalter took the Baltimore Orioles ' new hit show on the road and produced another win . 	 Felix Pie hit the first of four home runs by the Orioles in a 14 - 8 victory over the Cleveland Indians on Tuesday night
column2: Showalter 's first road game since taking over as manager . 	 " It 's real fun to be an Oriole right now
column3: " rookie right - hander Jake Arrieta said after the Orioles improved to 7 - 1 with Showalter in command . 	 Arrieta ( 4 - 3 ) allowed five earned runs over six innings to win for the first time in five starts . 	 " Tonight
column6: whose starting pitchers had posted a 1.89 ERA on a 6 - 1 homestand after he took over . 	 " You like to see runs tacked on to give you a little security
column7: if there is such a thing in the American League
column8: " Showalter continued . " You could see early on that runs were not going to be at a premium . " 	 Pie 's three - run drive over the center field wall off Justin Masterson ( 4 - 11 ) with two outs in the fifth gave Baltimore a 7 - 6 lead . It came after Arrieta fell behind 6 - 4 by allowing five runs in the bottom of the fourth after the Orioles had taken a 4 - 1 lead with four runs in the top half . 	 " That 's disappointing
column9: " Masterson said . " You have the lead and you want to keep it . You feel like you let down everyone else . He [ Pie ] struck it well . We tried to make him put a ball in play
column10: and he [ really ] put a ball in play . " 	 Corey Patterson hit a solo homer in the sixth
column11: and then Matt Wieters had a two - run shot and Luke Scott another three - run drive during the Orioles ' six - run eighth . 	 The Orioles still have the worst record in the majors at 39 - 74 and worst on the road ( 15 - 40 ) . Cleveland has lost eight of its last 10 at home . 	 " We could have a few more wins with fewer walks and fewer errors
column12: " Indians manager Manny Acta said . " We need to face it and we need to get better . " 	 Scott had four RBIs and the 6 - thru-9 batters in Baltimore 's order totaled eight hits
column13: seven runs and nine RBIs . The Orioles were 7 - for-10 with runners in scoring position and are 29 - for-70 ( .414 ) under Showalter . 	 Asdrubal Cabrera 's run - scoring single gave Cleveland a 1 - 0 lead in the third . 	 Both teams sent nine men to bat in the fourth . The Orioles ' four - run half included an error
column16: three hits and a spectacular play by Cabrera at shortstop . 	 Scott had an RBI double and Adam Jones put Baltimore ahead 2 - 1 with a run - scoring groundout . With a runner on third
column17: Pie lined a shot off Masterson 's left foot . Cabrera
column18: moving to his left
column19: stopped in his tracks
column20: dived to his right and caught the ball barehanded before throwing out the speedy Pie from a sitting position . 	 " I was mad
column21: " Pie said . " I could n't believe it . " 	 Wieters and Cesar Izturis added RBI singles to make it 4 - 1 . 	 Shin - Soo Choo 's two - run double capped Cleveland 's five - run bottom half . Cabrera was thrown out trying to score from first on the bases - loaded drive into the right field corner . 	 " It was just kind of glad to be out of the inning
column22: " Arrieta said . " I just lost command of offspeed pitches in that inning . " 	 Trevor Crowe doubled home a run
column23: stole third and scored on a groundout by Luis Valbuena . Michael Brantley 's two - out RBI single tied it at 4 . Brantley had a two - run homer in the ninth . 	 Baltimore 's first four batters combined to hit for the cycle in the eighth off Frank Herrmann . Pie doubled and scored on Wieters homer . Patterson tripled and scored on a single by Izturis to make it 11 - 6 . 	 Masterson gave up four earned runs over five innings
column24: dropping to 5 - 17 in 32 starts since being acquired from the Boston Red Sox in July 2009 . 	 Game notes 	  Cleveland acquired catcher Luke Carlin from the Pittsburgh Pirates for a player to be named and sent him to Triple - A Columbus . Carlin has a .252 average in 46 career games with the San Diego Padres ( 2008 ) and Arizona Diamondbacks ( 2009 ) . He hit .239 for the Pirates ' Triple - A team at Indianapolis this year . ... The Indians signed right - handers Cole Cook and Nate Striz
column25: their fifth and 22nd draft picks
column26: respectively . Cleveland 's top four picks are unsigned with the deadline Monday at midnight . ... Orioles third baseman Josh Bell
column27: in a 3 - for-22 slump
column28: did n't start . He was a defensive replacement in the ninth . ... The Orioles improved to 19 - 46 at Progressive Field since the ballpark opened in 1994 -- with Arrieta only the eighth Baltimore starter to earn a win . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season

column1: DETROIT -- Jeremy Hellickson is making pitching in the majors look easy . 	 He and two other Tampa Bay pitchers combined on a four - hitter and the Rays beat the Detroit Tigers 8 - 0 on Tuesday night . 	 Hellickson ( 2 - 0 )
column2: making his second major league start and appearance after being recalled Monday night from Triple - A Durham for the second time this month
column3: gave up three hits and struck out seven without walking a batter over seven innings . 	 " For a kid who has made only two starts
column5: " Detroit 's Johnny Damon said . " He 's in the majors to stay . " 	 Hellickson has a 1.29 ERA
column6: allowed two walks against 13 strikeouts and has given up only six hits in 14 innings in the majors . 	 Joaquin Benoit pitched the eighth and Mike Ekstrom the ninth . 	 After allowing Austin Jackson 's single to lead off the game
column7: Hellickson retired 18 straight batters and faced the minimum through six innings . Damon flied out after Jackson 's hit and Brennan Boesch hit into a double play to end the inning . 	 " I felt really good
column8: " Hellickson said . " As long as I can throw my curveball for a strike
column9: I feel I can be successful . " 	 He struck out six of eight batters during a span from the second through fifth innings . 	 " His third pitch was his curveball and he dropped it in for strikes
column10: " Rays catcher John Jaso said . " And he was getting swings and misses with it . " 	 Hellickson 's first two pitches were his fastball and changeup . 	 Damon 's one - out single in the seventh broke Hellickson 's streak . Boesch followed with a single
column11: but Hellickson induced Miguel Cabrera to hit into a double play to get out of the jam . 	 Tampa Bay manager Joe Maddon said Hellickson always stays calm . 	 " He 's able to control his emotions
column12: " Maddon said . " ... That 's been a big part of his success . " 	 Max Scherzer ( 7 - 9 )
column13: the opposing pitcher when the Rays ' Matt Garza no - hit the Tigers in Tampa Bay on July 26
column14: gave up one earned run and four hits in seven innings
column15: walking four and striking out two . 	 Detroit is 6 - 21 since the All - Star break . The Tigers are particularly struggling at the plate . 	 " We 're pressing offensively ... hard to believe
column16: " Detroit manager Jim Leyland said sarcastically . " It 's more like an over - effort . We 've just got to get some offense going . " 	 Jackson had two of the Tigers ' four hits . 	 Tampa Bay got its first two runs on Detroit miscues . The Rays took a 1 - 0 lead in the fifth when Ryan Raburn bobbled Jason Bartlett 's double to left - center field to allow Dan Johnson to score from first with one out . 	 Scherzer 's wild pitch made it 2 - 0 in the seventh as Johnson
column17: who had walked and advanced on two groundouts
column18: scored from third . 	 Evan Longoria added an RBI double in the eighth . Jaso hit a run - scoring double
column19: Ben Zobrist a sacrifice fly and Willy Aybar
column20: Johnson and B.J. Upton walked with the bases loaded in the ninth . 	 Game notes 	  Maddon talked about using C Jaso as the team 's leadoff man . Jaso
column21: the first Rays C to ever bat leadoff
column22: led off for the 19th time on Tuesday night . " He works good at - bats
column24: he 's a good baserunner ... he 's going to make good reads
column25: " Maddon said . ... Maddon said 1B Carlos Pena
column26: on the 15 - day DL with a right plantar fascia sprain
column27: looked good during a workout on the field before Tuesday night 's game . ... Rays 1B Johnson walked four times . ... Detroit fans gave their largest cheer of the night when reliever Enrique Gonzalez
column28: who threw seven straight balls when he entered the game with the bases loaded in the ninth
column29: threw a strike to Upton on a 3 - 0 pitch . Gonzalez then walked Upton to force in another run . ... Tigers 3B Brandon Inge was 0 for 3 and is in a 0 - for-21 skid . column1: WASHINGTON -- Everyone else has been building outsized expectations for Stephen Strasburg . 	 This time
column2: maybe he was the one hoping for too much . 	 Returning from his first trip to the disabled list
column3: Strasburg turned in the worst start of his sometimes - spectacular rookie season
column4: allowing a career - high six earned runs in a career - low 4 1/3 innings Tuesday night
column5: and his Washington Nationals lost to the Florida Marlins 8 - 2 . 	 " Not one pitch felt like I controlled it
column6: " Strasburg said . " Just going to chalk it up as a learning experience and go out there and really compete and not worry about things too much next time . " 	 Dan Uggla drove in four runs with a homer and a double
column7: and Hanley Ramirez hit two of his three doubles off Strasburg ( 5 - 3 )
column8: whose ERA rose from 2.32 to 3.07 . The No . 1 overall pick in the 2009 amateur draft had not allowed more than three earned runs or lasted fewer than five innings in any of his previous nine major league games . 	 " Just was n't his night
column9: " Nationals manager Jim Riggleman said . " ' Rust ' is probably a good word . He just was n't sharp . His velocity was good . " 	 In other words : Do n't panic about one poor outing
column10: and do n't forget that Strasburg was consistently in the 98 - 99 mph range early and touched 100 mph once . 	 " Arm felt really good . Nice and loose . Everything felt 100 percent . Just did n't know where it was going today
column11: " Strasburg said . " Being on the DL
column13: and maybe expecting maybe a little too much out of myself -- kind of got in my head a little bit out there . " 	 He struck out at least five hitters in each prior start -- including a high of 14 in his June 8 debut -- but had only four K 's against Florida
column14: and two were of opposing pitcher Anibal Sanchez . Strasburg gave up six hits and two walks
column15: and went to three - ball counts on five of his first 12 batters . 	 " When you see guys smacking doubles
column16: hitting home runs
column17: " said Mike Stanton
column18: who doubled off Strasburg in the fourth
column19: " everyone kind of gets up for that and wants to knock him out early . And that 's what happened . " 	 When Strasburg beat Florida on July 16
column20: he threw six shutout innings . Tuesday marked the first time he was facing a big league club for a second time . 	 " We saw him once before
column21: " Stanton said
column22: " so we were a little ready . " 	 Sanchez ( 9 - 7 )
column24: went 6 2/3 innings and both runs he was responsible for were unearned . 	 " Same thing he always does : any pitch at any time
column25: throwing strikes
column26: keeping you off - balance
column27: " Washington 's Ryan Zimmerman said . 	 Strasburg had n't pitched since a victory at Cincinnati on July 21 . His next scheduled start was July 27 at home against Atlanta
column28: but he had trouble getting loose in the bullpen beforehand
column29: prompting general manager Mike Rizzo to scratch the pitcher he signed to a record $ 15.1 million contract . 	 Two days later
column30: Strasburg went on the DL with shoulder inflammation . 	 Although it only had been three weeks since Strasburg last faced major league hitters
column31: his appearance was described as a " long - awaited return " by the PA announcer at Nationals Park . Dozens in the crowd of 25
column32: 939 gathered along the walls above the home bullpen to watch him warm up . 	 His first real pitch was a 99 mph ball to Ramirez
column33: who eventually popped out . But Strasburg walked Logan Morrison and gave up Uggla 's 26th homer on a high
column34: 99 mph fastball that started outside but drifted over the inner half of the plate . The ball landed in the red flowers barely beyond the wall in left . 	 " I 'm not going to lie
column35: " Uggla said . " I did n't hit that ball good . " 	 Strasburg 's take : " He touched it . I supplied all the power for it . " 	 More trouble came in an eventful third
column36: when there was action in Washington 's bullpen as Florida took a 4 - 0 lead . 	 Strasburg gave up Ramirez 's first double
column37: walked Morrison again
column38: was visited by pitching coach Steve McCatty
column39: and eventually gave up Uggla 's two - run double over left fielder Josh Willingham 's head . 	 After Ramirez doubled on an 0 - 2 count in the fifth
column40: Riggleman came out for a visit . Two batters later
column41: Gaby Sanchez doubled off Willingham 's glove for a 5 - 1 lead . That was it for Strasburg
column42: who glanced away while handing Riggleman the ball . 	 " His games where he struggles
column43: we tend to go a little overboard
column44: " McCatty said . " But the kid 's actually been pretty doggone good so far . If he has this game one out of 10
column45: I 'll be pretty happy with it . " 	 Game notes 	  Uggla has homered in 10 of his last 16 games . ... Ramirez 's three doubles tied a team record . ... Florida had n't played since Saturday because of a rainout and a day off . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: TORONTO -- Resilience in the face of adversity has been a theme for the Boston Red Sox all season . Tuesday night was no exception . 	 Mike Lowell hit a go - ahead home run in the eighth inning and the Red Sox beat the Toronto Blue Jays 7 - 5 despite blowing two leads . 	 " It was like our whole season
column2: " Red Sox manager Terry Francona said . " It was n't perfect but we kept playing . 	 " We did a lot of things that were n't really conducive to winning a close game but we found ways to come back and win
column3: " Francona added . 	 J.D. Drew hit a solo shot as the Red Sox improved to 8 - 2 against the Blue Jays this year . Boston has won eight of its past 11 on the road . 	 Lowell
column4: who returned to the lineup Aug. 3 after missing 34 games with a sore right hip
column8: absent for 58 games with fractured ribs
column9: were key figures in this one
column10: driving in five of the seven Boston runs . 	 " We 've kind of been relentless the whole year with injuries and trying to piece things together
column11: " Lowell said . " That was a really nice win . Winning the first game of the series is always pretty good but the way we did it tonight was extra satisfying . " 	 Catcher Victor Martinez said the Red Sox are happy to have extra reinforcements in their injury - ravaged lineup . 	 " It 's good . Any help that we can get is good
column12: " Martinez said . " We just want to stay together and keep pushing . " 	 Third - place Boston is still without infielders Kevin Youkilis ( right thumb ) and Dustin Pedroia ( left foot )
column13: catcher Jason Varitek ( right foot ) and left - hander Hideki Okajima ( right hamstring ) . 	 Jose Bautista hit his major - league - leading 35th home run for the Blue Jays
column14: while Travis Snider hit a three - run shot and Adam Lind added a solo blast . Toronto leads the majors with 178 homers this season
column16: who are second with 149 . 	 Felix Doubront ( 2 - 2 ) pitched 1 1/3 innings for the win while Shawn Camp ( 3 - 2 ) took the loss . 	 Jonathan Papelbon pitched around a one - out double in the ninth for his 29th save in 34 chances . Papelbon has never blown a save in 24 opportunities against Toronto . 	 Scott Downs got one out in the eighth for the Blue Jays before Camp came on to face Adrian Beltre
column17: who grounded out . Lowell followed with a homer to left - center
column18: his fourth . 	 " We had our chances
column19: " Blue Jays manager Cito Gaston said . " We just did n't hold them in the end . " 	 Pinch hitter Ryan Kalish singled and Lowrie made it 7 - 5 with an RBI double to center . Lowrie went 2 for 3 with two RBIs . 	 " That 's why we 've been talking about getting him healthy
column20: because he can help you win
column21: " Francona said . 	 Boston opened the scoring with three in the second . Beltre and Lowrie hit RBI doubles and Ellsbury added an RBI single . 	 Lind homered in the bottom half
column24: but Boston added one more in the third on Lowell 's sacrifice fly . 	 Toronto promptly tied it in the bottom of the inning when Snider hit a three - run homer off the facing of the second deck in right
column25: his eighth 	 The Red Sox reclaimed the lead in the fifth on a solo homer by Drew
column26: his 13th
column27: but Bautista tied it again with a solo drive to left off Doubront in the seventh . 	 Red Sox right - hander Daisuke Matsuzaka allowed four runs and six hits in 5 2/3 innings . He walked three and struck out seven . 	 Blue Jays lefty Ricky Romero allowed five runs and eight hits in six innings . He walked two
column28: one intentional
column29: and struck out four . 	 Game notes 	  Boston is 6 - 1 in Toronto this season . ... Pedroia ran at full speed before the game . He could begin a rehab assignment this weekend and hopes to return to the lineup Aug. 17 . Varitek is about seven to 10 days behind Pedroia
column30: Francona said . ... Toronto OF Vernon Wells did not play after dislocating the big toe on his right foot when he crashed into the outfield wall Sunday . He could return Wednesday . ... Blue Jays SS Yunel Escobar ( right knee ) was a late scratch . He was replaced by McDonald . column1: CINCINNATI -- From their first - inning scrum to the final out
column2: the St. Louis Cardinals sent a message : Do n't demean the defending champs . Not without expecting a fight . 	 Yadier Molina jawed with Cincinnati Reds second baseman Brandon Phillips in the first inning Tuesday night
column4: and the Cardinals followed their catcher 's lead to an 8 - 4 victory that moved St. Louis back into first place in the NL Central . 	 When it was over
column5: there were cuts and scrapes and a sense that the Cardinals had gotten the better of it all . 	 " I know our guys
column6: " manager Tony La Russa said . " This is not the first time that we 've been challenged . You just go up and down our roster -- we 've got a bunch of guys that are very tough characters . Like I say
column7: there 's times that you beat us
column8: we 're not good enough . but you 're never going to scare us and we 're never going to back down . " 	 The fight brought out their best . 	 St. Louis has won the first two games of the showdown series between teams locked in a tight race since May. The Cardinals moved a season - high 14 games over .500 and a few percentage points ahead of the Reds
column9: who had led the division for the last eight days . 	 The defending champions improved to 9 - 5 against the Reds this season
column10: the only team in the NL Central that has beaten them so thoroughly . 	 " They 're in first place
column11: but we showed we 've got good talent and we 're going to compete
column12: " Molina said . " We did today . We battled . " 	 By contrast
column13: the Reds responded to the dustup with one of their worst games
column14: committing three errors and managing only six singles . 	 " I do n't think it 's a big mystery that there was some tension before the game
column15: " third baseman Scott Rolen said . " I was tired before my first at - bat . I wo n't get into specifics about it . It was two teams defending their own people . It got ugly . " 	 It all started with Phillips . 	 The second baseman opened the series by saying he hates the Cardinals and calling them complainers . Reds manager Dusty Baker wished he had n't said it
column16: and had a talk with Phillips before the game on Tuesday . 	 Then
column17: Phillips caught grief from the Cardinals . 	 He dug in to lead off the bottom of the first and tapped his bat on Molina 's shin guard in a friendly gesture . Molina was taken aback . 	 " The comment he made yesterday that he 's got no friends over here -- then why you touch me ? " Molina said . " You are not my friend
column18: so do n't touch me . I mean
column19: if we 're no good for you
column20: you are not my friend . " 	 The exchange turned angry . Phillips took off his helmet
column21: Molina removed his mask . Both benches and bullpens emptied . 	 La Russa and Baker talked animatedly in the middle of the crowd . Rolen -- a former Cardinal -- went after St. Louis pitcher Chris Carpenter
column22: who beat the Reds 7 - 3 in the series opener on Monday night
column23: trying to be a peacemaker . That
column25: escalated . 	 Carpenter ended up pinned against the backstop screen . Cueto also ended up against the screen
column26: furiously kicking away St. Louis players . Catcher Jason LaRue got kicked in the head -- La Russa said he had a slight concussion -- and Carpenter had several long
column27: raw scrapes across his lower back and his right side . 	 " I turn around and I 've got Cueto kicking me in the back with his spikes
column28: " Carpenter said . " It 's super unprofessional . I do n't know where he learned how to fight . " 	 Cueto said he was trying to protect himself . 	 " I was trying to break it up
column29: " Cueto said
column30: with catcher Ramon Hernandez translating . " The next thing I know
column31: 15 - 20 people were around me . I was up against the net . When 15 people are around you
column32: you get scared . I had my back to the wall with my feet up . " 	 The altercation lasted seven minutes . Play resumed and Phillips grounded out . 	 Molina hit a solo homer off Cueto ( 11 - 3 ) in the second inning and later added a sacrifice fly . Matt Holliday broke the game open with a bases - loaded single in the seventh
column33: one of his four hits . 	 Rookie left - hander Jaime Garcia ( 10 - 5 ) beat the Reds for the third time this season
column34: giving up four runs in 5 1/3 innings . Ryan Franklin retired Phillips
column36: on a routine grounder with two runners aboard
column37: ending the game for his 20th save in 22 tries . 	 " We did n't get key hits when we needed them
column38: " said Phillips
column39: who is 1 for 10 in the series . " It 's all about wins . We 're in a race . " 	 Game notes 	  The last St. Louis rookie to win 10 games was Jason Simontacchi in 2002 . ... St. Louis 2B Skip Schumaker left the game with leg cramps . It was 95 degrees at game time . ... La Russa said RHP Jeff Suppan had discomfort in his groin during a between - starts workout on Monday and is being examined . ... The Reds started using RHP Homer Bailey out of the bullpen during his minor league rehab stint . Bailey has been on the DL since May 24 with inflammation in his pitching shoulder . ... Holliday 's bases - loaded single ended Ondrusek 's streak of scoreless innings at 22 . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: NEW YORK -- Mike Pelfrey stood tall on the mound
column2: aggressively challenging the Colorado Rockies with fastballs . From the start
column3: he looked like a pitcher determined to put an emphatic end to a slide . 	 And
column5: did he . 	 Pelfrey returned to early - season form
column6: outpitching All - Star Ubaldo Jimenez for seven innings
column7: and Jose Reyes hit a sacrifice fly to help the New York Mets kick off a crucial homestand with a 1 - 0 win over the Rockies on Tuesday night . 	 " I thought the tempo was better
column8: I was quick on the mound
column9: " Pelfrey said . " Coming to the game I knew I had to be at the top of my game
column10: and I knew that guy 's been good over there . " 	 The Mets moved back to .500 ( 56 - 56 ) with a much - needed win after returning from a 2 - 4 road trip against division rivals that helped drop them 8 games behind the Atlanta Braves in the NL East . They were relying on Pelfrey to bounce back from a horrible seven - start winless stretch while facing the Rockies ' 17 - game winner . 	 " It looked like he was attacking
column11: " Mets manager Jerry Manuel said . " I think Mike 's on his way back . " 	 Pelfrey ( 11 - 6 ) had been so bad since late June that at one point Manuel considered skipping his turn in the rotation . column2: Texas -- David Murphy is becoming a prime - time player for the Texas Rangers
column3: with another big hit to provide an exciting victory and a career - first for New York Yankees closer Mariano Rivera . 	 Murphy 's single off Rivera with the bases loaded in the 10th inning gave the AL West - leading Rangers a 4 - 3 victory Tuesday night in an early August matchup of division leaders with a playoff - type atmosphere . 	 After go - ahead homers in two Texas victories over the last week

column7: " Murphy said . " It 's working right now and I 'll stick with it . " 	 It was Rivera 's first loss in 32 career appearances at Rangers Ballpark

The Rangers ( 65 - 47 ) are 8 1/2 games ahead of the Los Angeles Angels . 	 Murphy 's two - run homer in the sixth put the Rangers ahead 3 - 2 after he threw out a runner out at home plate

column1: HOUSTON -- Brooks Conrad filled in ably for an injured Chipper Jones on Tuesday night . 	 Now the Atlanta Braves have to wait and see how long he 'll be their third baseman . 	 Conrad 's two - run homer in the ninth inning powered the Braves to a 4 - 2 win over the Houston Astros . 	 The Braves were trailing 2 - 1 after the Astros scored a pair of runs in the eighth inning off Atlanta errors before Conrad 's shot to right field off Houston closer Matt Lindstrom ( 2 - 3 ) . 	 Alex Gonzalez singled to set up Conrad 's go - ahead shot . Conrad entered the game in the bottom of the sixth inning to replace Jones
column2: who injured his left knee . 	 " It was really big
column3: " Conrad said of the comeback . " He goes down like that and it was tough
column4: but we pulled through and won the game and it was really huge . " 	 Jones said after the game that he did n't think the injury was to his anterior cruciate ligament but that he heard a pop and had significant pain in his knee . He 'll wait until Thursday to get an MRI in Atlanta . 	 Troy Glaus added a solo homer off Lindstrom in the ninth and also drove in Atlanta 's first run in the seventh inning . 	 " I am just devastated
column5: " Lindstrom said . " J.A. pitched a great game . The guys battled back
column6: so it is really hard to swallow right now . I do n't know what else to say other than I take responsibility and I look forward to getting back out there and working on my mechanics and getting my location back . " 	 Jonny Venters ( 4 - 0 ) got the win after striking out Jason Michaels to end the eighth inning and Billy Wagner pitched a perfect ninth for his 28th save . 	 Atlanta 's big ninth inning allowed the team to overcome another sloppy defensive night . The Braves committed three errors for the second straight game . 	 Michael Bourn tripled in the eighth inning and tied it on an error by Gonzalez on a bad throw home to Brian McCann on a ball hit by Jeff Keppinger . Keppinger reached first on a fielder 's choice . Braves starter Jair Jurrjens then intentionally walked Hunter Pence and was replaced by Peter Moylan . 	 Houston went ahead on an error by Omar Infante when he missed the catch at second
column7: allowing Keppinger to score . 	 " Just a great win
column8: " Braves manager Bobby Cox said . " The way J.J. pitched and then Chipper gets hurt
column10: adversity staring us right in the face and we came back . " 	 Glaus put Atlanta up 1 - 0 with an RBI - single in the seventh inning . Astros starter J.A. Happ set up that score by walking Conrad to start the seventh before walking McCann with one out . 	 Jurrjens allowed six hits and two runs in 7 1/3 innings . 	 Happ did not factor in the decision
column11: but was much better on Tuesday than in his last start where he allowed seven earned runs in one - plus innings . He yielded just two hits and a run in 6 1/3 innings in his third start for the Astros since being traded from the Philadelphia Phillies for Roy Oswalt . 	 " Tonight I was better at mixing things up and throwing more strikes
column12: " Happ said . " I was around the plate and still kept the ball where it needed to be a lot more often tonight . " 	 Rick Ankiel robbed Carlos Lee of a hit with one out in the fourth inning with a nifty diving grab on his fly ball to center . Ankiel dove headfirst to snag the ball and bounced awkwardly on the grass as he landed with his glove between his legs but with the ball sitting firmly in it . 	 Chris Johnson singled after that but Jurrjens struck out Brett Wallace to end that inning . 	 Jason Castro singled in the fifth inning before Happ reached on an error by Jones . But Jurrjens retired the next three Astros to end the inning . 	 Happ retired the first seven batters he faced before walking Ankiel with one out in the third inning . But he got out of that inning unscathed after striking out Jurrjens before Ankiel was picked off trying to steal second base . 	 He did n't allow a hit until a double by Jones with two outs in the fourth inning . Happ intentionally walked Matt Diaz before McCann popped out for the third out . 	 He sailed through the next two innings
column13: facing the minimum in the fifth and sixth
column14: before the walk to Conrad to start the seventh . The run - scoring single to Glaus chased Happ . 	 He was replaced by Wilton Lopez
column15: and the Astros turned a double play to limit the damage . 	 Jones was injured fielding a ball in the sixth inning . He grabbed a grounder hit by Pence and jumped in the air as he made the throw to first base to get Pence out . He then fell to the ground where he remained for several minutes while trainers and coaches crowded around him . He was helped to his feet and walked gingerly off on his own power . 	 Game notes 	  Right fielder Jason Heyward was scratched from Atlanta 's lineup because of a sore right knee . ... The Astros gave Cox a cowboy hat and a pair of boots to honor his career before the game . Houston manager Brad Mills and hitting coach Jeff Bagwell handed him the gifts . ... Cox chatted with Orlando Magic coach Stan Van Gundy and his brother

column1: CHICAGO -- Jim Thome figured the Minnesota Twins would fight the Chicago White Sox for the AL Central championship . If they keep hitting like this
column2: they 'll get the knockout . 	 Thome knocked his 579th homer
column3: Joe Mauer had three more hits and the Twins took sole possession of the AL Central lead by beating the White Sox 12 - 6 on Tuesday night . 	 " We knew coming into this season
column4: they were going to have a very good ballclub
column6: who spent nearly four years with the White Sox before getting dealt to the Los Angeles Dodgers late last season . " In our division
column8: when you play the White Sox you 've got to bear down . They 've got a good club
column11: it was a good start to a showcase series between the top two teams in the division . Now
column12: they 're alone atop the Central for the first time since July 2 . 	 For the White Sox ? 	 " It was a very
column13: very bad game from the beginning
column14: " manager Ozzie Guillen said . 	 The Twins pounded out five homers
column15: starting with Thome 's drive to left - center on the first pitch of the second to kick off a four - run burst against his former team that made it 5 - 0 . 	 J.J. Hardy and Mauer each went deep against Freddy Garcia ( 10 - 5 ) in the inning
column16: and the Twins pulled away after Chicago 's Carlos Quentin hit a three - run shot off Scott Baker ( 10 - 9 ) in the bottom half . 	 Mauer now has 25 hits in 46 at - bats after going 3 - for-5 and Minnesota pounded out 14 in all while winning for the fifth time in six games . 	 " We see stretches like this all the time with him
column17: where he 's just on every ball and getting big hits
column18: " manager Ron Gardenhire said . " I 'd say it amazes me
column19: but I do n't know about that anymore . " 	 Jason Kubel and Michael Cuddyer each added two - run homers . 	 It was another difficult night for the White Sox
column20: who managed just 10 runs while dropping three of four at Baltimore and falling into a first - place tie . 	 Guillen went off on another tangent before the game in which he wondered why there was so much attention on the Twins and said his own team does not " feel the support . " He said the White Sox deserve more credit
column21: but they did n't exactly back him while taking just their second home loss in 15 games . 	 Garcia allowed six runs and eight hits over 2 1/3 innings after going 7 - 1 in his previous 12 starts
column22: and while the White Sox showed some pop at the plate
column23: it was n't enough to make up for his difficulties . 	 Baker allowed five runs over six shaky innings . column2: the St. Louis Cardinals gave second baseman Brandon Phillips a different description to use . 	 Whiners ? Complainers ? 	 Try division leaders . 	 Colby Rasmus hit his first career grand slam
column3: Adam Wainwright dominated again and the brawl - scarred Cardinals beat the Cincinnati Reds 6 - 1 on Wednesday
column4: completing a three - game sweep that changed the standings and made a point . 	 The defending NL Central champs wo n't let themselves be dismissed or demeaned . 	 " It certainly added fuel to our fire when you 've got guys opening their mouth
column7: who gave up only two singles in seven shutout innings . " But we only used that in a positive way . It 's very unprofessional to fire back . " 	 The Cardinals overtook the Reds with their first three - game sweep in Cincinnati since 2005
column8: moving a game ahead in the standings . It could n't have been more satisfying . 	 While the Cardinals dressed afterward
column9: televisions in the visitors ' clubhouse were tuned to a sports show that replayed their brawl with the Reds from the previous night
column10: one incited by Phillips ' comments . The All - Star second baseman had said he hates the Cardinals and called them a bunch of complainers . 	 When his words were shown again on the TV screen
column11: one Cardinal simply chuckled . 	 The lopsided series could represent a tipping point in the two - team race . 	 Cincinnati was on one of its best surges of the season
column12: leading St. Louis by two games when it began . The Reds were shut down by one of the league 's best rotations -- Chris Carpenter
column14: who joined the Colorado Rockies ' Ubaldo Jimenez as the NL 's 17 - game winners . 	 St. Louis thumped 'em every which way . 	 " A lot of things were going on . It 's a pumped - up series
column16: " said Rasmus
column17: who got his first grand slam on his 24th birthday . " With the pitching we have
column18: that 's kind of tough for them
column19: especially coming in with the words they were putting out there . I think it just kind of got everybody more pumped up . It definitely did n't work in their favor . " 	 The Reds had n't lost three in a row since the All - Star break and had n't been swept at home all season . Phillips ' incendiary words became a backdrop and flashpoint for a first - inning brawl on Tuesday night
column20: when he and catcher Yadier Molina went nose - to - nose at home plate . A couple Cardinals got kicked by Reds starter Johnny Cueto
column21: who was pinned against the backstop . 	 A day later
column22: the Reds did n't put up much of a fight . They managed only four baserunners against Wainwright -- two on errors . The right - hander improved to 9 - 0 in day games
column23: best in the league . Wainwright has been on top of his game
column24: going 3 - 0 in August while allowing one run . 	 The Reds were held to 11 singles in the last two games . Phillips
column25: their leadoff hitter
column26: had two singles in 14 at - bats during the series
column27: getting the ball out of the infield three times . 	 " We 're just going to look forward
column28: " Phillips said . " There is no reason to panic . They 're a good team . They 've been to the playoffs so many times . " 	 There were some lingering wounds from the seven - minute scrum . Reserve catcher Jason LaRue had sore ribs and was expected to get X - rays . Cardinals manager Tony La Russa expects Major League Baseball to discipline the Reds for the brawl . 	 Reds manager Dusty Baker acknowledged before Wednesday 's game that his team had so far been outplayed . Baker sat in the steamy afternoon heat and watched it happen again . 	 Bronson Arroyo had n't given up an earned run in his last two starts . The Cardinals loaded the bases in the fifth with the help of an intentional walk to Albert Pujols . Arroyo got ahead of Rasmus 0 - 2 in the count
column29: but the outfielder fouled off a couple tough pitches
column30: worked the count full and then homered off the base of the batter 's eye in center field . 	 " You try to put this series behind you

column1: DETROIT -- The Detroit Tigers turned a lead in the AL Central into a 10 - game deficit in a month with a staggering slump . 	 The Tigers
column3: insist the division race is n't over . 	 Ryan Raburn hit a tiebreaking
column4: two - run homer in the sixth inning and Detroit held on to beat the Tampa Bay Rays 3 - 2 on Wednesday . 	 The Tigers led Minnesota by a half - game after beating the Twins on July 10
column5: then won just six of their next 28 games due in part to injuries and a big gap was formed behind them and the Chicago White Sox . 	 Justin Verlander said it was " huge " to avoid a sweep in the series finale against Tampa Bay before going on the road to play the White Sox and Yankees . 	 " Hopefully we 're able to carry this into Chicago and New York and beat up some tough teams
column6: " he said . " Chicago is one of the teams we need to catch and we need to gain some ground on them . " 	 Verlander ( 13 - 7 ) gave up one run and six hits in six innings while striking out seven in an eight - batter stretch . 	 " That was the only point I felt comfortable the whole game
column7: " he said . 	 Ryan Perry pitched 1 2/3 innings of scoreless relief and Jose Valverde allowed a run before earning his 22nd save in 23 chances . 	 Tigers manager Jim Leyland said he 's not worried about his team giving up despite the hole it has dug . 	 " When were in first place for quite a while and somebody hit a groundball and did n't go 110 percent
column9: " he said . " If somebody hits a ball now and goes that same exact speed
column10: somebody says they 're not putting out . That 's what you have to be careful of . 	 " It is a letdown when you were where we were
column11: but it has nothing to do with somebody not hustling . " 	 Tampa Bay started the three - game series with a five - game skid and trailed the AL East - leading Yankees by 2 1/2 games . The Rays made up ground
column12: but that did n't satisfy Joe Maddon . 	 " Our standards are set high
column13: " Maddon said . " We are aiming to win a division and go deep into the postseason
column14: so we want to win every game . " 	 Matt Garza ( 11 - 7 ) has n't won since he no - hit Detroit on July 26 . He gave up three runs and seven hits in 5 2/3 innings to the Tigers after throwing eight scoreless innings last week at Toronto and giving up four runs in a loss to New York in his previous two starts . 	 " I pitched well
column16: so it is hard to feel like it was a good outing
column17: " Garza said . 	 He retired the side in order in the first inning

column1: HOUSTON -- After getting blown out in the first game and needing late rallies to win the other two
column2: Atlanta Braves manager Bobby Cox was pleased to escape Houston with a series victory . 	 Omar Infante drove in the go - ahead run with a 10th - inning double and Brian McCann added a grand slam later in the inning to give the Braves an 8 - 2 win over the Astros on Wednesday . 	 " It was a good series
column3: " Cox said . " We took it . That 's all you can ask . A sweep would have been great
column4: but we almost got swept ourselves . " 	 Infante 's hit bounced low on the wall in left field and scored Rick Ankiel to put Atlanta back on top 3 - 2
column5: giving closer Billy Wagner ( 6 - 2 ) the win after he blew a save in the ninth . Brandon Lyon ( 6 - 5 ) intentionally walked Melky Cabrera to set up a run - scoring single by Alex Gonzalez
column6: and McCann 's pinch - hit slam off Jeff Fulchino put the game out of reach . 	 The Braves trailed 2 - 1 on Tuesday night but won 4 - 2 after a pair of homers in the ninth . 	 " As long as our team is winning ... that 's what it 's all about
column8: the former Astros pitcher who will retire after this season . " That 's not how I guess you 'd draw it up
column9: but you do n't have much you can do about it . But a win 's a win and it 's good for us . Hunter Pence tied it 2 - 2 when he scored on a sacrifice fly by Chris Johnson off Wagner in the ninth inning . Pence singled on a grounder to third base before advancing to third on a single by Lee . Wagner retired the next two batters to send the game to extra innings . 	 Ankiel walked with one out in the 10th before reaching second on an error by Pedro Feliz
column10: who could n't handle the throw to first base . Lyon intentionally walked Eric Hinske before Infante 's go - ahead hit and the flood of runs that followed . 	 " I did n't make good pitches and they hit them
column11: " Lyon said . " I just have to come back next time and make better pitches . " 	 Houston closer Matt Lindstrom was n't available Wednesday after pitching two straight days and dealing with a sore back . 	 Cabrera doubled and scored on a groundout by Gonzalez to make it 1 - 0 in the first inning . Cabrera had advanced to third on a passed ball by catcher Jason Castro to set up the run
column12: before Rodriguez struck out Matt Diaz to get out of that inning . 	 Hanson did n't allow a hit until Michael Bourn 's single leading off the fourth . Bourn stole second and tried to steal third but got caught in a rundown . Hanson dropped the throw while covering the base
column14: allowing Bourn to return safely to second . 	 " One of the most amazing things to see is Bourn in the run down
column16: for anyone that is human and not Superman
column17: when they get in a rundown
column18: they 're generally out . I do n't think anyone has a chance to get him and it came up pretty clutch for us . Astros starter Wandy Rodriguez retired 13 straight before a single to Brooks Conrad with two outs in the fifth inning . Ankiel walked before Hanson 's single on a grounder to left field scored Conrad and put Atlanta on top 2 - 1 . 	 Hanson retired the next ten straight after Pence 's hit before walking Johnson with one out in the seventh inning . He got back on track after that

column2: Calif. -- Bobby Abreu moved into the top spot in the order after the Los Angeles Angels got swept last week at Baltimore . They 're been mostly winning ever since . 	 Abreu homered in the bottom of the 10th inning Wednesday to give the Angels a 2 - 1 victory over the Kansas City Royals and their first three - game sweep since mid - June . 	 " It 's not over for us
column3: " right fielder Torii Hunter said . " The fat lady
column4: she has n't sang yet . " 	 Abreu sent a 1 - 1 pitch from Jesse Chavez ( 4 - 3 ) into the right - field seats with one out . The Angels rushed from the dugout to greet Abreu but stood back
column5: giving him plenty of room to safely cross the plate . 	 Kendry Morales sustained a season - ending broken leg on May 29 while jumping on home plate during a raucous celebration of a walk - off grand slam . 	 " We have rules
column7: referring to changes made after Morales ' injury . " After I touched home plate
column8: we celebrate . We still have our emotions . " 	 The Angels have won five of six with Abreu leading off . 	 " Bobby really works the pitcher

column16: giving up one run in eight innings . 	 " He 's definitely been under the radar way too much this year
column17: " Kansas City starter Zack Greinke said . " He 's in the top three or four pitchers in the American League and he 's leading the league in strikeouts . He 's just shutting down everyone . He dominated and he kept us off - balance the whole time . " 	 Greinke also went eight innings and
column18: just like Weaver

column20: " Abreu said . " He mixed up his pitches really well . He 's not going to give you anything to hit
column21: so you have to be aggressive with him . " 	 The Royals went 2 - 7 on their West Coast trip
column22: with seven games decided by two runs or less . They were outscored 34 - 17 . 	 " Usually the team that pitches better wins
column23: " Royals center fielder Mitch Maier said . " We had plenty of opportunities with guys on base
column24: but we did n't get big hits when we needed them
column25: and that 's the story of the series right there . Weaver 's probably the most deceptive guy I 've seen . He 's tough to pick up and he mixes his stuff and throws all his pitches for strikes . " 	 After his 11th strikeout to open the eighth

column27: then Weaver walked Wilson Betemit to load the bases . Weaver got out of it when Alex Gordon hit a dribbler down the first base line . Weaver grabbed the ball and tagged out Gordon . column1: SEATTLE -- Dallas Braden was n't perfect this time
column2: but he was still awfully good . 	 The Oakland Athletics left - hander looked as good as he has in months against the Seattle Mariners on Wednesday
column3: tossing a four - hitter for his fourth career complete game in a 5 - 1 victory . 	 Braden ( 7 - 8) won for just the third time in nine decisions since throwing the 19th perfect game in major league history against the Tampa Bay Rays on May 9 . He went 0 - 5 in nine starts after his gem before landing on the disabled list from June 23 to July 20 with left elbow tightness . 	 " He 's just sharp mentally and physically right now
column4: " A 's manager Bob Geren said . " He had a real good changeup with two different speeds today . He was able to pitch inside enough to keep both lanes open for his fastball . He threw a lot of strikes . " 	 Braden was effective and efficient
column5: throwing just 104 pitches and 69 strikes . He walked two and struck out six while improving to 3 - 1 with a 2.97 ERA since coming off the DL . 	 " He 's got a really good changeup and got a lot of swings and misses on the changeup
column6: " said the Mariners ' Russell Branyan . " He spotted his heater and had good command today . " 	 Mark Ellis supported him with three doubles and drove in three runs
column7: most of the damage coming against Luke French ( 1 - 3 ) . He allowed four runs and seven hits in six innings . 	 The Mariners had won the first two games in the series
column8: Ellis playing a key role in each one . He hit into a triple play Monday
column9: the first for the Mariners in 15 years
column10: and struck out three times Tuesday against Felix Hernandez before finishing with a career - high three doubles . 	 " It was a series of threes -- triple play
column12: " Ellis said . " It was definitely an interesting series
column13: as long as I get the three hits in there . But no more triple plays . " 	 Ellis had entered the game with just one extra - base hit over his previous 18 games . 	 " He 's always been a guy who could split a gap
column15: " Geren said . " He was just in extra - base - hit drought . They were all hit hard
column16: too . " 	 Ellis hit the first double to open the second
column17: stole third and scored when Coco Crisp hit a sharp single to left . The A 's added a run in the fourth when Rajai Davis hit a one - out double into the left - field corner and Landon Powell lifted a two - out single into shallow center . 	 " The one to Powell was big
column18: " French said . " I had two strikes on him and two outs and was trying to go away and left it up and away . And he hit it . They took advantage of the mistakes and that was pretty much the game . " 	 The A 's added two more runs in the fifth
column19: when Ellis ripped a double down the third - base line . 	 Just three Mariners reached base off Braden through the first six innings
column20: but he still faced the minimum number of batters to that point . All three were wiped away with double plays . 	 The Mariners finally put together a meager rally in the seventh
column21: when Ichiro Suzuki and Jose Lopez singled . Branyan walked to load the bases with one out
column22: and Franklin Gutierrez hit a sacrifice fly that was caught by left fielder Chris Carter on the warning track . 	 Braden thought it was a grand slam . 	 " Absolutely . I was just thinking that I hope Carter is 7 - foot-12 and had a shot to get over the fence and catch it
column23: " Braden said . " I thought [ Gutierrez ] got it . " 	 Casey Kotchman bounced out to first to end the threat
column24: and Ellis finished the scoring with a RBI double in the eighth . It scored Cliff Pennington all the way from first . 	 Ellis is hitting .423 ( 11 - of-26 ) against Seattle this season . Sheets had been told that his ulnar collateral ligament was not involved
column25: but Texas Rangers team surgeon Dr. Keith Meister found the UCL damage during the operation . He transferred the tendon along with repairing the flexor tendon and pronator tendon . column1: CLEVELAND -- Brad Bergesen became the latest Bird to win under Buck Showalter . 	 Bergesen pitched a two - hitter for his first victory in nearly three months and the surging Orioles beat the Cleveland Indians 3 - 1 Wednesday night . 	 " He was outstanding
column3: now 8 - 1 as the Orioles ' new manager after their fourth win in a row . 	 Bergesen ( 4 - 9 ) held the Indians hitless until Luis Valbuena singled with two outs in the fifth inning . He retired 12 in a row before Asdrubal Cabrera singled with two outs in the ninth . 	 Showalter thought about going to the bullpen
column4: but decided Bergesen earned the chance to face Cleveland 's best hitter
column5: Shin - Soo Choo . 	 " He was a bloop and a blast away from a tie game for a few innings
column6: " Showalter said . " It was a tough matchup
column8: too . " 	 Bergesen retired Choo on a routine fly ball to center
column9: completing the best outing by an Orioles starter in Cleveland in 40 years . It was the fewest hits the Indians got at home against a Baltimore starter since Tom Phoebus ' two - hit
column11: 1970 . 	 " We could n't do anything offensively . That was the game
column12: " Indians manager Manny Acta said . 	 Baltimore backed Bergesen with 13 hits and he won for the first time in 13 starts . He had gone 0 - 7 with a 6.65 ERA and was sent to the minors for two weeks in June since his last win for the Orioles

column14: " Showalter said . " He showed tonight what he is capable of doing at this level . " 	 Bergesen walked two and struck out four . column1: WASHINGTON -- Mike Stanton came into the major leagues barely two months ago with lots of hype . On Wednesday night
column2: he had the first of what he hopes will be many five - hit games . 	 Stanton also had four RBIs as he help power the Florida Marlins to a 9 - 5 victory over the Washington Nationals . 	 The 20 - year - old rookie hit a long home run just short of the left field concourse in the seventh inning for his fourth hit . His previous high was three hits . It was his 11th homer
column3: and his teammates marveled at his strength . 	 " Every time he comes up
column4: we 're just waiting [ to see ] how far he can hit it
column5: " teammate Hanley Ramirez said . 	 Ramirez hit a long home run in the second inning to left - center field
column6: but he joked that his had barely cleared the fence . 	 Stanton 's power is evident
column7: but he was n't sure if it was the longest home run he 's hit . 	 " It was up there . I do n't have a measuring stick
column8: " he said . 	 Stanton 's five - hit game was Florida 's first since Ramirez did it on July 10
column10: and he could have hit for the cycle . He had a two - run double that keyed a four - run first inning where the Marlins batted around . He had a single that was deflected twice by shortstop Ian Desmond
column11: who slowed the liner and tipped it in the air volleyball - style
column12: and another double in the fourth . 	 Stanton probably could have made it to third on the ball that right fielder Michael Morse could n't hold on to . 	 " I should have tried to push it
column13: " Stanton said . " It happens . " 	 After the home run

column15: who has managed the team two weeks longer than Stanton has played for it
column16: believes Stanton 's just getting started . 	 " What he did tonight could be the start of very good things to come
column17: " Rodriguez said . 	 Rodriguez believes the rookie
column18: who raised his average from .239 to .259
column19: has limitless ability . 	 " Nobody knows . I do n't think he even knows
column20: " Rodriguez said . He ca n't believe his young star was n't even old enough to celebrate with a legal drink . 	 " That 's the scary part . He 's only 20 . He wants to get better . He does n't want to waste any day . " 	 Washington manager Jim Riggleman realizes that Stanton may be a threat -- for years to come . 	 " We got to figure out something different against him because he is going to be in this division a long time
column21: " Riggleman said . 	 It was the third straight win for the Marlins ( 56 - 56 ) and the 18th time this season they have reached .500 . 	 Stanton 's first double keyed a four - run first inning where Florida batted around against Scott Olsen . The Marlins hammered Olsen ( 3 - 4 )
column22: scoring seven runs and eight hits in 1 2/3 innings -- his shortest start since July 8
column23: 2007 . 	 " I made terrible pitches . You make bad pitches
column25: " Olsen said . 	 Chris Volstad ( 6 - 8) got his third win against Washington this season . He was spectacular in his first two starts against Washington this season -- allowing three runs in 16 innings . In his third
column26: he gave up four runs and nine hits in five - plus innings

Kuntz said Wednesday the Nationals will evaluate Strasburg regularly and " kind of tinker " with his preparation . ... column30: which was operated on in spring training . Detwiler
column31: on the DL retroactive to Aug. 6

column34: " Kuntz said . " Is it anything to be alarmed over ? Not at this time . " ... Marlins OF Chris Coghlan underwent surgery on his left knee Wednesday . He 'll begin rehabbing it immediately . column1: PHILADELPHIA -- Roy Oswalt got an extra boost from the sellout crowd
column2: and then gave them more reason to cheer in his home debut . 	 Oswalt pitched seven impressive innings
column3: two relievers finished off the six - hitter and the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Los Angeles Dodgers 2 - 0 on Wednesday night . 	 The two - time NL champions are 15 - 4 since July 22
column4: but lost another player when Ross Gload left with a strained right groin . 	 Oswalt ( 7 - 13 ) allowed five hits
column5: walked two and struck out five . Relying on a powerful fastball and sharp curve
column6: he mowed down the Dodgers to earn his first win in his third start for the Phillies . 	 The three - time All - Star right - hander
column7: acquired from Houston before the non - waiver trade deadline
column8: pitched twice on the road before putting on the red pinstripes for the first time . 	 " There 's a lot more adrenaline than when your pitching in front of 15
column9: 000 fans trying to get to the end of the season
column10: " Oswalt said . " I do n't get caught up looking around
column11: but you can hear it 's a lot louder . " 	 Dodgers starter Clay Billingsley ( 9 - 7 ) gave up two runs and five hits in six innings . 	 After Oswalt blew a 95 mph fastball past pinch - hitter Matt Kemp on his 109th and final pitch
column12: manager Charlie Manuel turned to his bullpen . 	 Ryan Madson worked around a leadoff double in the eighth
column13: striking out two batters . Brad Lidge pitched a perfect ninth for his 15th save in 19 chances . Lidge saved a bunch of Oswalt 's wins during their days together with the Astros . 	 " It 's great to be pitching behind him again
column14: " Lidge said . " It 's just like old times . " 	 The injury - depleted Phillies already were missing All - Stars Ryan Howard and Chase Utley and Shane Victorino before Gload got hurt running out a double in the sixth . The backup first baseman will be evaluated on Thursday . 	 Oswalt has received the lowest run support of any starter in the majors this year . It was 2.48 runs per game coming in . He did n't need much this time . 	 " He had all his stuff working and did n't give us a chance to get him on the ropes
column15: " Dodgers manager Joe Torre said . 	 The Phillies took a 1 - 0 lead in the fourth when Billingsley struggled with his control . Placido Polanco led off with a single . Gload followed with a sinking liner to left
column16: but Jay Gibbons made a diving catch to rob him . 	 Billingsley then walked Raul Ibanez and Jayson Werth to load the bases . Polanco scored on Domonic Brown 's grounder . 	 " You could tell from the beginning he was going to throw a good game
column17: " Billingsley said of Oswalt . " You ca n't make mistakes in these kind of games . " 	 Ibanez made it 2 - 0 with an RBI double in the sixth . Gload led off with a double
column18: limping to the bag after getting hurt . Ibanez hit a drive to the gap in left - center to knock in pinch - runner Mike Sweeney . 	 Philadelphia wasted a leadoff triple by Wilson Valdez in the fifth . Oswalt and Jimmy Rollins grounded out to drawn - in infielders and Polanco flied out . column19: six weeks after surgery on his right thumb . Assistant GM Scott Proefrock said the team plans to stick with its original timetable of eight weeks for Utley 's return

column23: 2009 . It 's the longest streak in the majors . ... Victorino was 3 for 4 with a triple and homer in a rehab start at Triple - A Lehigh Valley . He 's eligible to return on Thursday . column1: TORONTO -- Clay Buchholz did n't want to set any goals for himself at the start of the season . Even if he had
column2: the Red Sox right - hander never could have imagined pitching quite this well . 	 Bill Hall hit two home runs

column4: routing the Blue Jays 10 - 1 Wednesday night . 	 " His stuff was tremendous

column1: NEW YORK -- The New York Mets ' discouraging season took an ugly turn when closer Francisco Rodriguez wound up in police custody
column2: charged with third - degree assault for a post - game scuffle with a family member at Citi Field . 	 Police say Rodriguez 's father - in - law is in the hospital with a scrape on his face and a bump on his head . 	 The altercation occurred after the Mets ' 6 - 2 loss to the Colorado Rockies on Wednesday night
column3: police and the Mets said . 	 Rodriguez did not pitch in the game . The scuffle came shortly after Melvin Mora kept what 's left of Colorado 's postseason hopes alive with a go - ahead grand slam that turned around the game and -- possibly- the Rockies season . 	 Rockies manager Jim Tracy said that if the Rockies wind up in the middle of a playoff race
column4: Mora 's slam may turn out to have been an inflection point . Colorado was seven games out of first and 4&frac12 out of the wild card before San Diego and San Francisco played later . 	 The Mets probably no longer have any illusions . The night got off to a promising start when Angel Pagan hit a two - run homer in the first and Jonathon Niese hung on to the early lead through seven strong innings
column5: but it all came undone in the eighth . 	 " I 'm not having much fun right now
column7: who struck out four times . " It 's tough . " 	 With two outs in the eighth
column8: Hisanori Takahashi ( 7 - 6 ) gave up a single to Todd Helton and walked Carlos Gonzalez
column9: prompting manager Jerry Manuel to call on Manny Acosta . Acosta 's first offering was a wild pitch that let the runners advance
column10: and Troy Tulowitzki was intentionally walked . 	 " I 've been in this situation many years
column11: and I know the pressure is n't on me
column13: " Mora said . " I love that pressure
column14: and I love that situation . " 	 Mora 's slam to left -- the Mets lead the majors having given up nine this season -- had barely landed when fans got up and started to leave . Those who stayed booed and some tried to start a feeble " Fire Jerry ! " chant aimed at manager Jerry Manuel . 	 " They are obviously frustrated
column16: " Wright said . " The fans have every right to voice their opinion . " 	 Acosta followed the homer with a walk and two singles
column17: the last one a dying quail by Clint Barmes that landed in shallow left field to score one more run and bring Manuel out just as the chants started up again . 	 " That 's part of it
column18: " Manuel said . " When you make decisions and they do n't work out
column19: New York will let you know . " 	 Rockies starter Jeff Francis allowed two runs and three hits in six innings . He struck out five and walked one . 	 Matt Belisle ( 5 - 4 ) struck out the side in the seventh
column20: part of a string of seven straight Mets who whiffed . Rafael Betancourt and Huston Street followed with a perfect inning each . 	 The Mets had three hits and did n't get a baserunner after the fifth . 	 Pagan 's first - inning shot was a no - doubt drive to left field after Jose Reyes led off the inning with a bunt single . 	 Niese gave up one run in seven innings
column21: striking out seven without a walk . He has allowed one run in three of his last four starts . 	 After Niese started the seventh inning with two singles
column22: he gave up a sacrifice fly before retiring Barmes on a popup to second baseman Luis Castillo in shallow right field . 	 Though they were n't really in contention
column24: the Mets were showing signs of life . They beat Colorado and ace Ubaldo Jimenez 1 - 0 Tuesday night and were poised to win consecutive games for the first time since June 22 - 23 . Instead
column25: they ended their evening in a hail of jeers . 	 " This is rough
column26: " Niese said . " It 's tough to watch . " 	 Game notes 	  The homer was Mora 's third of the season . ... After Wright 's third K
column27: he hit the bench twice with his bat
column28: taking two one - handed whacks before throwing it aside . ... Following Pagan 's homer
column29: Francis did n't allow another hit until Henry Blanco led off the fifth with a single . ... Jeff Francoeur lost his grip on the bat swinging at a third strike in the bottom of the seventh
column30: sending the bat halfway to shortstop . ... Rockies pitcher Esmil Rogers pinch - ran in the eighth . ... Colorado has n't won a series at the Mets since taking 2 of 3 in May 2002 . 	 Information from The Associated Press was used in this report . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column2: Texas -- Once Marcus Thames finally put the New York Yankees ahead
column3: there was no way Mariano Rivera was going to have a repeat performance . 	 One loss in Texas was enough for the longtime Yankees closer . 	 Thames hit a long homer in the eighth inning
column4: then had the go - ahead RBI single in the ninth as New York rallied from five runs down to beat the Rangers 7 - 6 on Wednesday night for a split in the two - game series between the division leaders . 	 A night after losing in Texas for the only time in his first 32 career appearances over 16 seasons
column5: Rivera gave up a leadoff triple to Elvis Andrus in the ninth before retiring the Nos . 2 - 4 hitters
column6: including Josh Hamilton on a comebacker after the majors ' leading hitter already had three hits . 	 " That 's Mo
column7: right through the heart of their order
column9: " manager Joe Girardi said . " I was thinking we 're in trouble here
column10: but if anyone can do it
column11: Mo can . " 	 After Andrus ' liner into the right - center gap
column12: Michael Young had a short fly ball to right
column13: where Austin Kearns made a shoestring grab . Hamilton and Vladimir Guerrero hit grounders to give Rivera his 24th save in 26 chances . 	 Asked what was going through his mind after the leadoff triple
column15: " Nothing . I 'm trying to get the next guy out and go from there . " 	 What about after Kearns ' catch ? 	 " I 'm thinking
column16: ' Oh
column17: my God . We have to win now
column18: " he said . " I 've got Hamilton next
column19: who I 've seen before
column20: so I made my pitches . " 	 The Yankees ( 70 - 43 )
column21: who have the best record in the majors and a 1-game lead over Tampa Bay in the AL East
column22: matched their biggest comeback of the season despite tying a franchise record with 17 strikeouts . Their other 17 - K games were in 1901 and 1999 . 	 Thames drove in the go - ahead run on a rolling single between shortstop and third base after Derek Jeter had tied the game with a chopper past a drawn - in infield
column23: an RBI single off Rangers rookie All - Star closer Neftali Feliz ( 3 - 3 ) . 	 " The whole game
column24: we were where we wanted to be . We just could n't stop them from the sixth inning on
column25: " Rangers manager Ron Washington said . " We got their closer last night . They got ours tonight . " 	 Feliz
column26: in his first save chance since July 31 after converting 20 in a row
column27: walked the leadoff batter in the ninth
column28: gave up a single to No . 9 hitter Brett Gardner and threw a wild pitch before Jeter 's tying hit . Nick Swisher struck out for the fourth time before Alexi Ogando came on and gave up the single to Thames . 	 Thames led off the eighth by pulling a 410 - foot shot down the left - field line off Frank Francisco to get New York within 6 - 5 . 	 Kerry Wood ( 2 - 4 ) threw two scoreless innings for his first decision in five appearances since New York acquired him from Cleveland on July 31 . 	 Texas ( 65 - 48 ) still has a 7-game lead over the Los Angeles Angels in the AL West
column29: by far the largest lead in any of baseball 's six divisions . 	 Rangers starter Cliff Lee struck out 11 with no walks in 6 1/3 innings
column30: matching his shortest outing of the season and ending his streak of 10 consecutive starts going at least eight innings . He gave up four runs . 	 But Young homered while David Murphy and Mitch Moreland had two - run singles for Texas
column31: which had scored only 2.28 runs a game for Lee in his first six starts since being traded to the Rangers instead of New York on July 9 . 	 Lee already had seven strikeouts by the end of the fifth
column32: five on called third strikes . He struck out Swisher
column33: Thames and Alex Rodriguez in order in the sixth after Jeter had a leadoff triple and scored on a wild pitch to make it 6 - 2 . 	 But after Lance Berkman had an RBI double and Gardner an RBI single in the seventh for a 6 - 4 score with two runners still on base
column34: Lee was done . Submarine - throwing Darren O'Day struck out Jeter before Darren Oliver struck out Swisher to end the threat . 	 " I started missing my spots a little bit
column36: who still threw 76 of 106 pitches for strikes . " I felt like I was running out of gas . " 	 Yankees starter Javier Vazquez gave up six runs and eight hits over 4 1/3 innings and was chased by Murphy 's two - run single that made it 6 - 1 . 	 Murphy has hit .423 ( 11 - for-26 ) with 11 RBIs in a seven - game hitting streak . He had a two - run homer Tuesday before his game - winning single with the bases loaded in the 10th off Rivera . 	 Game notes 	  Lee has 137 strikeouts and only nine walks in 161 1/3 innings this season . ... Yankees 1B Mark Teixeira is expected to rejoin the team Thursday in Kansas City after missing the two games in Texas for the birth of his third child . ... In the crowd of 48
column37: 676 was former President George W. Bush and his wife
column38: Laura

column1: CHICAGO -- Ozzie Guillen was afraid he would wake up to a panicking city had the Chicago White Sox lost this one . Well
column2: he can rest easier . 	 John Danks pitched eight sharp innings and the White Sox beat Minnesota 6 - 1 on Wednesday night to move back into a first - place tie with the Twins in the AL Central . 	 Carlos Quentin homered in his second straight game while helping the White Sox draw even again after being knocked out of first place for the first time since July 10 with a 12 - 6 loss to the Twins on Tuesday . 	 They fared better this time after dropping four of five
column3: with a rare victory over a team that had won 18 of 23 against them . 	 " It 's great for us because all of a sudden
column4: I did n't want to wake up tomorrow morning and [ there ] be people in Chicago panicking about it
column5: " Guillen said . 	 Danks ( 12 - 8) allowed one run and six hits . Quentin hit a two - run shot in the second off Glen Perkins ( 0 - 1 ) that made it 2 - 0
column6: and the White Sox continued to pile on from there
column7: taking advantage of two throwing errors that helped set up runs on their way to an easy win . 	 Alex Rios singled in a run in the third
column8: and the White Sox broke it open with three more in the fifth on an RBI single by Juan Pierre
column9: an RBI double by Alexei Ramirez and a throwing error by shortstop J.J. Hardy . 	 That was enough for Danks
column10: who kept the Twins in check after they got five homers from five different players in a game for the first time since May 2
column11: 1992 . He is 5 - 1 in his last seven starts . 	 " I hate pitching against this team
column12: I 'm not going to lie to you
column14: who is 6 - 6 lifetime with a 5.01 ERA against Minnesota . 	 The Twins got two hits apiece from Michael Cuddyer and Joe Mauer
column15: who has 27 in his last 50 at - bats after going 2 for 4 . Otherwise
column16: it was a painful night for Minnesota . 	 Perkins got knocked out in the fifth in his first start since Aug. 2
column18: and the injuries piled up for the Twins . 	 Hardy got lifted for a pinch - hitter in the top of the seventh after experiencing pain in his left wrist
column19: the same one that has sent him to the disabled list twice this season . And reliever Jose Mijares injured his left knee in the eighth . He expects to have an MRI on Thursday or Friday
column20: and manager Ron Gardenhire said he will probably go on the disabled list . 	 Mijares had just come in to start the eighth when he landed awkwardly covering the bag on Quentin 's leadoff single to first . 	 He raced over and pulled up as first baseman Cuddyer dived for the base . The pitcher fell to the ground
column21: clutching his knee
column22: stayed down for a few minutes and then jogged toward the outfield and back before being removed . 	 For Perkins
column23: it was simply a rough night . Called up from Triple - A with Kevin Slowey nursing a sore elbow
column24: he lasted just 4 2/3 innings and allowed five hits and six runs while hitting Quentin twice . 	 " We made a lot of mistakes and it cost us a lot of runs
column25: " Gardenhire said . 	 Things got particularly ugly in the fifth
column26: when Pierre singled in Omar Vizquel after fouling a squeeze off Mauer 's left leg . Ramirez followed with an RBI double off the left - field wall and came around with two outs when Hardy bounced a throw to first after fielding Paul Konerko 's grounder
column27: making it 6 - 0 . 	 Perkins then hit Quentin for the second time
column28: leading to a warning from plate umpire Mike DiMuro and the hook from Gardenhire . He brought in Ron Mahay
column29: who retired A.J. Pierzynski on a grounder to short to end the inning . 	 " It 's unfortunate that happened
column30: " Perkins said . " I was trying to make a pitch and yanked it a little bit . I definitely did n't hit every spot tonight and that was one of the times I did n't hit the spot I was trying to throw . " 	 Guillen said if Quentin was hit purposely
column31: the order was n't coming from the Twins ' bench . 	 " I 'm not 100 percent he did it [ on purpose ]
column32: " Guillen said . " I know 100 percent it did not come from the bench . I can guarantee you that . " 	 Game notes 	  2B Gordon Beckham was back in the White Sox 's lineup after missing two games with a strained right groin . ... Chicago 's RF Andruw Jones was scratched because of a sore back . ... Hardy does n't expect to miss much time . ... Gardenhire said after the game that reliever Jon Rauch is day to day after spraining a toe on Tuesday . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column33: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: MILWAUKEE -- Arizona Diamondbacks manager Kirk Gibson was in awe of his team 's power display . 	 The Diamondbacks tied a major league record by hitting four consecutive home runs
column4: Mark Reynolds and Stephen Drew connecting in the fourth inning Wednesday night to beat the Milwaukee Brewers 8 - 2 . 	 The Diamondbacks became just the seventh team in history to accomplish the feat . 	 " I do n't know what to tell you about that
column5: " Gibson said . " It was a freak thing . I was happy to be part of it . " 	 Arizona nearly made it five home runs in the inning
column6: but Chris Young flied out to deep center field . 	 Milwaukee starter Dave Bush took a 2 - 0 lead into the fourth and retired Justin Upton on a fly ball to start the inning . 	 LaRoche then hit his 19th home run into the Diamondbacks ' bullpen and Montero followed with a shot into the second deck in right field . 	 Reynolds was next with his 26th home run to left and Drew capped the run with his seventh home run to right . 	 " I did n't even swing very hard at it
column7: " Reynolds said . " I just put the barrel on it . " 	 Drew said he was also not necessarily going for the fourth straight home run . 	 " It 's pretty special
column8: " he said . " You do n't see that too often . It 's one of those things that was meant to be and it was a special time . " 	 Bush is the first pitcher in the majors to give up four straight home runs since the New York Yankees ' Chase Wright did it against the Boston Red Sox on April 22
column9: 2007 . Wright now pitches for the Brewers ' Triple - A team in Nashville . 	 Daniel Hudson ( 3 - 0 ) got the win as he continued his strong pitching for Arizona since the Diamondbacks acquired him and pitching prospect David Holmberg from the Chicago White Sox in a deal for starter Edwin Jackson on July 30 . 	 Hudson pitched seven innings
column10: giving up two runs and seven hits . He has given up four runs in his three starts for Arizona . 	 Hudson helped himself in the sixth inning as he ripped a bases - loaded double to increase Arizona 's lead to 7 - 2 . He said he was glad to benefit from the Diamondbacks ' home run outburst after giving up back - to - back home runs to the Brewers in the second inning . 	 " I like it when guys pick me up
column11: especially after a rough inning like the second inning
column12: " he said . " 	 Bush ( 5 - 10 ) took the loss for the Brewers
column13: who lost for the third straight time against Arizona . He gave up seven runs in 5 1/3 innings . 	 Bush said he was n't exactly sure what happened in the fourth inning . 	 " I 'm going to assume I lost a little location
column14: " he said . " There was n't anything that changed other than that little bit of a rut there . It was frustrating for sure . " 	 Brewers manager Ken Macha said Bush may have had trouble locating his pitches . 	 " He was pitching along ok
column16: bang
column17: bang
column18: " Macha said . " I think they were all mislocated pitches
column19: right down the middle . " 	 The Brewers continued to struggle at the plate
column20: despite the return of All - Star outfielder Corey Hart to the lineup . Hart had missed the past two games with a sore back . He went 0 - for-3 with a walk . Brewers ' All - Star left fielder Ryan Braun did not start his third straight game with a bruised wrist . He pinch - hit in the eighth inning and struck out . 	 Prince Fielder hit his 25th home run of the season in the second inning . It was Fielder 's first home run since July 22 against the Pittsburgh Pirates . Casey McGehee hit the next pitch for his 15th home run to give the Brewers a 2 - 0 lead . 	 Game notes 	  Brewers center fielder Carlos Gomez will begin a minor league rehab assignment Friday at Triple - A Nashville . Gomez has not played since he was struck in the head by a pitch Aug. 2 in Chicago . ... Diamondbacks closer Juan Gutierrez threw a bullpen session Wednesday . He has been on the disabled list since Aug. 3 with right shoulder inflammation . ... Fielder played in his team record 300th consecutive game Wednesday . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
