column1: SAN DIEGO -- Kevin Correia is starting to regain the form that made him the most consistent starter for the San Diego Padres last year . 	 Correia took a one - hit shutout into the seventh inning and Jerry Hairston Jr. hit a two - run home run to lead the San Diego Padres to an 8 - 5 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday night . 	 " That was as well as he 's pitched all year
column2: " manager Bud Black said . 	 Correia faced the minimum through 6 1/3 innings before the Pirates chased him during a four - run rally in the seventh . Correia ( 9 - 7 ) won for the fourth time in five decisions . 	 " That 's as good as I 've felt
column3: " Correia said . " In the last month or so
column4: I 've felt pretty good but I just did n't really have everything working
column5: and then tonight I had the offspeed pitches to go with the fastball command . I felt pretty confident out there and in control of the game . " 	 Correia got Andrew McCutchen to fly out to left to open the seventh before allowing three straight singles to load the bases . He walked Pedro Alvarez to force in a run
column6: prompting Black to bring in Ernesto Frieri . Frieri allowed Ryan Doumit 's two - run double over Chris Denorfia 's head and off the center - field fence . Chris Snyder 's groundout brought in another run . 	 Correia struck out the side in the third and sixth innings
column7: finishing with seven punchouts and one walk . He allowed four singles . 	 " Overall he threw the ball very well
column8: " Black said . 	 All - Star Adrian Gonzalez went 4 - for-4 with a walk
column9: drove in two runs and scored twice . Miguel Tejada scored three runs for the Padres
column10: who beat the Pirates for the fifth straight time this season . The West - leading Padres ( 66 - 46 ) have the best record in the National League
column11: while the Pirates ( 39 - 74 ) have the worst . San Diego remained 2 1/2 games ahead of San Francisco
column12: which beat Chicago . The Padres are 20 games over .500 for the third time this season . 	 Heath Bell pitched a perfect ninth for his 33rd save in 36th chances and his 20th straight since May 29 . 	 Pittsburgh starter James McDonald ( 1 - 2 ) was gone after allowing four runs and seven hits in 4 2/3 innings . He struck out six and walked one . 	 " He threw OK
column13: " manager John Russell said . " He had some deep counts
column14: got ahead of some guys but really had trouble putting them away . " 	 McDonald threw a career - high 107 pitches . 	 " I had good stuff
column16: but I got too many three - ball counts after being ahead in the count 0 - 2 and 1 - 2
column17: " McDonald said . " I have to be more aggressive in putting the batters away earlier in the count . " 	 Pittsburgh scored an unearned run in the eighth to pull to 7 - 5 before the Padres scored another run in the bottom of the inning . 	 The Padres scored three runs in both the fifth and sixth innings . Pirates reliever Chan Ho Park allowed Hairston 's two - run homer and Gonzalez 's RBI double
column18: both with one out in the sixth
column19: giving the Padres a 7 - 0 lead . It was Hairston 's 10th
column20: tying his career high set last year while with Cincinnati and the New York Yankees . 	 The Padres had six straight batters reach base with two outs in the fifth
column21: scoring three runs to take a 4 - 0 lead . After Hairston and Tejada singled
column22: Gonzalez hit an RBI single to center and Ryan Ludwick hit an RBI double to center . Chase Headley walked to load the bases and Yorvit Torrealba walked to bring in Gonzalez . 	 Leading off the fourth
column23: Gonzalez bunted for a single to counter the shift opponents often put on against the left - handed slugger and took second on McDonald 's throwing error . Gonzalez advanced on Ludwick 's fly out and scored on McDonald 's wild pitch
column24: which bounced in the dirt and went over the screen into the stands . 	 " You 've just got to pick the right spots
column25: " Gonzalez said . " Leading off an inning I felt was a good time to do it
column26: if I got the right pitch for it
column27: and I did . " 	 Black felt the bunt gave the Padres a lift . 	 " As small as it was
column28: I thought it was a big part of the game
column29: " Black said . 	 " Next time I will know to eat the ball
column30: " McDonald said . 	 Game notes 	  Black said 2B David Eckstein is doing better but there 's no timetable for his return from a strained right calf that 's had him on the DL since July 21 . ... Jerry Moss
column31: owner of the undefeated mare Zenyatta

column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Pat Burrell is back in the National League
column2: back in a pennant race and back to being his old productive self . 	 Burrell hit a go - ahead solo homer in the eighth inning after an earlier two - run single
column3: Aaron Rowand also homered and the San Francisco Giants beat the Chicago Cubs 5 - 4 on Wednesday night . 	 " He wants it really bad . That 's what we need right now
column4: guys stepping up and having that hunger
column5: " pitcher Barry Zito said . " Every game is huge . " 	 Burrell also made a perfect relay throw from left field that saved an early run for the Giants
column6: who finish this series Wednesday before a weekend showdown with the first - place San Diego Padres . 	 San Francisco remained 2 games behind San Diego in the NL West after the Padres beat Pittsburgh . 	 " This is what you play for
column7: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " You talk about this in spring training . You want to be in it . We have n't accomplished anything yet . " 	 Rowand 's 10th homer of the year
column9: gave him seven straight seasons with double - digit home runs . 	 Burrell has been quite an addition since joining the Giants on June 4 . Over his last 15 games
column10: he is batting .356 with 10 of his 16 hits going for extra bases . That includes three home runs . His eighth homer of the year leading off the eighth came off Justin Berg ( 0 - 1 ) . 	 Burrell
column12: feels rejuvenated with the Giants after a disappointing start with Tampa Bay . 	 " Getting the opportunity to come here
column15: " he said . " And then to be able to contribute and get back into a pennant race
column16: I really could n't ask for anything more than that
column17: so I 'm more than excited to be here and hopefully we can continue to roll . " 	 Sergio Romo ( 5 - 3 ) recorded five outs for the win
column18: while All - Star closer Brian Wilson pitched the ninth for his 33rd save in 36 opportunities . Wilson and San Diego 's Heath Bell share the major league lead in saves . 	 Marlon Byrd and Tyler Colvin each hit solo homers for the Cubs
column19: with Colvin 's seventh - inning drive tying the game . 	 " That was an embarrassment for me to give up the home run and give up the lead
column20: " Zito said . 	 Chicago 's Blake DeWitt cut his upper lip when he crashed into Giants catcher Buster Posey in the second on the play started by Burrell on Welington Castillo 's double . Castillo got a hit in his major league debut and first at - bat . 	 " We 've played two games that were clean and we lost
column21: " said acting Cubs manager Alan Trammell
column22: filling in while Lou Piniella is helping his ailing mother in Tampa
column23: Fla. " Burrell was a big thorn in our side on some bad execution of pitches . Those are some of the growing pains hopefully we learn from . " 	 Zito gave up a season - high 10 hits in 6 1/3 innings . His winless stretch extended to five straight starts despite being staked to a 3 - 1 lead . The lefty has only one win in 11 starts since June 12
column24: going 1 - 4 during that stretch with six no - decisions
column25: including three straight . 	 This game marked only the third time during the stretch that the Giants backed the 2002 AL Cy Young Award winner with more than three runs . 	 Chicago starter Tom Gorzelanny allowed eight hits and four runs over six innings . He struck five but left with a no - decision for the second time in three winless starts following a season - high four - start winning streak . 	 The Cubs scratched third baseman Aramis Ramirez about an hour before the first pitch with a sore left rib cage . Jeff Baker started in his place . 	 The Giants acquired infielder Mike Fontenot from the Cubs before the game
column26: so all Fontenot had to do was walk between the two clubhouses and switch uniforms . He was available off the bench for San Francisco . 	 Game notes 	  Giants OF Andres Torres stole third for the sixth time this year
column27: most in the NL . ... Chicago announced that LHP reliever John Grabow is done for the season . Already on the DL since June 29 with a sprained left knee
column28: the pitcher tore the medial collateral ligament while on a rehab assignment in the Arizona League . He is scheduled to meet Monday with the team orthopedist in Chicago to discuss his options
column29: and surgery is possible . The hope is that Grabow will be ready for the start of spring training 2011 . He was 1 - 3 with a 7.36 ERA in 28 appearances this year . ... The Giants activated INF Eugenio Velez from the DL and optioned him to Triple - A Fresno . Velez was struck on the head July 25 by a foul ball while in the dugout against Arizona . ... The Cubs still do n't know how long 1B Derrek Lee will stay on the bereavement list . He has been spending time with his ill grandfather in his native Sacramento and ca n't play before Friday . column1: NEW YORK -- Johan Santana saw Jerry Manuel before taking the mound against the Colorado Rockies . 	 " Do n't come out there today . Leave me alone
column2: " the New York Mets ace told his manager . 	 " I sure would love to
column4: " because they do n't want to see me out there anyway . " 	 Santana made a closer unnecessary
column5: a good thing for New York because Francisco Rodriguez was n't available . After Rodriguez was arrested on a charge of assaulting his girlfriend 's father at Citi Field
column6: Santana pitched a four - hit shutout in a 4 - 0 victory Thursday . 	 " Right before the game
column7: I told Jerry I was ready for 10 innings . " Santana said . " So that was my mind - set . " 	 Just before the game began
column8: the Mets suspended Rodriguez for two days without pay
column9: a move that if not reversed would cost him $ 125
column10: 683 of his $ 11.5 million salary . Manuel said the decision was made without his input . 	 Rodriguez was charged with third - degree assault and second - degree harrassment after Wednesday night 's game
column11: police said . His girlfriend 's father -- identified by authorities as 53 - year - old Carlos Pena -- was in a hospital with a scraped face and bump on his head following the confrontation at a Citi Field family lounge . 	 Santana has his own legal troubles . A Florida woman who accused him of sexual assault sued the Mets ace in Lee County
column13: after authorities declined to prosecute the case . Santana said after the game he had no additional comments . 	 Against the Rockies
column14: Santana ( 10 - 6 ) won for the second time in four starts and boosted the Mets back to .500 at 57 - 57 with only their second series win since June 27 . Using a nasty changeup
column15: he struck out 10 and walked two -- striking out the side in the first . 	 In a rare quick game that took just 2 hours
column16: 18 minutes
column17: Santana needed 115 pitches for his 49th double - digit strikeout game

column19: and he improved to 5 - 1 with a 1.88 ERA in his last nine starts . 	 " We did n't hit many balls hard

column25: losing for the fourth time in five decisions . Troy Tulowitzki had two of Colorado 's hits . 	 " Any time you pitch against Johan
column26: you know there 's a small margin for error
column27: " Hammel said . " Basically
column28: he did his Johan thing . " 	 Jose Reyes sparked the Mets in the first when he singled
column29: stole second and scored on a single by Angel Pagan
column30: who came around on Ike Davis ' double and Beltran 's sacrifice fly . Santana tilted his bat as if to bunt but then pulled it back and had a hit - and - run single that put runners at the corners . Reyes singled for a 3 - 0 lead

column33: he knew he would have to go it alone . 	 Game notes 	  The Mets filled Rodriguez 's roster spot by recalling right - hander Ryota Igarashi from Triple - A Buffalo . He took a taxi from Scranton

column1: TORONTO -- Jonathan Papelbon 's streak of perfection against the Toronto Blue Jays came to a costly end for the Boston Red Sox . 	 Fred Lewis ' sacrifice fly capped a four - run rally in the ninth inning and lifted Toronto to a 6 - 5 victory over Boston on Thursday
column2: just the Blue Jays ' third win in 12 games against the Red Sox this season . 	 " He 's always shut the door on us
column5: said of Papelbon . " It 's nice to get a guy like that . " 	 The blown save
column6: Papelbon 's first in 25 career chances against Toronto
column7: denied the Boston right - hander his 30th save . He needs one more to become the first pitcher ever to begin his career with five straight 30 - save seasons . 	 Trailing 5 - 2
column8: Toronto 's Jose Bautista chased starter John Lackey by leading off the ninth with his major league - leading 36th homer . 	 " Once again
column10: " Blue Jays manager Cito Gaston said . " He got us going . " 	 Papelbon ( 4 - 5 ) came on and blew his sixth save of the season . 	 " It seemed like every one of my pitches today was up in the zone
column11: " Papelbon said . " In a pressure situation
column13: that ca n't happen . " 	 Papelbon said he felt " groggy " all afternoon
column14: both in the bullpen and on the mound . 	 " I did n't have much power or energy in my delivery today
column15: " Papelbon said . 	 Vernon Wells greeted Papelbon with a double and scored when Adam Lind lined a single up the middle . Pinch - runner Dewayne Wise stole second and moved to third when Hill singled off Papelbon 's left foot . 	 " It seemed like it hurt a little bit
column16: " catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia said . " He needed a second . " 	 Papelbon stayed in the game and struck out Travis Snider
column17: but Encarnacion tied it with a double down the line in left . Pinch - hitter Lyle Overbay was walked intentionally to load the bases for Lewis
column18: who hit a fly ball to shallow center off Daniel Bard . Hill tagged up and slid home well ahead of the throw from Jacoby Ellsbury . 	 " It was down and in
column19: " Bard said of his pitch to Lewis . " He probably grounds it out half the time . It was definitely where I wanted it . He did a good job getting under it . " 	 Kevin Gregg ( 1 - 4 ) pitched one inning for the win . 	 The Red Sox
column20: who are second in the American League wild - card race
column21: open a three - game series at Texas on Friday and will have to put the defeat behind them quickly . 	 " Whether we can or not
column23: " infielder Jed Lowrie said . " We do n't have a choice at this point . " 	 David Ortiz and Lowrie hit solo homers for the Red Sox
column24: who had won 10 of their previous 11 at Toronto . 	 Lackey came in having allowed 13 earned runs in 10 2/3 innings over two starts against the Blue Jays this year but was better in this one
column25: allowing three runs and eight hits in eight - plus innings . He walked one and struck out four . 	 Lackey had thrown only 98 pitches when manager Terry Francona came out to replace him but was n't about to question the decision to got to Papelbon . 	 " I still felt pretty strong but we 've got a great closer so it 's tough to argue
column26: " Lackey said . 	 Lowrie and Ortiz both hit solo shots in the fifth
column27: giving Boston eight homers in the series and 155 this season . Only Toronto ( 179 ) has hit more . 	 Ortiz 's homer was his 25th of the season
column28: the seventh time in his Red Sox career he 's reached the plateau . Only Ted Williams ( 14 ) and Jim Rice ( seven ) have had as many 25 - homer seasons with Boston . 	 Lowrie 's homer was his first of the season and first since a grand slam against the Cleveland Indians last Oct. 4
column29: the final game of the 2009 regular season . 	 The Red Sox opened the scoring with two in the third when Victor Martinez hit a sacrifice fly and Ortiz followed with an RBI single . 	 Toronto cut the deficit in half in the fourth when Bautista scored on Lind 's double play grounder . 	 Lowrie led off the fifth with a drive to center . One out later
column30: Ortiz lined a 3 - 2 pitch over the wall in right . 	 Toronto pulled to 4 - 2 in the sixth on another double play
column31: with Lewis scoring on Bautista 's grounder
column32: but the Red Sox pushed the lead back to three on Darnell McDonald 's RBI triple against Scott Downs in the eighth . 	 Blue Jays left - hander Brad Mills allowed four runs and seven hits in 4 1/3 innings . He walked two and struck out a season - high seven . 	 Mills was optioned back to Triple - A Las Vegas after the game
column33: with lefty Marc Rezepczynski coming up from Las Vegas to start Friday against the Los Angeles Angels . 	 Game notes 	  Blue Jays left - hander David Purcey injured his right foot making a play at first base in the sixth and will be evaluated again Friday in Los Angeles . ... Overbay was held out of the lineup with Lind starting at first base . ... Boston shortstop Marco Scutaro got the day off
column34: with Lowrie starting in his place . ... Francona said left - hander Hideki Okajima ( right hamstring ) threw at 120 feet on flat ground Wednesday . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column35: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: MILWAUKEE -- Casey McGehee is too busy getting hits to count how many he 's gotten . 	 McGehee set a franchise record with his ninth straight hit
column2: going 4 - for-4 and leading the Milwaukee Brewers to an 8 - 4 victory Thursday over the Arizona Diamondbacks . 	 McGehee had a solo homer
column4: an RBI single and another single . His seventh - inning single off reliever D.J. Carrasco broke the team mark set by Ryan Braun in 2008 . 	 " It 's definitely neat
column5: " McGehee said . " I was n't aware of that I had eight in a row until Braunie made a comment to me
column6: ' Eight in a row is pretty good . ' " 	 McGehee started his 9 - for-9 performance Tuesday night with a double in his last at - bat . He tied his career high with four hits Wednesday night
column7: including a home run . 	 The major league record for consecutive hits is 12
column8: set by Pinky Higgins in 1938 and matched by Walt Dropo in 1952 . 	 " He 's hot
column9: " Arizona manager Kirk Gibson said . " We could n't get around him today . He jumped us on several first pitches in this series
column11: you 've just got to tip your hat . He 's hot . " 	 McGehee scored three times and helped the Brewers avoid a four - game sweep . Milwaukee scored three times in the first inning
column12: three more in the second and McGehee hit a first - pitch fastball from Rodrigo Lopez ( 5 - 11 ) for his 18th home run in the fifth . 	 Gametime temperature was 87 degrees
column13: but it felt hotter on the field . 	 " You just ca n't stop sweating
column14: " Randy Wolf said after winning consecutive games for the first time this season . He allowed four runs on seven hits
column15: walked four and struck out eight in his 25th start . 	 " It 's difficult to grip the ball when you 're sweating that much
column16: " he said . 	 Working with a six - run cushion
column17: Wolf ( 9 - 9 ) faced 10 batters in the fourth as the Diamondbacks scored four times
column18: highlighted by Stephen Drew 's three - run homer . 	 Adam LaRoche singled
column19: Mark Reynolds doubled
column20: Rusty Ryal hit an RBI single and Drew followed with this eighth home run . Two walks sandwiched around Chris Young 's single loaded the bases
column21: but Wolf got the third out he needed to escape the jam . 	 " I gave up four
column22: " Wolf said . " I could have easily given up a lot more than that . " 	 The Brewers took a 3 - 0 lead in the first on three hits
column23: two walks and a passed ball . McGehee 's single drove in the first run . 	 " The weather did n't help me at all
column24: " Lopez said . " I ran out of gas trying to work my way out " of the first inning . 	 Lopez allowed seven runs on seven hits over five innings for the Diamondbacks who were trying to sweep Milwaukee for the first time since they came into existence in 1998 . 	 Milwaukee tacked on three more in the second on a walk
column25: a double by McGehee and a two - run single by Craig Counsell . 	 Reliever Zach Braddock began the eighth trying to protect an 8 - 4 lead but walked three to load the bases with one out . He gave way to closer John Axford
column26: who retired Young on a fly ball and struck out pinch - hitter Kelly Johnson . 	 Axford also pitched the ninth
column27: holding on for his 17th save in 19 chances . He struck out Justin Upton to start the inning
column28: but then heard plenty of boos when he walked LaRoche
column29: Reynolds and Ryal . Drew hit into a double play to end the game . 	 Brewers manager Ken Macha said Axford was one more walk away from bringing in Trevor Hoffman . 	 Game notes 	  Braun returned after missing three games with a left wrist strain and contusion . He went 0 - for-5 . ... Lopez leads the NL in home runs allowed with 28 while Wolf is second with 24 . Lopez is first in the majors in runs allowed with 98 while Wolf is second in the NL with 90 . ... Milwaukee slugger Prince Fielder walked and scored three times . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Pinch - hitter Andres Torres hit a bases - loaded single in the bottom of the ninth inning to send the San Francisco Giants into a weekend showdown against San Diego on a high note following an 8 - 7 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Thursday . 	 Pat Burrell hit a grand slam and solo home run and Pablo Sandoval also homered to snap a drought of 178 at - bats without a long ball as the Giants won despite blowing a four - run lead . 	 Aaron Rowand led off the ninth with an infield single against Andrew Cashner ( 1 - 5 ) and went to second on a sacrifice by Freddy Sanchez . After Aubrey Huff was intentionally walked
column2: Cashner walked Buster Posey unintentionally to load the bases . 	 Torres
column3: held out of the starting lineup because of tightness in his legs
column4: then hit a drive to center that landed on the warning track and bounced over the fence for the winning hit . 	 Brian Wilson ( 3 - 1 ) pitched a hitless ninth for the win . 	 Now the Giants can turn their attention to the NL West - leading Padres
column5: who have won seven of eight head - to - head meetings between the teams this season . But the Giants are a very different team than the one that last played the Padres in May. 	 The biggest difference is the presence in the lineup of rookie Buster Posey
column6: who is hitting .335 since being called up from the minors May 29
column8: who has 10 homers in 154 at - bats since joining the Giants on June 4 . 	 San Francisco can take over first place in the NL West by sweeping the three - game series at home beginning Friday . 	 Burrell gave the Giants a 7 - 3 lead with a grand slam in the fifth off Randy Wells . But the Cubs worked their way back into the game after starter Matt Cain left . 	 Kosuke Fukodome hit an RBI double in the seventh off Chris Ray before Chicago scored three times in the eighth to tie it . Blake DeWitt started the rally when he drew a leadoff walk from Javier Lopez . Guillermo Mota allowed a single to Geoff Baker and an RBI double by Koyie Hill to make it 7 - 5 . 	 Sergio Romo entered with runners on second and third and no outs and got pinch - hitter Alfonso Soriano on an infield popup and Tyler Colvin on an RBI groundout . Starlin Castro then tied the game with an RBI single past a diving Sandoval at third base for his fourth hit of the game . 	 Cain matched a season - high with nine strikeouts in six innings
column9: but was not as dominating as usual against the Cubs . Cain had allowed just one run in his past 30 innings against Chicago
column10: throwing 23 straight scoreless innings since new teammate Mike Fontenot hit an RBI single against him Aug. 23
column11: 2007 . 	 Cain could n't make it out of the first inning unscathed this game
column12: giving up a two - run double to Xavier Nady that put the Giants in an early hole . 	 Wells ' RBI double in the fourth made it 3 - 1 before the Giants tied the game on the consecutive homers by Burrell and Sandoval . 	 Game notes 	  Sandoval 's homer was first since June 15 against Baltimore and his third career splash hit . ... Burrell has 19 career multihomer games . ... Cubs 3B Aramis Ramirez missed his second straight game with a sore left rib cage . ... Cubs 1B Derrek Lee will fly to St. Louis with the team and be activated from the bereavement list Friday . ... Cubs manager Lou Piniella
column13: who is helping his ailing mother in Tampa
column15: is also expected to rejoin the team in St. Louis . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

Jonathan India finished ahead of Cardinals OF Dylan Carlson and Marlins starter Trevor Rogers for NL Rookie of the Year . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column17: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column18: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox .

column1: SAN DIEGO -- After sweeping aside the lowly Pittsburgh Pirates
column2: the San Diego Padres can turn their attention to a showdown with the San Francisco Giants in the NL West . 	 But the Padres refuse to be baited by Jonathan Sanchez 's guarantee of a Giants sweep . 	 Ryan Ludwick hit a two - run homer while Jon Garland and three relievers combined on a four - hitter to lead the Padres to a 3 - 0 victory Thursday that completed a three - game sweep of the lowly Pittsburgh Pirates . 	 The Padres protected their 2 1/2 - game lead over the Giants in the NL West . Sanchez
column3: who has guaranteed a sweep against the Padres
column4: will start Friday night 's series opener against lefty Clayton Richard . San Diego is 7 - 1 against the Giants this year . 	 The Padres
column5: who 've been in first place for all but three days since April 20
column6: were n't about to make any bold predictions . 	 " For us to go out and sweep Pittsburgh is a good feeling and we 're going to have a a happy flight tonight to San Francisco
column8: who pitched the ninth for his major league - leading 34th save in 37 chances . " Tomorrow we 'll get ready for San Francisco . " 	 Sanchez made his prediction on Sunday after losing to the Atlanta Braves . 	 " If he said it tonight then it might mean a little bit more
column9: " Bell said . " I think he 'll have more pressure on himself now pitching against us tomorrow
column10: just because he predicted something that he can only handle for one game out of three . " 	 Sanchez no - hit the Padres in San Francisco on July 10

column2: handing Buck Showalter his first road loss as Orioles manager . 	 Gomez ( 3 - 0 ) gave up one run and six hits over six innings

column1: WASHINGTON -- Mike Stanton hardly felt at his best Thursday . 	 A sore throat kept him from sleeping much the night before . He decided he needed to head out and buy some medicine . But a storm left him soaked on his walk to the store
column2: and then the stuff he bought to soothe his throat did n't really work . 	 No matter . Stanton homered for the second consecutive game to stretch his hit streak to six at - bats
column3: and Ricky Nolasco rebounded from a rough start by taking a shutout into the seventh inning
column4: leading the Florida Marlins past the Washington Nationals 5 - 0 Thursday night to complete a three - game sweep . 	 " The kid is unbelievable
column5: " Nolasco said about Stanton . " This is just a small glimpse of what we 're going to see . " 	 Added Nolasco ( 13 - 8) : " It 's going to be fun to watch
column6: and I 'm glad I do n't got to face him . " 	 Nationals pitchers did
column8: and Stanton went 8 for 12 with two homers
column9: three doubles and six RBIs in the series . 	 He hit a two - run homer off Livan Hernandez ( 8 - 8) in the second inning Thursday
column10: when umpires checked a replay of the drive and ruled it cleared the fence . Stanton 's 12th homer landed above the out - of - town video scoreboard
column11: and the ball rattled around a metal fence along the green outfield wall
column12: then bounced back onto the field . So Stanton stopped at third base with an apparent triple
column13: until the umpiring crew left the field for a video review and decided the ball left the park . 	 " We knew it was a home run . I heard it hit the metal back there
column15: " Nationals manager Jim Riggleman said . " They got the call right . " 	 In Florida 's 9 - 5 victory Wednesday
column16: Stanton went 5 for 5
column17: including a homer and two doubles . That made him the second - youngest player -- at 20 years
column18: 276 days -- to have five hits and drive in four runs in a game since RBIs became an official statistic in 1920
column19: according to the Elias Sports Bureau . Only one other Marlins player had those stats in a game : Gary Sheffield
column20: in September 1995 against Colorado . 	 Stanton walked in his second plate appearance Thursday
column21: then made his first out since Tuesday by popping up in the sixth . 	 " That swing . That powerful swing
column22: " Florida manager Edwin Rodriguez said . " He 's one of those guys that
column23: irregardless of the score of the game
column24: the fans have to stay till the end of the game
column25: because he 's going to make history any time . " 	 Only dozens of fans were around when this game ended at 12:23 a.m. ; the start was delayed 1 hour
column26: 57 minutes because of rain . 	 Using his biting slider
column27: Nolasco struck out eight batters in six - plus innings
column28: allowing six hits and one walk . 	 Nolasco earned his eighth win in his past 10 outings . In his previous start
column29: a loss against St. Louis on Aug. 6
column30: the righty gave up seven runs and 10 hits in five innings . 	 But he was much sharper Thursday
column31: retiring eight straight batters in one stretch . 	 " Honestly
column32: I felt better my last start than I did tonight
column33: " Nolasco said . " So today I just tried to not to do too much . " 	 He found himself in a tough spot in the fifth
column35: a walk and a hit batter loaded the bases with two outs for Adam Dunn
column36: who entered the day leading the NL with 31 homers . 	 " Biggest at - bat of the game
column37: " Nolasco said . 	 He struck out Dunn on what the slugger called " a really good slider " that was " tough to pick up . " 	 After a 1 - 2 - 3 sixth
column38: Nolasco ran into problems again in the seventh
column39: which began with two singles in a row . But relievers Jose Veras
column40: Clay Hensley and Burke Badenhop finished the shutout . 	 " The story of the game was Nolasco
column41: " said Riggleman
column42: whose team went 0 for 10 with runners in scoring position . " We just could n't get anything off him . " 	 Hernandez gave up three runs in his 6 1/3 innings against the team he helped lead to a championship as MVP of the 1997 World Series . 	 Riggleman said neither Hernandez nor catcher Ivan Rodriguez was pleased with some of plate umpire Mike Winters ' calls . At one point
column43: Riggleman left the dugout to make sure Rodriguez did n't get ejected . 	 Hernandez said he thought Winters did n't " see the ball very good " and that Rodriguez " complained a little bit . " 	 Said Rodriguez : " I do n't want to talk about it . " 	 Game notes 	  The Marlins had n't swept a three - game series in 2010

column4: on Thursday night . 	 Once the winning run scored

column1: CHICAGO -- The Minnesota Twins will leave Chicago in first place in the American League Central . 	 Jason Kubel hit a three - run home run and Francisco Liriano pitched in and out of trouble to help the Twins beat the Chicago White Sox 6 - 1 and take over the top spot in the division on Thursday night . 	 Orlando Hudson also added a solo homer for the Twins
column2: who took two of three games from their division rivals to move one game ahead . The Twins also finished a 10 - game road trip with a 6 - 4 record . 	 " It 's a battle
column3: " Twins manager Ron Gardenhire said . " I do n't expect it any other way . This is the way it 's supposed to be with these two teams . You 're sitting in the dugout trying to figure out what you have to do next and they 're doing the same thing . It 's two good teams getting after each other and that 's why we 're right at the top of our division and we 'll hopefully remain there right until the end and we 'll see what happens . " 	 The White Sox lost their first series at U.S. Cellular Field since the Indians took two out of three games there on June 4 - 6 . 	 Liriano ( 11 - 7 ) allowed one run and pitched around seven hits with four strikeouts . He pitched his best when he was in several jams . 	 The White Sox loaded the bases with no outs for the middle of their order in the fifth
column4: but Liriano still escaped unscathed . Alex Rios hit a comebacker to the pitcher
column5: who threw to Joe Mauer at the plate for the force . Liriano then struck out Paul Konerko on three pitches and finished off the inning by getting Carlos Quentin swinging . 	 " I felt pretty good . I felt strong . I was hitting my spot on the slider today
column6: especially in the fifth inning . I wanted to make sure it was down
column7: " said Liriano . " I was making some good pitches when I need to . I got myself in trouble and just told myself to calm down and take it one hitter at a time . " 	 The White Sox threatened again in the sixth . They loaded the bases with one out for the top of their order . Liriano got Juan Pierre to line out to shallow center . Gardenhire went with reliever Matt Guerrier to finish up the inning
column8: and Guerrier got Alexei Ramirez to hit an infield pop out . 	 " I was ready to come out . I ran out of gas a little . I pitched pretty good so I was n't mad at all . He did what he had to do
column9: " said Liriano . 	 The White Sox left 12 runners on . 	 " We missed a lot of opportunities offensively
column10: " said White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen . " We got people on base almost every inning and we could n't get a base hit . One inning we had bases loaded and the big guys coming to bat and we could n't get it done . Obviously we could n't get anything done with people on base but we were facing a pretty good pitcher . Liriano 's slider was pretty good and we could n't lay off of those good sliders . " 	 White Sox starter Gavin Floyd ( 8 - 9 ) allowed six runs on 10 hits and was done in on an 0 - 2 pitch to Kubel . Trailing 3 - 1 in the seventh with first base open and two outs
column12: to get to Kubel . Floyd got ahead of Kubel
column14: Floyd hung a curve that Kubel hit over the left - field wall to give the Twins a 6 - 1 lead . 	 " It does n't matter who 's [ hitting cleanup ]
column15: Joe is n't going to get many opportunities if there 's a base open . You try to move a left - hander in there and it was n't working too well the first couple times but he finally got a big hit for us late . We have a lot of faith in Kubel . It 's good stuff
column16: " said Gardenhire . 	 Guillen did n't contemplate taking Floyd out
column17: despite having a lefty in the bullpen ready . 	 " Gavin was throwing the ball very good and I gave him the opportunity to finish it up like I do with all of my pitchers
column18: he made a bad pitch
column19: he just hung a breaking ball over the plate
column20: " said Guillen . 	 With one out in the first
column21: Hudson homered on a 3 - 2 pitch to center . 	 Rios singled with two outs in the first inning and Konerko walked . Quentin was hit for the third time in the series to load the bases . Pierzynski followed with a weak roller down the third - base line for an infield hit to score Rios . 	 Michael Cuddyer led off the second inning with a single . With the infield shift on during Jim Thome 's at - bat
column22: Cuddyer stole second and went to third after catcher A.J. Pierzynski 's throw went into center because the shortstop Ramirez did n't cover second . Cuddyer then scored on Thome 's sacrifice fly . 	 In the third inning

column25: Floyd started his windup then stopped
column26: resulting in a balk call by home plate umpire Tim Welke to give the Twins a 3 - 1 lead . 	 " It was one of those games where you did n't feel your greatest

column28: " said Floyd

column21: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " That 's as good as you 'll see him throw . He was probably 4 miles

column2: Fla. -- The Baltimore Orioles keep winning under new manager Buck Showalter . 	 Jeremy Guthrie scattered two hits over six innings

column1: ATLANTA -- Tim Hudson needed the support of only one big hit to continue his streak of impressive wins . 	 The Braves ' fill - in for Chipper Jones came through in a big way . 	 Hudson extended his dominant stretch of starts with three - hit ball for eight innings and Brooks Conrad homered in the seventh to lift Atlanta to a 1 - 0 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers on Friday night . 	 In the Braves ' first game since learning Jones would be lost for the season with a knee injury
column2: Conrad made the initial bid to fill the void as he replaced Jones at third base . 	 Conrad hit his second key homer in three games
column3: following a two - run homer in the ninth after replacing the injured Jones in Tuesday 's 4 - 2 win at Houston . 	 " Conrad
column4: what 's new about that ? " asked Braves manager Bobby Cox . 	 Conrad
column6: has had a knack for key homers off the bench . Three of his seven homers have come as a pinch - hitter
column7: including two grand slams . 	 The NL East - leading Braves increased their margin over second - place Philadelphia to three games . 	 Conrad 's homer off Hiroki Kuroda was especially big after Jones announced Friday he will have surgery on his injured left knee on Saturday . 	 Jones was in uniform on the bench and was part of the crowd of players to greet Conrad after the homer . 	 " He was excited
column8: " Conrad said of Jones . " He came up after the game and said ' Way to go . ' " 	 Conrad hit a 2 - 0 pitch over the center - field wall . 	 " I was just looking for a pitch up I could drive and try to get on base
column9: " said Conrad . 	 Conrad said he hit a fastball . Kuroda called the pitch a sinker . Each said the pitch was up . 	 It was Kuroda 's fifth shutout loss . 	 " I did n't really count but it 's really disappointing when you say it 's the fifth one
column10: " Kuroda said . 	 Hudson ( 14 - 5 ) has won five straight starts and has yielded only two runs in the impressive period . 	 Hudson is tied for third in the NL in wins . He lowered his ERA to 2.13
column11: also second in the league . 	 " I feel good
column12: " Hudson said . " I 'm happy with how I 'm giving the team a chance to win . 	 " It would be nice to get some big leads and blow some teams out
column13: but if we just keep pitching this way we 're going to win some more close games . " 	 Hudson struck out the side in the fifth and retired 13 consecutive Dodgers before giving up a single to Scott Podsednik with two outs in the sixth . 	 " They were both pretty good
column14: were n't they ? " asked Dodgers manager Joe Torre of Kuroda and Hudson
column15: who is in his sixth season with Atlanta after six years with Oakland . 	 " Hudson is back to the guy I remember over there in Oakland
column16: " Torre added . " He 's just very tough . He does n't give in
column17: stays down . His pitch count was terrific tonight . We obviously could n't mount any kind of offense against him tonight . " 	 Hudson threw 91 pitches . 	 Podsednik led off the game with a walk and moved to second on Ryan Theriot 's groundout . Hudson did not allow another baserunner to reach second . 	 Billy Wagner
column18: who blew his seventh save against Houston on Wednesday
column19: allowed a single to Podsednik leading off the ninth . With one out
column20: Podsednik was caught stealing before Wagner struck out Andre Ethier to earn his 29th save . 	 Kuroda gave up only three hits before Conrad 's 406 - foot homer to center field with one out in the seventh . 	 Kuroda ( 8 - 11 ) gave up four hits and one run in seven innings . He had three strikeouts with two walks
column21: one intentional . 	 Jonathan Broxton
column22: who was removed from his role as the Dodgers ' closer on Friday
column23: gave up one hit in a scoreless eighth inning . 	 " Until I get back right Joe just wants to put me out there in non - pressure situations
column24: " Broxton said . " Let me get back to my feel and we 'll go from here . I felt good out there . " 	 Game notes 	  Torre said SS Rafael Furcal ( back ) is unlikely to be activated when eligible to come off the disabled list on Wednesday . Furcal still has soreness in his back . ... Torre said OF Manny Ramirez
column25: who has been out since July 17 with a right calf strain
column26: could be ready for a rehab assignment by the middle of next week . ... Braves LHP Eric O'Flaherty ( mononucleosis ) gave up one hit in one scoreless inning in his first of at least two rehab appearances with Triple - A Gwinnett . ... The Braves recalled INF Brandon Hicks from Triple - A Gwinnett to fill Chipper Jones ' roster spot after Jones was placed on the disabled list with a season - ending knee injury . Jones said he plans to attempt a comeback next season . ... Podsednik has a 10 - game hitting streak . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season
column27: leading all rookies with a 4.1 WAR . 	 Take a look back at the best plays from NL Rookie of the Year Jonathan India 's 2021 campaign . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column29: who played for seven teams in a 12 - year major league career has died . He was 45 . column2: Texas -- Talk about more bang for the buck under the Texas Rangers ' new ownership . 	 Nelson Cruz led off the 11th inning with a homer on the first pitch thrown by Tim Wakefield and AL West - leading Texas capped a 10 - 9 victory over the Boston Red Sox on Friday night . 	 " Wakefield always throws the knuckleball . ... Especially the first pitch
column3: he always tries to throw the first strike
column4: " Cruz said . " So I just tried to tee him up . " 	 Cruz 's 16th homer of the season disappeared deep into the left - field seats after the expected knuckleball from Wakefield ( 3 - 9 )
column5: the seventh Boston reliever . 	 The Rangers ' biggest comeback victory of the season came in the first game since the ownership group led by Nolan Ryan and Chuck Greenberg officially took over the team . Ryan was absent
column6: but Greenberg was among the happiest people in the park . 	 As Cruz approached home plate
column7: he flipped his batting helmet to the side and jumped on the plate in the middle of the mob of teammates waiting for him there . 	 " Nellie is a great athlete . He can get it done anytime
column8: " Josh Hamilton said . " It 's seems when the pressure 's on
column9: he thrives in these situations . I 'd love to see him play in the playoffs . " 	 The Rangers have an 8-game lead in the AL West over the Los Angeles Angels . 	 While Cruz won the game
column10: Hamilton is a certain MVP candidate . 	 Hamilton had four more hits to raise his majors - best average to .362 and scored four times
column11: including in the eighth when he raced home from second base on Vladimir Guerrero 's infield hit for a 9 - all tie after the Rangers had trailed by six runs earlier in the game . There were also two highlight - reel catches in center field . 	 " I 'm tired
column13: with a chuckle . " I feel confident at the plate right now
column14: not trying to do so much . That 's what I told Nellie before the last at - bat . " 	 Darren O'Day ( 4 - 2 ) worked a perfect 11th inning against Boston 's Nos . 2 - 4 hitters
column15: extending a team record with his 29th consecutive scoreless appearance . His stretch of 26 1/3 consecutive scoreless innings is the longest active streak in the majors . 	 A day earlier
column16: Major League Baseball formally approved the sale of the team from Tom Hicks to the 18 - investor group led by Greenberg and Ryan
column17: the Hall of Fame pitcher and team president . The new owners immediately implemented lower prices for concessions
column18: parking and merchandise . 	 Best of all for the second consecutive sellout at Rangers Ballpark was the comeback and Cruz 's game - winning blast . 	 " That 's a guy that 's swung the bat very well against us . We were in a situation where there was nothing else to do
column19: " manager Terry Francona said . " Wake was going to pitch ' til we won or lost . The good news is he wo n't be tired . " 	 Wakefield left the Red Sox clubhouse without talking to reporters . 	 J.D. Drew hit two of Boston 's five solo home runs
column20: which included three in a row in a seven - run fourth that put the Red Sox up 8 - 2 . 	 Drew 's second homer gave Boston a 9 - 6 lead in the seventh before Hamilton help the Rangers finish off their comeback . The biggest deficit they had overcome to win was four runs . 	 Hamilton led off the Texas seventh with a single
column21: went to third on a one - out double by Cruz and scored on David Murphy 's sacrifice fly . Bengie Molina then hit a liner to right that Drew misplayed
column22: though it was ruled an RBI double instead of an error . 	 An inning later
column23: Hamilton had a two - out double before Daniel Bard 's first pitch to Guerrero was high and tight . Guerrero gave a menacing stare toward the mound and a couple of pitches later hit a ball up the middle that second baseman Jed Lowrie fielded . But the throw could n't get Guerrero sliding headfirst into the bag and Hamilton kept running . 	 David Ortiz
column24: Adrian Beltre and Drew hit consecutive homers in a seven - pitch span to start the fourth to chase Tommy Hunter . Boston added four more runs in the inning off Scott Feldman for an 8 - 2 lead . Lowrie had already homered an inning earlier . 	 Boston had n't had three consecutive homers since April 22
column26: when Drew was part of four in a row at home against the New York Yankees . 	 Texas pulled to 8 - 6 after three homers off Josh Beckett
column27: including back - to - back shots by Michael Young and Hamilton starting the fifth . 	 It was Hamilton 's 25th homer
column28: to go along with 37 doubles and 79 RBIs . 	 Lowrie
column29: who led off the third with a homer
column30: was robbed by Hamilton of another extra - base hit to start the sixth . Hamilton sprinted toward the warning track
column31: leaped and in mid - air had to reach back with his glove to make the grab . He also took a hit away from Marco Scutaro in the third with a lunging grab
column32: holding on when his momentum caused him to fall down . 	 Rangers rookie Mitch Moreland hit his first career homer
column33: a two - run shot in the fourth . 	 Game notes 	  Murphy had a double and a triple and is hitting .448 ( 13 - for-29 ) in an eight - game winning streak . ... Beckett 's ERA rose to 6.51 after giving up six runs and 10 hits in five innings . He allowed seven runs in 4 2/3 innings in a loss to the Yankees on Sunday . ... Boston has 13 homers the past four games . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers

column1: HOUSTON -- Even in the midst of the worst season of his career
column2: Carlos Lee has a knack for hitting key home runs . 	 Lee hit a three - run homer in the eighth inning to power the Houston Astros to a 4 - 1 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Friday night . 	 " I took advantage of the opportunity
column3: " he said . " That does n't happen very often so you have to take advantage of it when it happens . " 	 Lee is batting just .249 on the year but four of his 15 homers have given Houston the lead in its final at - bat . 	 " I know people get on him about his year
column5: " manager Brad Mills said of the clutch drives . " It was great to see Carlos come through there . " 	 Houston was down before Lee connected against All - Star reliever Evan Meek ( 4 - 4 )
column6: belting a drive to the Crawford Boxes in left . Angel Sanchez reached on a one - out single and Hunter Pence walked before Lee 's shot . 	 " [ Meek ] is not an easy guy to hit
column7: " Lee said . " It was one of those games where one hit changes it all and it was n't my hit
column8: it was Sanchez . ... I mean the momentum got going and we scored four runs . That was great today . " 	 The Astros kept going after Lee 's go - ahead drive
column9: putting together three consecutive singles . Rookie Brett Wallace 's hit scored Geoff Blum to make it 4 - 1 . 	 Meek said he had trouble keeping the ball down . 	 " The guys really fought and to go out there and pitch how I pitched tonight is really tough
column10: " he said . " That 's just something that weighs on your shoulders when you go up there and struggle . I 'm just kind of in a rut . I 'm falling behind hitters
column11: walking guys . When you do that
column12: it 's not going to be pretty . " 	 The Pirates wasted a great start by Ross Ohlendorf in their fifth consecutive loss and eighth straight on the road
column13: dropping to a major league - worst 39 - 76 . 	 " This is what Ross looks like when he 's winning
column14: " Pirates manager John Russell said . " His pitches were working well . His velocity was very good . It was a great game . He really did a nice job . Hopefully we can get him a win someday . " 	 Wilton Lopez ( 4 - 0 ) allowed one hit in a scoreless eighth inning and Brandon Lyon finished for his third save . 	 Pittsburgh went ahead in the third inning against Brett Myers . Andrew McCutchen singled
column15: stole second and moved to third on Jose Tabata 's grounder . Neil Walker then drove him with a single to center . 	 Myers pitched seven innings and has lasted at least six innings in each of his 24 starts
column16: extending his franchise record to start a season . He allowed seven hits
column17: struck out seven and walked none . 	 Ohlendorf was even better
column18: pitching 6 2/3 innings of four - hit ball . But he remains winless in 10 appearances against the Astros . 	 Ohlendorf allowed a pair of singles with one out in the first inning before walking Lee to load the bases . He pitched out of that jam by striking out Blum before Chris Johnson popped out to end the inning . 	 He retired 11 of the next 12 batters before walking Michael Bourn with two outs in the fifth . Bourn stole second but was stranded when Ohlendorf struck out Sanchez . 	 Pedro Alvarez had three hits
column19: a pair of singles and a ground - rule double
column20: for the Pirates . Ohlendorf struck out seven and walked two . 	 Game notes 	  Pittsburgh SS Ronny Cedeno was sidelined with inflammation in his left shoulder . He does n't think it 's serious and expects to return soon . ... Tests performed on Houston closer Matt Lindstrom 's bothersome back showed no structural damage . He was given medication and hopes that combined with treatment will eliminate the problem . ... Houston RHP Felipe Paulino was examined by Dr. James Andrews for a second opinion on his injured right shoulder . Andrews agreed with the first diagnosis of a rotator cuff strain and recommended continued rest and treatment . Paulino has been on the disabled list since June 21 . column21: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers

column1: CHICAGO -- When he goes to the plate these days
column2: it 's safe for Gordon Beckham to look at the scoreboard again . 	 " It 's a little bit of a relief
column4: where you 've got the batting average right in front of you
column5: " Beckham said . " It 's tough when you see .198 in June . That was no fun . " 	 The fun is back for Beckham
column6: who hit a three - run homer Friday night to lead the Chicago White Sox to an 8 - 4 victory over the slumping Detroit Tigers . 	 Mark Teahen
column8: added a two - run shot for Chicago ( 65 - 51 )
column9: which is 41 - 18 since June 9 -- a surge that began with a 15 - 3 victory over the Tigers . Mark Buehrle ( 11 - 9 ) allowed three runs and five hits in 6 1/3 innings and has won his last five decisions against Detroit . 	 Beckham also tripled and scored in the seventh . One of baseball 's top rookies in 2009
column10: he is batting .379 with five homers and 19 RBIs in his last 28 games after getting off to a slow start . 	 " Physically
column11: I was doing everything I could to try to get better every day but emotionally
column12: it was a pretty rough ride
column13: " Beckham said . " To be in the worst part of my career and get out of it
column14: I think it 'll help me down the road . " 	 After losing five of seven to fall out of the AL Central lead

column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- Carl Pavano was n't happy when Drew Butera decided to shave his mustache . 	 But the veteran pitcher
column2: who sports a mustache of his own that is rising in popularity
column3: will forgive the young catcher as long as the pair continues to rack up wins . 	 With Butera -- his personal catcher -- behind the plate
column4: Pavano pitched into the seventh inning for his 15th win
column5: Danny Valencia had two hits and two RBIs and the Minnesota Twins held on to beat the Oakland Athletics 4 - 3 on Friday night despite being outhit 14 - 5 . 	 Pavano ( 15 - 7 ) allowed two runs and 10 hits over 6 1/3 innings and matched the New York Yankees ' CC Sabathia and Tampa Bay Rays ' David Price for the most wins in the American League . 	 " You 're going to have some innings where they 're kind of rough
column6: " Pavano said . " You just do n't want it to blow up in your face . It did n't happen tonight because we made some great plays . " 	 Matt Capps allowed an unearned run in the ninth but held on for his third save with the Twins and 29th overall . He got Rajai Davis to fly out to end the game with runners on first and second . 	 Minnesota took a 3 - 2 lead in the fourth inning when Valencia 's ground - rule double scored Delmon Young . Valencia advanced to third on Alexi Casilla 's sacrifice bunt and scored on Butera 's squeeze to make it 4 - 2 . 	 Butera fought off a low curve from A 's starter Gio Gonzalez to lay down a perfect squeeze . 	 " He shaved his mustache
column7: I was a little disappointed in that
column8: " Pavano said . " But he picked us up when we needed to be picked up . He 's a good young kid and he steps up when we need him . " 	 Daric Barton and Jack Cust had the A 's RBIs . Mark Ellis had three hits for Oakland

column10: not only did we get however many hits we had but I think we hit the ball pretty hard on a lot of outs as well
column11: " Cust said . " That 's also frustrating when guys are hitting the ball well and not getting anything to show for it . column12: Ron Mahay relieved Pavano and struck out Cust . Casilla made a diving catch deep in the hole at short off the bat of Kevin Kouzmanoff to end the threat . column14: whose team also had two errors . 	 " We made some real good ones and some real bad ones . It was enough to win
column15: " he added . 	 A combination of bad defense and control problems cost Gonzalez ( 10 - 8) in the first inning . 	 Span reached on an error to start the first and scored when Gonzalez walked Jason Kubel with the bases loaded . Valencia made it 2 - 0 with an RBI single later in the first . 	 The Twins continue to win without the services of All - Star first - baseman Justin Morneau . The former MVP has been out since July 8 with a concussion and said before Friday 's game that there is no timetable for his return . column21: great squeeze

column23: " Gonzalez said . " You 've got to respect that . " 	 Barton

column1: DENVER -- Troy Tulowitzki jogged to first base and stopped
column2: unsure if he was a star or robbed of another hit . 	 When the crowd starting roaring

column4: " he said . " It got kind of loud there
column5: starting in the left - field seats . " 	 Tulowitzki hit a three - run homer in the eighth inning and the Colorado Rockies rallied to beat the Milwaukee Brewers 5 - 4 on Friday night . 	 With runners on second and third and no outs
column6: Kameron Loe ( 2 - 3 ) relieved starter Yovani Gallardo and Tulowitzki hit an 0 - 1 pitch off the glove of a leaping Ryan Braun at the left - field wall . 	 For a split - second
column7: only Braun knew it was gone . 	 " I felt the ball go off the tip of my glove . If I had a couple of more inches I probably would have caught it
column8: " Braun said . " I knew as soon as I came down I did n't have it . " 	 After three hard - hit balls for outs before the eighth
column9: Tulowitzki was n't taking anything for granted . 	 " I hit some balls hard that were caught
column10: " he said . " I was starting to get frustrated
column11: but one broke my way . " 	 Todd Helton drew a leadoff walk and Carlos Gonzalez doubled down the left - field line before Tulowitzki 's 11th homer delighted the crowd of 39
column12: 142 at Coors Field . 	 " From my angle it looked like he caught it
column13: " Helton said . " I was tagging . " 	 It was another memorable win in a season of dramatic home victories for the Rockies
column14: who have struggled on the road . They scored nine runs in the ninth inning to beat St. Louis in Denver on July 7 . They put up 12 runs in the eighth inning against the Chicago Cubs two weeks ago . 	 " We 've had some magic here

column17: the National League 's leading hitter

column21: Alcides Escobar doubled to center to chase starter Jorge De La Rosa . 	 Lucroy greeted Matt Belisle with a single to right that made it 3 - 1 . 	 De La Rosa allowed three runs and six hits
column22: struck out five and walked three . 	 Milwaukee added another run in the seventh when Weeks led off with a double

column25: " Macha said . " Even with the lefties

They had a chance for more but right fielder Hart tracked down Tulowitzki 's drive into the right - center field gap for the last out . 	 Game notes 	  Buchholz 's previous win was Aug. 20

column2: Calif. -- Marc Rzepczynski made the most of his return to the major leagues . 	 Rzepczynski pitched two - hit ball over seven innings in a spot start for resting Brandon Morrow
column3: and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Los Angeles Angels 3 - 0 on Friday night . He retired 14 of his last 15 batters in his 14th big league start and third this season after getting recalled from Triple - A Las Vegas . 	 " It 's been an up and down year
column5: whose season was delayed when a batted ball broke his left middle finger during a spring training start against the Yankees . " Unfortunately I was hurt at the beginning
column6: and then the last time I was up here I tried to do too much . So it was good to just stay within myself and help the team win . " 	 The 24 - year - old left - hander
column7: who was born in nearby Yorba Linda and lives in Riverside
column8: made his first appearance for the Blue Jays since giving up five runs and nine hits over 4 2/3 innings at Kansas City on July 21 . Among Friday night 's crowd of 40
column9: 606 were a group of 20 family members and friends
column10: including his parents . 	 " It was good to pitch at home and pitch in front of them because there are a lot of them who have n't seen me pitch before . So it was exciting
column12: I had a little bit of butterflies . But once I got out there
column13: I told myself to slow the game down and just go out there and pitch like it was any other ballgame . " 	 Blue Jays manager Cito Gaston decided to have Morrow skip a turn in the rotation after last Sunday 's 1 - 0 masterpiece in which he set career highs with 137 pitches and 17 strikeouts and lost his bid for a no - hitter on Evan Longoria 's two - out single in the ninth . 	 " They gave me the chance
column14: and I 'm glad I was able to back it up and do what they needed me to
column15: " Rzepczynski said . " I still felt like I had plenty left . I 'm not overthrowing it anymore
column16: like I was the last time I was up here . I felt like I could have kept going
column17: which was a good thing . " 	 Scott Downs pitched the eighth and former Angels right - hander Kevin Gregg worked a perfect ninth for his 26th save in 30 chances
column18: completing the three - hitter . 	 Rzepczynski ( 1 - 1 ) picked up his first win since last Aug. 21 against the Angels at Toronto . It also was the Blue Jays ' 10th shutout
column19: tying Oakland for the AL lead . 	 The Angels capped off a three - game sweep of Kansas City on Wednesday when Bobby Abreu connected in the 10th inning
column20: but were blanked in this one for only the fourth time this season and second time at home . The Blue Jays beat them 6 - 0 at Angel Stadium on May 24 with 7 1/3 innings of two - hit ball by Brett Cecil . 	 " They 're a good hitting team . So for Marc to do that and keep those guys off balance
column21: it 's a tribute to him
column22: " Toronto first baseman Lyle Overbay said . " It was good to see . He 's got the stuff . It 's just a matter of him believing it and doing it . " 	 Scott Kazmir ( 8 - 10 ) allowed two runs and four hits over six innings for Los Angeles . It was the left - hander 's second impressive outing since coming off the disabled list . He was sidelined for 17 games because of shoulder fatigue
column23: after going 0 - 4 with a 13.73 ERA over his previous four outings . 	 " I felt like I was a little erratic early on
column24: but then I settled in after that third inning
column25: " Kazmir said . " I thought I was in a pretty good groove with all my pitches . " 	 One night after a pulsating win against Boston in which they rallied for four runs in the ninth inning against Jonathan Papelbon
column26: the Blue Jays evened their road record at 30 - 30 in the opener of a nine - game trip . 	 " It was kind of tough
column27: coming from Toronto to here
column28: " said left fielder Fred Lewis
column29: who capped the scoring with an RBI double in the seventh . " As the game got later and later
column30: I got kind of tired . But I could n't let that affect me . " 	 Speedy Angels rookie Peter Bourjos
column31: who has started in center field in all nine games since his promotion from Triple - A Salt Lake on Aug. 3
column32: made a leaping attempt on Adam Lind 's drive to the wall in right - center in the second inning and the ball caromed off his glove for a triple . Edwin Encarnacion drove in Lind with a single . 	 Bourjos robbed Aaron Hill of a bloop single in left - center in the third
column33: but it went in the books as a sacrifice fly . 	 Game notes 	  Rzepczynski
column34: who had hit only two batters during his first 75 innings in the big leagues
column35: plunked Bourjos and Abreu with consecutive pitches in the third . ... Bourjos robbed Jose Bautista of an RBI double in the ninth with a diving catch after running full - speed toward the warning track . ... column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Closer Heath Bell will take any extra momentum the San Diego Padres can muster at the moment . 	 There 's a lot of baseball left
column2: yet Bell & Co. are determined to ride this run right into October . 	 Ryan Ludwick narrowly beat Juan Uribe 's throw home to score the go - ahead run in the sixth inning
column3: and the National League West - leading San Diego Padres held off the San Francisco Giants 3 - 2 on Friday night for their fifth straight victory . 	 " The Giants are one of the hottest teams in baseball
column4: " Bell said . " If we can win a series with them
column5: maybe we can brush them off our heels a little bit . " 	 Clayton Richard ( 10 - 5 ) earned his third straight win over the Giants this season
column6: helping San Diego extend its division lead to 3 1/2 games over San Francisco in a game the Padres played under protest . It became a moot point when they won . 	 The Padres quieted Jonathan Sanchez ( 8 - 8)
column7: who no - hit them here July 10
column9: after he guaranteed a sweep of San Diego following his outing at Atlanta last Sunday . 	 Sanchez 's comments only added fuel to this highly anticipated weekend series between the two contenders . He did n't back down afterward . 	 " I believe in my team
column12: but I know if we keep fighting like this
column13: I think we 're going to make it . " 	 In the fourth
column15: San Francisco second baseman Freddy Sanchez hustled to field Chris Denorfia 's grounder that hit off Jonathan Sanchez
column16: but Scott Hairston ran in front of Freddy Sanchez and caused the infielder to stop his motion . First - base umpire Marvin Hudson first ruled Hairston out for interference
column17: and then the crew met about the play . 	 Padres manager Bud Black came out to argue . After a discussion that lasted several minutes
column18: San Diego decided to play the game under protest . 	 The Padres took the lead in the sixth when a sliding Ludwick beat the close play at the plate on Chase Headley 's grounder . That came moments after hefty San Francisco third baseman Pablo Sandoval ran down the line and made a forward - diving tag on Adrian Gonzalez to save a run . Sandoval 's head whipped back upon impact with the ground and knocked the wind out of him . He was briefly down and examined by trainers before returning to third . 	 " We play a lot of these type of games
column19: " Black said . " I think the Giants do
column20: too . We 're used to these games and they 're good games . " 	 The teams
column21: each having changed significantly
column22: had n't met since May 18 at Petco Park but still face off seven times after this series -- four games in San Diego in early September and a season - ending three - game series from Oct. 1 to 3 in San Francisco . 	 " This is a showdown
column23: " Black joked of the significance of this series
column24: considering it 's still only mid - August . " When you get into September
column25: that 's really the line for me . " 	 The game sure had a playoff feel
column26: with a boisterous sellout crowd of 42
column27: 722 . 	 The Padres have won eight of the first nine with the Giants
column28: including the initial seven matchups . 	 " It was intense out there . That 's the way our games have been going against them
column29: " San Francisco skipper Bruce Bochy said . " They 're shutting us down and winning these tight games . " 	 San Francisco jumped to a quick 2 - 0 lead against Richard
column30: who walked leadoff man Andres Torres and allowed him to advance on a wild pitch . Aubrey Huff then hit an RBI double and later scored on Pat Burrell 's groundout . 	 The Padres tied it in the top of the second . 	 Sanchez plunked Yorvit Torrealba on the left shoulder to start the inning
column31: then Headley tripled him home and Hairston followed with a sacrifice fly . 	 Richard allowed six hits in six innings . He owns a 2.05 ERA in four starts against the Giants in 2010 . Bell pitched the ninth for his majors - leading 35th save in 38 chances . He needed nine pitches to get Burrell on a popup for the first out . 	 San Francisco 's starters are winless over their past 10 outings
column32: going 0 - 6 . 	 The Giants acquired Jose Guillen from the Kansas City Royals earlier in the day to be their new right fielder . Guillen was n't due to arrive in the Bay Area until late Friday and Bochy was n't sure he would start Saturday . 	 The Giants lost for the first time in 10 tries while wearing their Friday night orange home jerseys . 	 Game notes 	  Padres RHP Chris Young threw a bullpen session of about 50 pitches . Young went on the disabled list with a strained shoulder on April 12
column33: a move that was retroactive to April 7 . He had arthroscopic surgery last August and has made only one start this season . A simulated game could happen soon and there 's a chance Young could pitch for the Padres in September . ... San Francisco LHP relievers Jeremy Affeldt ( strained oblique ) and Dan Runzler ( dislocated left knee ) both were set to begin rehab outings with Class - A San Jose this weekend . Affeldt allowed two hits and a strikeout in one inning Friday . Runzler will start and pitch an inning Saturday . ... The Giants sold out for the 20th time
column34: topping their 19 sellouts last season . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column35: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column36: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: ST . LOUIS -- Carlos Zambrano may no longer be the Chicago Cubs ' stopper
column2: but he played the role Saturday in a ballpark where he 's had a lot of success . 	 Zambrano won for the first time since his banishment for a dugout tantrum in June
column3: helping the Cubs win for just the third time in 17 games
column5: snapping the Cardinals ' four - game winning streak . 	 " St. Louis has good hitters and any time I face them I have to give a little extra
column6: " Zambrano said . " Today everything was working -- split - finger
column7: my sinker and my slider . " 	 Aramis Ramirez homered on the first pitch he saw after missing three games with sore ribs
column8: and was 2 for 4 . Derrek Lee also hit a solo home run for Chicago . 	 Chris Carpenter ( 13 - 4 ) gave up three runs in six innings . He was 4 - 0 with a 1.79 ERA over his previous six starts . 	 Zambrano ( 4 - 6 ) allowed seven hits in 5 2/3 innings
column9: struck out three and walked two . He is 5 - 0 with a 1.85 ERA for his career at the new Busch Stadium . 	 Carlos Marmol got the final five outs for the save
column10: his 20th in 24 chances but his first since July 26 . 	 St. Louis manager Tony La Russa watched from a private box as he finished up a two - game suspension for his role in a brawl Tuesday at Cincinnati . 	 " You just do n't feel like you 're part of it
column12: " La Russa said . " You 've got a helpless feeling but it makes it look a lot easier from up there than it is from on the field . " 	 Zambrano has had a tough year -- a 5.46 ERA entering the game and a dugout blowup with Lee on June 25 that led to the Cubs placing him on the restricted list . He was solid in his return start at San Francisco on Monday

column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- The San Francisco Giants have had so much trouble beating the San Diego Padres that it took a heady play and a fortunate bounce to pull out an extra - inning win . 	 Buster Posey legged out a double after his slow bouncer caromed off second baseman Jerry Hairston Jr. and then scored the winning run on Juan Uribe 's single in the 11th inning to give the Giants a 3 - 2 win over the Padres on Saturday . 	 " I do n't look at it like I won the game
column2: " Uribe said . " Buster won the game . Getting the double leading off
column3: this guy won the game for us today . " 	 Posey 's hustle
column5: and four tense - but - scoreless innings by the bullpen gave the Giants just their second win in 10 meetings this season with first - place San Diego . 	 San Francisco moved within 2 1/2 games of the Padres and have a chance to win the series when ace Tim Lincecum takes the mound in Sunday 's series finale . 	 " They 've owned us all year
column6: " Giants outfielder Aubrey Huff said . " It seems like we match up well . They just come out on the winning end most of the time . We finally caught some breaks . " 	 Posey created the big break that won this game . He led off the 11th with a bouncer up the middle that just eluded Tim Stauffer ( 3 - 2 ) . Hairston tried to get to the slow roller before it got to the outfield but deflected it into left - center and Posey hustled into second . 	 " I saw it kind of carom off to the left from my angle and figured it was worth taking the chance
column7: " Posey said . " I used what little I had left in the tank . " 	 After Pablo Sandoval was intentionally walked
column8: Uribe blooped a single to right and Posey easily scored setting off a celebration for the sellout crowd . 	 " It was one of those games going back and forth all the time
column9: " Stauffer said . " Both teams had chances to win it . And then their balls found their holes there in that last inning . That was pretty much it . Posey 's hit just found it 's way up the middle and took a tough bounce off the glove and was able to get on second . Then it 's an uphill battle . " 	 Santiago Casilla ( 4 - 2 ) escaped a first - and - third
column10: one - out jam in the 11th by striking out Chase Headley and getting Tony Gwynn to line out to center to earn the win . Casilla extended his scoreless streak to 13 innings . 	 The Padres stranded 16 runners
column11: including the bases loaded in the eighth and two runners each in the ninth
column12: 10th and 11th innings . San Diego had won five straight . 	 " You ca n't overlook the job the bullpen did
column13: " Huff said . " They kept us in the game the whole time . A lot of scary situations that the bullpen got out of to keep us in the game . " 	 The Giants fell behind 2 - 0 early to a sharp Mat Latos and looked poised to fall once again to the Padres . But Sandoval ended Latos ' day with a leadoff homer in the seventh . 	 After Javier Lopez got pinch - hitter Will Venable to ground out with the bases loaded to end the top of the eighth
column14: San Francisco managed to tie it in the bottom half against nemesis Luke Gregerson . 	 Gregerson had allowed four baserunners and no runs in 16 1/3 career innings against the Giants before Mike Fontenot started a rally with a groundball single to right field . He went to third on Huff 's double and scored on Pat Burrell 's RBI groundout . Gregerson escaped with the tie intact
column15: but the Giants still got the win . 	 Latos pitched a one - hitter here in May and looked almost as dominant this start
column16: matching his career high with nine strikeouts . He left after allowing Sandoval 's eighth homer of the season
column17: yielding five hits and no walks in six - plus innings . 	 He threw a career - high 108 pitches and set a franchise record by allowing two or fewer runs in 11 straight starts . 	 " I did n't want him to throw 125 pitches
column18: " manager Bud Black said . " It was just one of those decisions . Take him out and go to our pen . Our pen is best in the National League . " 	 Giants rookie Madison Bumgarner allowed RBI doubles to Headley and Adrian Gonzalez
column19: but kept the Giants in the game . He allowed two runs and eight hits in seven innings . 	 Game notes 	 Jake Peavy had 10 straight starts with two or fewer runs in 2004 for the Padres . ... Newly acquired OF Jose Guillen grounded out as a pinch - hitter in the ninth inning in his debut for the Giants . ... Hall of Famers Tom Seaver and Dave Winfield were at the game . ... Bumgarner needed just three pitches to get out of the third inning despite allowing a leadoff double to Miguel Tejada . Ryan Ludwick lined into an inning - ending double play . ... Giants starters are winless in their last 11 games
column20: recording six losses and five no - decisions . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column21: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
