column1: ATLANTA -- The Braves struggled for eight innings against the Los Angeles Dodgers . They came through in their last at - bat -- again . 	 Atlanta trailed by two after the Dodgers scored two unearned runs in the eighth
column2: but the Braves recovered with three runs in the ninth inning Monday night for their 20th final at - bat victory of the season
column3: the most in the majors . 	 Melky Cabrera 's bases - loaded
column4: two - run single off Octavio Dotel capped the three - run rally that lifted the Braves to a 4 - 3 win over the Dodgers . 	 " We do n't give up
column6: who had a single to start the winning rally . " We 've got a good offense . All those guys took great at - bats . " 	 The Braves lead the majors with 204 runs in the seventh inning or later . 	 Dotel took over for Hong - Chih Kuo ( 3 - 2 )
column7: who failed to protect a 3 - 1 lead . Kuo gave up singles to Gonzalez and Brian McCann before walking Brooks Conrad with one out to load the bases . 	 Dotel walked pinch - hitter David Ross to force in a run . Cabrera then lined the game - winning single on a 3 - 2 count past shortstop Jamey Carroll . Scott Podsednik charged the ball in left field but it skipped past his glove
column8: ending any chance for a potential play at the plate . 	 " He got a good hit
column9: " Dotel said of Cabrera . " I threw a couple pitches close . It did n't go my way . " 	 Cabrera also had a key defensive play when he threw out Ryan Theriot at the plate to end the Dodgers ' two - run eighth inning . Cabrera said he was as happy with his throw as his big hit an inning later . 	 " I was n't trying to win the game
column10: " Cabrera said of his hit . " I was just trying to make contact . " 	 Dotel had 21 saves with Pittsburgh before his July 31 trade to the Dodgers . Manager Joe Torre on Friday removed Jonathan Broxton from the closer 's role
column11: and Kuo earned the save on the Dodgers ' only win in the four - game series . 	 Kuo and Dotel combined to blow the lead . 	 " You certainly have to be shocked by the results out there
column13: noting Kuo needed only seven pitches to retire the Braves in order in the eighth . 	 " We were going to have him finish it
column14: " Torre said of Kuo . 	 " I must admit that as a manager you want every inning to be like the eighth . But you can never sit back and relax when you have just a one or two - run lead . " 	 The first - place Braves moved 2 1/2 games ahead of Philadelphia in the NL East . 	 Braves starting pitcher Tommy Hanson said the team 's habit of final at - bat wins breeds confidence . 	 " It almost feels like we 're going to win the game
column15: " Hanson said . 	 Peter Moylan ( 4 - 2 ) pitched a perfect ninth for Atlanta . 	 Los Angeles right - hander Chad Billingsley gave up five hits and one run in seven innings . 	 Hanson was equally strong
column16: also giving up five hits and a run in seven innings before the Dodgers took the lead with two unearned runs in the eighth off Jonny Venters with help from a throwing error by Conrad . 	 Conrad
column17: who has made five straight starts at third base since Chipper Jones ' season - ending knee injury
column18: bobbled pinch - hitter Reed Johnson 's grounder to open the eighth . The grounder took a bad hop at the edge of the grass
column19: and the initial call of an error was changed to a hit at the end of the inning . 	 After Podsednik walked
column20: Theriot hit a soft grounder toward third base . Conrad charged the ball and threw wide of first baseman Troy Glaus for an error
column21: allowing Johnson and Podsednik to score . 	 Theriot advanced to third base as right fielder Jason Heyward chased down Conrad 's wild throw . Cabrera threw out Theriot at the plate on James Loney 's fly ball to end the inning . 	 " I definitely should have made both those plays
column22: " Conrad said . " I felt terrible . " 	 The Dodgers took a 1 - 0 lead in the first . With one out
column23: Theriot reached on a single . Theriot
column25: scored from first on Andre Ethier 's double to left . 	 Billingsley did not allow a baserunner to reach third before Omar Infante ended a nine - pitch at - bat with a triple to center field leading off the sixth . Infante scored when Ethier made a leaping catch of Heyward 's drive in front of the right - field wall . 	 Much of the game was played in rain which began in the fourth inning . column2: Fla. -- Jason Bartlett beating an ill - advised throw to second base keyed Tampa Bay 's comeback win over Cliff Lee . 	 Carlos Pena hit a tiebreaking single during a four - run eighth inning and the Rays rallied to beat Lee and the Texas Rangers 6 - 4 on Monday night in a potential playoff preview . 	 Rangers second baseman Joaquin Arias could n't track down B.J. Upton 's one - out bloop double that started the Rays ' late rally . Bartlett reached on an infield single and easily beat Arias ' throw to second on Carl Crawford 's fielder 's choice grounder . 	 " We did n't catch the popup
column3: we did n't get the out when we should have got it
column4: " Rangers manager Ron Washington said . " There were too many outs that were supposed to be outs that did n't happen and that was the game right there . " 	 Tampa Bay moved into a tie for first place in the AL East with the New York Yankees
column5: who lost 3 - 1 to Detroit . The Rays own a 5 1/2 - game cushion in the wild - card standings . 	 " It was kind of a nice win
column6: was n't it ? " Rays manager Joe Maddon said . " Throughout all that good stuff
column7: the one thing I really want to point out is Jason Bartlett beating the force play at second . That was the biggest event for us to win that baseball game . " 	 Lee outlasted David Price in a marquee matchup of All - Star aces and was given a late lead when Texas scored twice in the top of the eighth to go up 4 - 2 . But Crawford hit a run - scoring grounder and Evan Longoria tied it with a single before Pena
column9: made it 5 - 4 . 	 Ben Zobrist added an RBI single that chased Lee ( 10 - 6 ) . 	 " It was kind of a blur of an inning
column10: " Lee said . " Things kind of fell apart . I do n't know why . It was a strange inning . " 	 The left - hander allowed six runs
column11: nine hits and one walk while striking out 10 over 7 2/3 innings . He has lost all three of his starts against Tampa Bay this season . 	 Price got a no - decision in his bid to become the AL 's first 16 - game winner
column12: giving up two runs and five hits in six - plus innings . The hard - throwing lefty struck out eight and walked five . 	 The matchup between Lee and Price marked the first time two pitchers with 10 or more wins and ERAs under 3.00 faced each other at Tropicana Field
column13: which opened in 1998 . The announced crowd was just 18
column14: 319 for the opener of a three - game series . 	 Texas has an eight - game lead in the AL West . 	 Rangers third baseman Michael Young left after six innings with neck stiffness and will have his playing status evaluated Tuesday . Young first felt the discomfort when he woke up Monday . 	 Lance Cormier ( 4 - 3 ) got the final out in the eighth before Rafael Soriano pitched the ninth for his 34th save . 	 Texas scored twice in the eighth for a 4 - 2 lead . Arias tripled and scored when Vladimir Guerrero hit into a double play . Bengie Molina added an RBI single . 	 Pena drew just the 10th walk -- and first to a left - handed hitter -- issued this season by Lee
column15: and Sean Rodriguez singled in the fifth . Willy Aybar later put the Rays up 2 - 0 on a bloop single to right over a drawn - in infield . 	 Lee retired 11 in a row before Crawford singled with two outs in the fourth . 	 Molina had a strange leadoff double during a two - run seventh that resulted in a 57 - second delay for an umpire review . Crawford tried to climb the left - field fence in what appeared to be an attempt to take away a homer
column16: but ended up about 10 feet away from where the ball hit off the wall . 	 David Murphy ended Price 's night with walk before Chad Qualls loaded the bases with another walk to Brandon Boggs . After a run scored on pinch - hitter Mitch Moreland 's double play
column17: Elvis Andrus tied it at 2 with an RBI infield single . 	 Price worked out of a bases - loaded
column18: two - out jam in the sixth by striking out Jorge Cantu . Guerrero had an infield single to second in the inning that hit Rodriguez just below the collarbone and then got briefly lodged in the infielder 's uniform . 	 " I was just trying to make sure I kept it in front of me knowing that there 's a guy on second at the time
column19: " said Rodriguez
column20: who still had a red spot after the game from where the ball struck him . " Sure enough it hit me . I looked down and could see it was rolling down my shirt . It 's frustrating
column21: but Price struck out the next guy . column1: CHICAGO -- Kevin Correia knows firsthand how big his RBI double was . 	 Correia pitched six scoreless innings and hit a rare RBI double
column2: leading the San Diego Padres to a 9 - 5 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Monday night . 	 Miguel Tejada was 4 for 5 with a double and two RBIs and Chris Denorfia added three hits for the NL West - leading Padres
column3: who have won seven of eight and moved four games ahead of second - place San Francisco . 	 After taking two of three from the Giants last weekend
column4: the Padres won behind another strong showing from of one of their starters . 	 Correia ( 10 - 7 ) allowed five hits and struck out five with one walk . After giving up four hits in the first two innings
column5: he settled down to retire his last eight batters and became the fourth Padres starting pitcher to win at least 10 games this season . 	 Correia also gave the Padres a lead that they would never give up . 	 Cubs starter Tom Gorzelanny retired the first two batters in the fifth but allowed a single to Denorfia before Correia helped himself with a double down the left - field line . Denorfia scored from first
column6: just beating the relay throw to give the Padres a 1 - 0 lead . 	 " It 's a 0 - 0 game . As a pitcher giving up an RBI to the pitcher when you 're about to get out of the inning really hurts . I know the feeling
column7: " Correia said . 	 Correia came into the game with a .108 batting average and only two doubles in 176 major league at - bats . 	 The right - hander also escaped a major jam in the first and improved to 5 - 1 since the All - Star break with a 3.00 ERA in six starts . 	 " I feel like I came back from the All - Star break with a better mental state . Attacking the second half and really going out there fighting . Once I got my fastball command back it 's kind of when I started pitching well
column8: " Correia said . 	 The usually dependable San Diego bullpen struggled
column10: yielding two runs in the seventh and three in the eighth . It took five relievers to secure the win . Mike Adams got one out in the eighth and closer Heath Bell finished up with a perfect ninth . 	 Alfonso Soriano hit an RBI double in the eighth and Blake Dewitt followed with a two - run homer for the Cubs
column11: who have lost seven of eight at home . 	 Gorzelanny ( 6 - 7 ) was tagged for five runs and nine hits in 6 1/3 innings . He did n't allow a hit until a leadoff single by Tejada in the fourth . 	 " We put so many high hopes on our team in spring
column13: knowing the talent we have on this team it 's tough . This is not what we expected out of this team . This is an unfortunate year but there is still a lot of baseball to be played and there is still a lot of good things that can be done from this team
column14: " Gorzelanny said . 	 The Padres helped Correia in the next two innings . Tejada led off the sixth with a single and advanced to third on Adrian Gonzalez 's single . Ryan Ludwick followed with a sacrifice fly . 	 In the seventh
column15: Tony Gwynn Jr. pinch - hit for Correia and reached safely on a bunt . Gwynn stole second and scored on Tejada 's double . Gonzalez chased Gorzelanny with an RBI single . After a walk to Yorvit Torrealba
column16: Cubs reliever Justin Berg gave up an RBI single to Chase Headley that gave the Padres a 5 - 0 lead . 	 " I think we 've all seen Miggie [ Tejada ] now . He 's a professional hitter . Really knows his swing . He has a great approach . Hits all pitches and hits good pitching
column17: " Padres manager Bud Black said . 	 Kosuke Fukudome had a two - run double for Chicago in the seventh

column1: HOUSTON -- With Francisco Rodriguez out for the season
column2: the New York Mets were n't sure who their new closer would be entering Monday night 's game . 	 After the performance Hisanori Takahashi delivered for his first career save
column3: he may have won the job . 	 Carlos Beltran homered and the Mets took the lead in the ninth inning on a wild pitch by Houston closer Matt Lindstrom in a 3 - 1 win over the Astros . 	 Takahashi worked a perfect ninth
column4: filling in as closer on the day the Mets learned K - Rod will miss the rest of the year . The four - time All - Star needs season - ending surgery on a torn thumb ligament in his pitching hand sustained during a fight with his girlfriend 's father at Citi Field last week . column12: apparently signaling the ball in play . Jackson
column14: watched with his back against the wall as the ball bounced toward the infield while Bautista raced around the bases for what was initially ruled an inside - the - park home run . 	 Replays showed the ball clearly hitting the yellow foul pole
column15: and official scorer Michael Duca met with officials from both teams during the game then spoke with the umpiring crew after Toronto 's 3 - 2 victory before changing the ruling to a normal home run . 	 " It was probably out of the ballpark
column16: " Blue Jays manager Cito Gaston said . " I 'd like to see it stay as an inside - the - parker . That would mean he has two this year . column1: BALTIMORE -- A pitching duel between an up - and - coming lefty and a veteran right - hander was decided by a utility player in the role of emergency starter . 	 Luke French took a one - hitter into the eighth inning
column2: Matt Tuiasosopo homered and had a career - high four RBIs and the Seattle Mariners beat Kevin Millwood and the Baltimore Orioles 4 - 0 on Tuesday night . column3: who was a late scratch with a severe headache . 	 " I just wanted to go out there and ... find a way offensively or defensively to help this team win a game . Just be loose and have fun

column8: now 5 - 3 since taking over for Don Wakamatsu

" 	 French ( 2 - 3 ) allowed two walks and no hits over the first five innings . The left - hander got the first out of the sixth before rookie Josh Bell bounced a single to left . 	 Losing the no - hitter was n't a big issue

column1: PHILADELPHIA -- Charlie Manuel could n't stop chuckling . 	 The Philadelphia Phillies
column2: depleted by injuries to star players throughout the year
column3: now are alone atop the NL wild - card standings . 	 What 's their manager think about that ? 	 " We do n't care about the wild card
column4: " Manuel said . 	 Roy Oswalt pitched seven sharp innings
column5: Placido Polanco had four hits and Philadelphia beat the San Francisco Giants 9 - 3 on Tuesday night . 	 The Phillies took a one - game lead over San Francisco in the wild - card race . The two - time NL champions remained 2 1/2 games behind Atlanta in the East . 	 " We 're trying to win our division
column7: shrugging off the wild card . 	 Pat Burrell homered in his first regular - season game at Citizens Bank Park since leading the victory parade down Broad Street after the Phillies won the 2008 World Series . Jose Guillen also connected for the Giants . 	 All - Star second baseman Chase Utley went 0 - for-5 in his return to Philadelphia 's lineup after having thumb surgery on July 1 . 	 " I felt pretty good
column9: there 's room for improvement . " 	 Oswalt ( 8 - 13 ) allowed three runs and six hits
column10: striking out seven . The three - time All - Star is 2 - 1 in four starts since the Phillies acquired him from Houston . 	 He came here to pitch in big games
column11: and delivered with another strong outing . Oswalt was 0 - 3 with a 3.15 ERA in three starts against the Giants with the Astros . 	 " This is what I miss
column12: " he said about pitching in a playoff race . " In ' 05
column13: we got to do that in Houston . Hopefully something magical will happen this season and we get back to the World Series . " 	 Barry Zito ( 8 - 7 ) struggled after a strong start and ended up allowing four runs and eight hits in five - plus innings . 	 " He was doing well
column14: " manager Bruce Bochy said . " He made a mistake on [ Jimmy ] Rollins ' hit then got a ball up the next inning . " 	 Burrell
column15: who had a love - hate relationship with fans during nine seasons in Philadelphia

column17: " he said before the game . 	 Utley also received a standing ovation when he came up in the first . He was expected to miss at least eight weeks after tearing a ligament in his right thumb . 	 Zito baffled the Phillies over four innings with an assortment of offspeed pitches
column18: including a slow curve clocked at 70 mph . But the lefty could n't get out of the sixth . 	 Polanco led off the inning with a single and Jayson Werth lined a double to left . Shane Victorino followed with a two - run double to left - center
column19: putting the Phillies up 4 - 2 . 	 Guillen crushed a solo shot to left to cut it to 4 - 3 in the seventh . 	 Carlos Ruiz hit a two - run double off Chris Ray during a five - run eighth that put the game out of reach . 	 Bochy was ejected for arguing a balk call by Ramon Ramirez that allowed the eighth run to score . 	 Rollins lined a two - run single to center to tie it at 2 in the fifth . 	 " There 's so much baseball to play
column20: " Rollins said . " Only sure way in [ the playoffs ] is to win the division . Our goal is to win as many as we can . It 's still pretty early to focus on the wild card . " 	 Game notes 	  Phillies All - Star 1B Ryan Howard is " getting close " to returning

column1: PITTSBURGH -- Ricky Nolasco used his arm and bat to help the Florida Marlins have fun again . 	 Nolasco pitched six shutout innings for the second consecutive start and added two hits and two RBIs as the Marlins snapped a four - game losing streak with a 6 - 0 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Tuesday night . 	 " Our intensity and our competitiveness was at a different level tonight
column2: and I think our level of having fun was at a higher level
column5: who was vocal during a closed - door
column6: players - only meeting after a 7 - 1 loss to Pittsburgh on Monday . " I think everybody showed up with a different attitude today . Everyone was smiling all day . I think we came out with a much higher level of intensity . " 	 Nolasco ( 14 - 8) extended his road winning streak to seven games and won for the fifth time in six starts overall . He allowed five hits -- all singles -- and a walk with nine strikeouts . 	 " Whenever he can throw his breaking ball for a strike in any count
column7: we pretty much know early on he 's going to have a good game
column8: " Marlins manager Edwin Rodriguez said . " That 's what happened tonight . " 	 Nolasco
column10: also snapped Florida 's streak of 34 hitless at - bats with runners in scoring position with a fifth - inning RBI single . 	 That scored Wes Helms to break a scoreless tie and was the first of four consecutive singles

column14: and we were able to get rolling and keep it going . " 	 Jose Tabata and Pedro Alvarez each had two hits for Pittsburgh
column15: which has lost eight of nine and was shut out for the 13th time this season . 	 The second Pittsburgh batter of the game

column19: and he chased it and I got the strikeout
column20: " Nolasco said . " That obviously was probably the biggest pitch of the game . " 	 The first two batters of the next inning singled
column21: but Jose Veras induced Ryan Doumit to fly out on his first pitch and got Chris Snyder to ground into a double play . 	 Veras clenched his fists and raised his arms while walking off the mound . 	 " I just think that people were having a lot more fun playing
column22: " Sanchez said . " We had just been flat
column24: and I felt like today there definitely was a lot more energy
column25: with guys talking and going around . It definitely showed . " 	 Pirates starter Zach Duke ( 5 - 12 ) had allowed only three hits through the first four innings until the four - run fifth . 	 " That 's hurt him this year
column26: getting into those innings he ca n't get out of
column27: " Pirates manager John Russell said . " He was going along pretty well until that inning . " 	 Nolasco drove in another run the following inning with a two - out double to the same vicinity as his first hit . 	 " The intensity was there
column28: " Rodriguez said . " The desire was there . It was good to see . " 	 Despite spending nearly a month on the disabled list

column1: ATLANTA -- Mike Minor had already dressed and turned to talk with the media when his new teammates saluted his first big league win . 	 How 'bout a beer shower
column2: rookie ? 	 If Minor and the Braves keep this up
column3: it wo n't be the last time they 're getting doused . 	 Little - used Diory Hernandez sparked Atlanta with a pinch - hit homer
column4: All - Star Martin Prado returned from the disabled list with three hits and Minor claimed his first big league win
column5: 10 - 2 over the Washington Nationals on Tuesday night . 	 Minor ( 1 - 0 ) was rewarded with four cans of beers poured on his head
column8: David Ross and Billy Wagner . 	 " That 's OK
column9: " Minor said . " Hopefully there will be more of these to come . Hopefully I can get some other guys down the road . " 	 Atlanta maintained its 2 1/2 - game lead in the NL East on Philadelphia
column10: which defeated San Francisco 9 - 3 . 	 Coming off their majors - best 20th victory on the final swing
column11: the Braves did n't need any dramatics in the opener of a series against the lowly Nationals . Still
column12: in keeping with the theme of a surprising season
column13: some unlikely players contributed to Atlanta 's sixth win in seven games . 	 Like Hernandez
column14: who had batted only twice since coming up from the minors on Aug. 2 . With the Braves trailing 2 - 0
column15: he led off the sixth batting for Minor and came through with his second career homer . 	 Like Matt Diaz
column16: who had a two - run double that put the Braves ahead for good while making a rare appearance in the cleanup spot . 	 Like Minor
column17: the Braves ' first - round pick last year but only pitching in the majors this soon because Kris Medlen went down with a season - ending injury . 	 " It 's been a year like that
column18: " Diaz said . " It 's a different guy every night . It 's got that feel " like something special is happening . 	 Now
column19: if the fans of Atlanta would only take notice . Even with the Braves contending for their first playoff appearance since 2005
column21: 911 turned out at Turner Field -- by the far the smallest home crowd of the season . 	 Minor pitched well in his second career start but was trailing when he left
column22: having surrendered two runs to the Nationals in the sixth to ruin a scoreless duel . 	 " I was really upset
column23: " he said . " I felt like I pitched OK
column24: but those two runs killed me . " 	 He was n't upset for long . Hernandez 's second career homer -- and first hit in the majors this season -- seemed to rattle Scott Olsen ( 3 - 5 ) . He gave up just one hit over the first five innings
column25: but did n't get an out in the sixth . 	 Omar Infante tripled to the gap in right - center and Jason Heyward walked
column26: prompting manager Jim Riggleman to call in right - hander Joel Peralta . That move backfired when Prado
column27: who had been on the DL since breaking his right pinky on a slide July 30
column28: doubled into the right - field corner to bring home the tying run . 	 Diaz
column29: hitting cleanup even with a .232 average and just five homers
column30: followed with another double into the left - field corner to bring home both runners . Olsen was charged with three runs and blew off reporters after the game
column31: apparently upset about getting yanked so soon by Riggleman . 	 " I thought our only chance to get out of the inning was to put a right - hander on Prado and Diaz
column32: " the manager said . " It was n't going the way we wanted it to go . As good as [ Olsen ] had been
column33: it got away from him real quickly . " 	 The Braves blew it open with four more runs in the seventh
column34: taking advantage of two Washington errors and a botched grounder that was charitably scored a hit . Prado picked up his second RBI with a single and Melky Cabrera blooped a two - run double to short left field . 	 The Nationals grabbed their short - lived lead with a pair of clutch hits off Minor . With two outs
column35: Wil Nieves lined a double just inside the third - base bag to put the Nationals ahead
column36: and Mike Morse extended the lead with a double to the gap in left - center . 	 Nieves was only in the game because Ivan Rodriguez never got a chance to put on his catching gear . 	 Pudge was ejected in the top of the first
column37: apparently for slamming his bat over a disputed strikeout that left two runners stranded . 	 Game notes 	  The Braves signed 37 of their 51 picks in the amateur draft before Monday 's midnight deadline

column2: Fla. -- Matt Garza stopped a short skid that followed his big night . 	 The right - hander scattered five hits over seven scoreless innings for his first win since pitching a no - hitter late last month and the Tampa Bay Rays beat the Texas Rangers 10 - 1 on Tuesday night . 	 " It 's great
column3: but the biggest thing is that we won
column4: " Garza said . 	 Garza ( 12 - 7 ) went 0 - 2 in three starts after throwing Tampa Bay 's first no - hitter in a 5 - 0 victory over Detroit on July 26 . 	 " He fought his delivery a little bit early on
column6: " Rays manager Joe Maddon said . " I just thought he was throwing the ball better as the game went deeper . He could have gone farther into that game
column7: there 's no question . There was no need to . " 	 Garza
column8: who had 10 strikeouts and two walks
column9: struck out AL batting leader Josh Hamilton with runners on second and third to end the third . 	 " Garza made us look flat
column10: " Texas manager Ron Washington said . " You 've got to give credit where credit is due . I did n't think he had his real best stuff
column11: but he made pitches when he had to . " 	 Evan Longoria came within a homer of the cycle and had three RBIs for the Rays
column12: who have won the first two games of the three - game series in a potential playoff matchup . The victory gave Maddon his 400th career win . 	 Carl Crawford also drove in three runs
column13: including a two - run homer during a five - run seventh that extended the Rays ' lead to 10 - 0 . Tampa Bay is tied for first place in the AL East with the New York Yankees
column14: a 6 - 2 winner over Detroit . 	 The AL West - leading Rangers remained eight games ahead of the Los Angeles Angels
column15: who were beaten 6 - 0 by the Boston Red Sox . David Murphy had a run - scoring single in the eighth . 	 Rangers third baseman Michael Young was out of the lineup due to a stiff neck . He left Monday night 's 6 - 4 loss to the Rays after six innings
column16: but Washington said Young could start Wednesday . 	 Crawford and Longoria hit consecutive RBI triples
column17: and Carlos Pena drove in a run with a double off Tommy Hunter ( 9 - 2 ) as the Rays took a 3 - 0 lead in the first . Crawford 's triple was the 100th of his career
column18: which made the 29 - year - old the youngest player to reach that total since Stan Musial ( 28 years
column19: 8 months ) in 1949 . 	 " It 's a real cool thing
column20: " Crawford said . " You like to be in the company with guys like that . " 	 Longoria made it 5 - 0 with a two - run double in the fourth . 	 Hunter allowed four runs and six hits over three - plus innings . The right - hander was pitching on three days ' rest after lasting just three innings in his previous start Friday because of a stomach virus . 	 Hunter threw 63 of his 83 pitches -- including 38 in the first -- through two innings . He stayed in the game after taking Crawford 's second - inning single off his right hand . 	 " He 's healthy
column21: " Washington said . " It 's one of those nights . He kept the ball out over the plate and they did n't miss it . It happens . " 	 Tampa Bay 's Jason Bartlett
column22: running toward second on John Jaso 's bunt in the fourth
column23: collided hard with Rangers second baseman Andres Blanco
column24: but both were able to stay in the game . 	 Game notes 	  Crawford is the 15th player since 1900 to have at least 100 triples and 400 steals . ... Texas plans to recall LHP Derek Holland from Triple - A Oklahoma City to start Wednesday 's game against the Rays . ... OF Josh Sale
column25: the Rays ' first pick in the 2010 draft
column26: was at the game . He will report to the team 's complex in Port Charlotte later this week and will participate in the Florida instructional league that begins next month . ... RHP Luke Jackson
column27: who agreed to a contract Monday with the Rangers
column28: will join the team 's rookie - level club in the Arizona League . He was selected 45th overall in the June draft . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column2: Padres manager Bud Black thought Jon Garland 's impressive outing was going to be ruined . 	 Garland pitched seven innings and Jerry Hairston Jr. scored the game 's only run and the San Diego Padres beat the Chicago Cubs 1 - 0 on Tuesday night . 	 The NL West - leading Padres won for the eighth time in nine games and moved five games ahead of the second - place San Francisco Giants . 	 Heath Bell pitched a scoreless ninth for his major league - leading 36th save in 39 opportunities
column3: but not before nearly allowing a game - ending two - run home run in the ninth to Blake DeWitt . 	 After allowing a leadoff single to Aramis Ramirez
column4: Bell struck out the next two batters . DeWitt followed a long fly ball to right and Ryan Ludwick went into the ivy and ended the game with a leaping catch . 	 " There 's a moment that you say ' Oh no . ' But then you track the ball and watch the outfielder there 's a moment things look good and then the ball is in his glove
column5: " said Black . 	 Ludwick felt good the whole way and knew he would have room to make the catch . 	 " I got to the track out there . I think I had three steps on it [ wall ]
column6: so I knew it was coming up . But I also saw where the flight of the ball was
column7: so I knew I had room . It was just a matter of catching it
column9: who was traded to Cubs on July 31
column10: had faced Bell when he was a member of the Dodgers . 	 " You 're kind of looking for a ball up . Bell 's reputation he is a great closer
column12: you 're looking for a pitch that you can hit hard somewhere . I was just trying to keep the inning alive and move the runner
column13: " said DeWitt . " It was a tough night
column16: who also had a hit taken away from him in the fourth inning with a runner on third by a diving catch by left fielder Will Venable . 	 Garland ( 12 - 8) allowed four hits and pitched around three walks with three strikeouts . He retired the last 12 batters he faced . He surpassed his win total from last season . The right - hander has pitched 17 scoreless innings dating to three starts . He has only allowed five hits in his last 12 innings . 	 " He 's one of those guys as the game goes along he gets into a groove . I ca n't explain it . There 's a rhythm to pitching . Jon 's one of those guys as the game progresses he finds his rhythm
column17: " said Black . 	 Garland said the key to his success is getting ahead of hitters . 	 " When you get ahead of big league hitters
column18: I do n't want to say it makes them uneasy
column19: but they ca n't lock on one pitch
column21: " Garland said . 	 The Padres
column22: who had just three hits in the game
column23: improved to a season - high 24 games over .500 ( 71 - 47 ) . 	 The Cubs have lost eight of its last nine home games . 	 Padres reliever Mike Adams pitched out of trouble in the eighth . With runners on first and second and one out
column24: he induced Marlon Byrd to ground into a double play . 	 Cubs starter Randy Wells ( 5 - 11 )
column25: who allowed six earned runs in his last start at San Francisco
column26: rebounded to pitch seven strong innings . He allowed one run and three hits
column27: struck out six and walked three and hit a batter . Hairston led off the game with a single and advanced to second on Miguel Tejada 's walk . One out later
column28: Wells hit Ludwick to load the bases . Hairston scored on Chase Headley 's groundout . 	 " I came in a little too amped up . I was trying to establish the sinker early and missed it a couple of times
column29: " said Wells . 	 Wells is hoping he can improve in the final month and half to put himself in position to earn a spot in next season 's starting rotation . 	 " They are big for me . You want to put yourself in contention for next year . They 're showcasing a lot of young guys up here
column30: a lot of guys are deserving of a job
column31: you have to show you can pitch and hopefully put yourself in contention
column32: " Wells said . 	 Game notes 	  Cubs 1B Derrek Lee missed his second game with a bulging disc in his back . He is listed as day to day . ... Padres 2B David Eckstein is expected to begin a rehab assignment with Single - A Fort Wayne on Wednesday . He has been on the DL with a right calf strain since July 21 . column1: HOUSTON -- The Houston Astros could n't string much together against Johan Santana . 	 Hunter Pence made sure they did n't really need to . 	 Pence had a three - run homer in the first inning and his go - ahead solo shot in the eighth inning propelled the Houston Astros to a 4 - 3 win over the New York Mets on Tuesday night . 	 The game was tied at 3 - 3 before Pence 's shot to left field off Santana ( 10 - 7 ) put Houston on top . 	 " Once I got 0 - 2
column3: you have to shorten up and find a way to see if you can battle him and fight
column6: I fouled off a really tough pitch 0 - 2
column7: the first pitch he threw me . From there
column8: I was ready to swing . Whatever the last pitch was I 'm not sure
column9: I found a way to get a swing on it and put it in play . " 	 Santana was disappointed he let the win get away . 	 " I knew that in this ballpark you have to throw the right pitch
column10: " he said . " If you put the ball in play it has a very good chance to be a homer and that was the case . He just put enough swing to hit it out . That 's the nature of this ballpark . " 	 David Wright hit a solo home run in the eighth inning for his first RBI since July 31st to tie it at 3 - all . Wright 's homer
column12: was to left field . 	 Pence gave Houston an early lead with a three - run home run to left field in the first inning . That home run broke a streak of 16 1/3 scoreless innings for Santana ( 10 - 7 ) . 	 " He 's been hitting the ball real well for the last week
column13: " Houston manager Brad Mills said of Pence . " Anytime you get your number three hitter doing that
column14: something is going to happen . " 	 Santana allowed nine hits and four runs with seven strikeouts in his first outing since throwing a four - hitter in a 4 - 0 win over the Rockies . Once an Astros minor league prospect
column15: Santana went eight innings for his 12th career complete game and third this season . 	 " A little struggle there at the beginning
column16: gave up the three runs
column17: and then settled in and pitched very well
column18: " Mets manager Jerry Manuel said . " We felt very good with him going back out there . " 	 Wilton Lopez got his first save
column19: retiring Jose Reyes on a foul out down the left field line with the tying run on second . 	 " I was pretty excited to save the game
column20: " Lopez said in Spanish . " I was happy . Anytime I need to pitch an inning
column21: I do the best I can . " 	 Michael Bourn and Angel Sanchez hit back - to - back singles to set up Pence 's first homer . Carlos Lee doubled when Fernando Martinez missed his fly ball to left field
column22: but Santana retired the next three Astros to get out of the inning . 	 Josh Thole singled in the second before a double by Santana with one out in the second inning . A groundout by Reyes sent Thole home to get New York within 3 - 2 . 	 Reyes hit a leadoff single and advanced to second on a passed ball . He scored on a single to center field by Martinez to make it 1 - 0 in the first inning . 	 Nelson Figueroa
column23: who had his start pushed back from Saturday because of migraine - like symptoms
column24: allowed four hits and two runs in five innings . It was his first start this season for the Astros . 	 " I threw a lot more pitches than I wanted to throw in such a short amount of time
column25: " Figueroa said . " For my first start
column26: I 'll take it . I put us in a position to win
column27: and Hunter Pence did the rest . " 	 Santana gave up a double to Geoff Blum with one out in the fourth inning before retiring the next nine batters . The next hit came on a ground - rule double by Jason Castro that landed just inside the right field line with one out in the seventh inning . He walked Jason Michaels before Bourn grounded into a double play to end the inning . 	 Game notes 	  The Mets announced on Tuesday that they are withholding injured closer Francisco Rodriguez 's salary while he 's not playing . Rodriguez was placed on the disqualified list six days after he tore a ligament in the thumb of his pitching hand while punching his girlfriend 's father outside a family lounge at Citi Field . Rodriguez had surgery Tuesday to repair the self - inflicted injury and is expected to miss the rest of the season . ... column2: Mo. -- Zack Greinke has eight wins and Joakim Soria has saved seven of them . That does n't mean Greinke likes to heap praise on the All - Star closer . 	 Greinke pitched six strong innings
column3: Soria earned his 34th save and the Kansas City Royals beat the Cleveland Indians 2 - 1 on Tuesday night behind home runs from Wilson Betemit and Yuniesky Betancourt . 	 " I always tell him how bad he is
column4: " Greinke said about Soria and laughed . " How he 's not good enough to be a starter and that he does n't throw hard . That he signed a bad contract . I just never give him credit for anything . I tell him his curveball and changeup are going to get hit soon . " 	 Greinke ( 8 - 11 )
column5: who won the 2009 AL Cy Young Award
column6: is 7 - 3 in his past 12 starts after starting the season 1 - 8 . He held the Indians to one run and five hits over six innings
column7: lowering his ERA to 3.90 . 	 Soria worked around a leadoff single by Michael Brantley in the ninth to tie for the AL lead in saves . The right - hander has converted 27 consecutive chances since a blown save May 6 at Texas . 	 With Brantley on second and one out
column8: Soria struck out Shin - Soo Choo and Travis Hafner looking . Indians manager Manny Acta disagreed with the strike three calls by umpire Kerwin Danley . 	 " Both were way off the plate
column9: " Acta said . " Those guys do a good job and you are n't supposed to criticize them
column10: but sometimes you wonder . It 's the No . 3 and cleanup hitters . Basically
column11: you feel like they took the bat out of their hands . They should let those two guys battle -- the closer against one of those guys . I hope he sees it after the game . It 's not fair . " 	 The Indians wasted several scoring opportunities
column12: stranding 12 and going 1 - for-9 with runners in scoring position . 	 " I ca n't do anything if the umpire calls them strikes
column13: " Choo said . " If I swing at that pitch
column14: it 's a foul ball . I ca n't change anything about it . It 's in the past already . " 	 Betancourt homered
column16: to left in the fifth to tie the score at 1 . Betemit put the Royals ahead to stay by leading off the sixth with his sixth home run
column17: which landed in the back of the Royals ' bullpen . 	 " The two homers was about all we needed
column18: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " Zack struggled with his command . He was getting his pitches down . If you 're going to miss
column19: that 's the place to miss . His stuff was really
column20: really good . He gave up only one run and he pitched out of a jam . " 	 The Royals have scored three runs in their past two games and won both . 	 " We kind of go in spurts
column21: " Greinke said . " We 've been pitching good lately . Most of the year
column22: we 've been hitting and not really pitching good . Right now
column23: we 're pitching good . " 	 Indians rookie right - hander Jeanmar Gomez ( 3 - 1 ) was handed his first loss in five big league starts . Gomez allowed seven hits in six innings . 	 " My sinker was good
column24: " Gomez said . " I made a couple of mistakes . They were both homers
column25: both on sinkers . " 	 Hafner
column26: who came off the disabled list Sunday
column27: led off the Cleveland second with a double
column28: stopped at third on Jayson Nix 's single and scored on Matt LaPorta 's groundout . 	 Jesse Chavez
column29: who replaced Greinke
column30: walked the bases loaded with two outs in the seventh before striking out Nix to end the inning . 	 Hafner led off the sixth with a walk and stopped at third on Trevor Crowe 's one - out double . Greinke retired LaPorta on a grounder to third and Jason Donald on a fly to right to strand the runners . 	 Game notes 	  Royals right - hander Brian Bannister

column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- Jim Thome slapped hands with both base coaches about as hard as he hit the winning home run . With childlike enthusiasm
column2: he chucked his helmet so high the home plate umpire had to backpedal to avoid it . 	 By giving the Minnesota Twins a big victory over the Chicago White Sox
column3: Thome 's 581st career homer was as satisfying as any of those before it . 	 Thome 's two - run shot in the bottom of the 10th inning -- against the team that decided not to bring him back this season -- sent the Twins to a 7 - 6 win over the White Sox on Tuesday night to stretch their AL Central lead to four games . 	 " We brought Thome in here for a reason
column6: who recalled Thome 's declaration on the bench he was going to come through with a clutch hit . 	 " We were just having fun
column8: even with his 40th birthday beckoning later this month
column9: Thome is still enjoying this game like a rookie . 	 " That never gets old
column12: but for a little bit here you cherish that moment . " 	 After Delmon Young 's leadoff single against Matt Thornton ( 3 - 4 )
column13: Thome smashed an 0 - 1 fastball and sent it sailing an estimated 445 feet over the right - field bleachers to send his new team and the fans at sold - out Target Field into a frenzy . He got the obligatory head - slapping at home plate and shaving - cream pie during the post - game interview . 	 " Any time you play your ex - team
column14: you obviously want to do well
column15: " Thome said . 	 Alexei Ramirez hit the tying home run in the ninth inning and the go - ahead RBI single in the 10th
column16: as Twins relievers Matt Capps and Jon Rauch gave up three hits each in the last two innings . Ron Mahay ( 1 - 1 ) was the winner . 	 Paul Konerko
column17: who earlier became the second player in the league to reach 30 homers this season
column18: grounded into a double play after the White Sox loaded the bases in the ninth following Ramirez 's homer . 	 White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen insisted before the game the Twins do n't have a mental edge over his team
column19: but they 're on some impressive runs against the Sox : 20 - 6 overall and 12 - 4 at home . 	 How will the Sox overcome the latest devastating loss ? They 've blown five games since the All - Star break with a lead in the eighth inning or later . 	 " Have a couple of drinks and come back tomorrow and fight
column20: " Guillen said . 	 The Twins are 23 - 7 in their last 30 games
column21: and the White Sox are 15 - 16 in their last 31 . The teams have just five more meetings this year . 	 " I will take that matchup again
column22: " Guillen said . 	 Thornton would too . 	 " The only thing that stings is the fact that our offense battled all night and we could n't pull it out
column23: " he said . " That 's the only thing that hurts for me . It does n't matter who hit the home run . " 	 White Sox starter John Danks recovered from a four - run first inning to finish seven frames
column24: and the Twins had two runners -- including Thome -- thrown out at the plate . Young 's fifth - inning homer gave them the lead back at 6 - 5 . 	 Chicago 's relievers have given up 18 earned runs in their last 20 2/3 innings . That 's not the way to climb back in the race . 	 " We know we can do it . We 've had some really good runs this year
column25: " Thornton said . " We 've just had about a two week period where we 're not playing very good baseball . It 's just a matter of getting back in the groove . " 	 Minnesota 's bullpen was cruising until Capps came in
column26: retiring 10 of 11 batters in relief of Scott Baker . Glen Perkins
column27: in his first appearance at Target Field
column28: got Mark Kotsay to ground out with the bases full to finish the fifth and stranded A.J. Pierzynski following a leadoff double in the sixth . Kotsay is 0 for 22 against lefties this year . 	 The division continues to revolve around this rivalry
column29: and it 's still intense despite the turnover on both teams and Guillen 's constant praise for the Twins . Young proved that in the eighth inning when he charged home on a groundout and veered toward chief agitator and White Sox catcher Pierzynski to deliver a forearm shiver that did n't dislodge the ball from the catcher 's mitt . 	 Game notes 	 Justin Morneau 's swing looked strong during batting practice
column30: but he still feels post - concussion symptoms so the Twins have no timetable for his return . " The more he gets out there on the field and tells us he 's feeling ready
column31: then that 's when we 'll start talking to him about something else . We 're just letting him do his thing

column1: ST . LOUIS -- Albert Pujols seems to be hitting home runs off everybody these days
column2: so Dave Bush had no reason to feel bad about serving up a long ball to the three - time NL MVP . The important thing was getting everyone else out . 	 Pujols ' eighth homer in 14 games led off the fourth inning
column3: the same inning in which four straight Diamondbacks connected off Bush six days earlier . But that was the only damage against Bush
column4: who pitched six stingy innings to bounce back quickly in a 3 - 2 victory over the suddenly sliding St. Louis Cardinals on Tuesday night . 	 " You have to forget about it
column6: some bad ones . But after a day or two you 've got to flush it and prepare for the next one . " 	 Pujols led off the fourth with his 31st homer of the season and 397th of his career . The Cardinals managed only three more singles against Bush ( 6 - 10 ) and have lost three in a row at home to NL Central also - rans
column7: including a pair of losses to the Cubs . 	 St. Louis is 10 - 5 against the division - leading Reds
column9: Cubs and Astros . The Cardinals still have one of the league 's best home records at 39 - 21 . 	 Third baseman Felipe Lopez
column11: blamed himself for this one . 	 " We lost the game because of me
column12: " Lopez said . " If I make those plays
column13: we win . " 	 Rookie reliever John Axford got five outs for his 18th save in 20 chances and sixth longer than an inning . He allowed one run with a wild pitch in the eighth before getting Matt Holliday to tap out with two on for the third out . Pujols drew his major league - leading 27th intentional walk before Holliday 's groundout . 	 " It 's a tough decision
column14: " Axford said . " It 's really a pick - your - poison type thing
column15: knowing I had to give it everything I 've got and go right after Holliday . " 	 Pujols passed Joe Carter for 50th on the career list
column16: one behind Dale Murphy
column17: and is 7 for 15 the last four games . 	 But Pujols ' last three homers
column18: and five of the last eight
column19: have come with the bases empty . 	 " I would n't say it was a terrible pitch . He 's a pretty good hitter
column20: " Bush said . " No one was on base
column21: so if he hits one out that limits the damage . " 	 Cardinals rookie Jaime Garcia ( 10 - 6 ) got six days of rest for the second straight time and was hurt only in the third when Lopez 's fielding error on a potential double - play ball opened the door for a three - run rally highlighted by Casey McGehee 's 19th homer . Garcia allowed five hits and struck out six
column22: and all the runs were unearned . 	 In Garcia 's last three starts
column23: opponents have scored seven unearned runs . 	 " All I try to focus on is control what I can control
column25: make a pitch . " 	 McGehee had three hits
column26: including a liner off Garcia 's backside in the second
column27: and is batting .411 ( 23 for 56 ) the last 14 games with five homers and 19 RBIs . 	 " He 's on fire
column28: " Brewers manager Ken Macha said . " I told him I did n't want to stand next to him because I was afraid of spontaneous combustion . " 	 In his last outing Bush became the fourth pitcher in major league history to allow four consecutive homers when he gave up solo shots to Arizona 's Adam LaRoche
column29: Miguel Montero
column30: Mark Reynolds and Stephen Drew in the fourth inning . This time

column32: and the next two batters went down quietly . 	 Bush has a 4.63 ERA mostly due to five horrible starts in which he allowed 32 runs in 18 1/3 innings . He has a 2.89 ERA in his other 19 starts . 	 Lopez botched another potential double - play ball in the second

column1: PHOENIX -- The Cincinnati Reds padded their NL Central lead in a place they have n't had much success . 	 Coming off a wild week of momentum that ended on upswing
column2: it was just what they needed . 	 Paul Janish hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the seventh inning and Bronson Arroyo overcame Kelly Johnson 's early two - run homer to pitch into the eighth
column3: helping the Cincinnati Reds open a crucial nine - game West Coast road trip with a 6 - 2 win over the Arizona Diamondbacks on Tuesday night . 	 " We have n't had a whole lot of series like we had the last two at home and you do n't really want to start going up and down like that
column4: so it was definitely important for this road trip off to a good start
column5: " Arroyo said . 	 The Reds got to the desert on an emotional upswing . 	 The low came early last week in a tense
column6: three - game sweep by St. Louis at home . The Reds alleviated some of the sting with their three - game
column7: weekend sweep over Florida to go back atop the division . 	 The big swings set up a critical trip through the west
column8: not one of their favorite places to play . 	 Cincinnati has seen many seasons blow up with wicked West Coast swings and is just 16 - 35 in the Pacific time zone over the past five years . The Reds have had some success against Arizona
column9: but have a 12 - game losing streak at Dodger Stadium

column15: combined with the Cardinals ' loss against Milwaukee

column2: Calif. -- Dallas Braden likened the Toronto lineup to a beer league softball team . He was lucky enough to avoid the barrels . 	 Braden pitched three - hit ball for seven innings
column3: Jack Cust drove in the go - ahead run and the Oakland Athletics ended a four - game losing streak by beating the Blue Jays 6 - 2 Tuesday night . 	 " I tried to utilize their aggressiveness against them
column4: " Braden said . " I ca n't give in because they can do some damage . It 's almost like staring down the barrel of a beer league team because they can hit home runs almost at will . You ca n't make any mistakes and you have to get in and out of the zone as quickly as possible . " 	 Coco Crisp had three hits and an RBI
column5: Daric Barton and Mark Ellis each drove in a run and the A 's finally mustered some early offense in winning for the 11th time in their last 16 home games . 	 " It definitely feels good to get it started
column7: who also stole two bases and scored twice . " I felt pretty good . Before the game
column8: while we were still in the clubhouse I joked
column9: ' He has a no - hitter . ' " 	 Braden ( 8 - 8) allowed two runs
column11: and improved to 4 - 1 since coming off the disabled list July 20 . He walked two and struck out five . 	 " He used his changeup to his advantage and sprinkled just enough fastballs to both sides of the plate
column12: " A 's manager Bob Geren said . " He 's been very consistent and giving us a lot of innings . " 	 Craig Breslow got two outs in the eighth before getting hit on the left forearm by Yunel Escobar 's line drive and leaving the game . Michael Wuertz recorded four outs for his sixth save . 	 " It 's not anything to worry about
column13: " Breslow said . " It 's a little tight right now . It all happened so fast . " 	 Brian Tallet ( 2 - 5 ) took the loss in relief of starter Brandon Morrow
column14: who lasted four innings in his first start since his near no - hitter that included 17 strikeouts Aug. 8 against Tampa Bay . 	 Given extra rest after throwing a career - high 137 pitches in that one
column15: Morrow allowed two runs and four hits Tuesday . He walked three and struck out two . 	 " Morrow pitched OK
column16: " Blue Jays manager Cito Gaston said . " He had not pitched in nine days so he did OK for a guy who had n't pitched in so long . He had a pitch limit . " 	 Jose Bautista got his 90th RBI in the first to put the Blue Jays ahead . 	 Morrow gave up consecutive doubles to Crisp and Barton leading off the bottom half and later threw a wild pitch that allowed Barton to score
column17: giving the A 's a 2 - 1 lead . 	 " I was n't too sharp
column18: " Morrow said . " I seemed to be behind a lot and ran my pitch counts up
column19: had a few walks . I only got four innings out of the 80 pitches . I feel lucky to keep us in it . " 	 Lyle Overbay singled home the tying run for Toronto in the seventh . 	 Tallet gave up singles to Crisp and Barton to open the bottom of the seventh and was replaced by Shawn Camp
column20: who struck out Conor Jackson after Crisp stole third . 	 Cust hit a sharp RBI grounder to second baseman Aaron Hill
column21: who tagged Barton but threw wildly past first base for an error that allowed Cust to reach second . Crisp scored the go - ahead run on the play and Cust came around moments later when Ellis singled . 	 Rajai Davis then singled to left and Ellis scored when Travis Snider misplayed the ball for an error
column22: making it 5 - 2 . 	 Crisp added an RBI single in the eighth . 	 Game notes 	  Morrow matched his second - shortest outing of the season . ... Tallet has allowed runs in 10 of his 18 appearances . ... Overbay was 0 for 10 before his seventh - inning single . ... A 's RHP Andrew Bailey threw an 18 - pitch simulated game and will likely throw at least one more before returning to action . ... Barton snapped an 0 - for-12 streak with his first - inning double . ... Crisp has 13 stolen bases since the All - Star break
column23: matching Juan Pierre of the Chicago White Sox for most in the majors . ... While Morrow lost his no - hit bid on Evan Longoria 's two - out single in the ninth

column1: LOS ANGELES -- Clayton Kershaw extended two personal streaks Tuesday night -- one good
column2: one not so good . 	 Kershaw pitched seven strong innings against a team he continues to dominate at home
column3: and the Los Angeles Dodgers returned from a humiliating road trip with a 6 - 0 victory over Colorado on Tuesday night . He has not allowed a run to the Rockies in the past 26 innings he 's pitched against them at Dodger Stadium . 	 " It is hard to imagine
column5: and some of them are bad
column6: " Colorado shortstop Troy Tulowitzki said . " It 's in the back of our heads
column7: and we know it . But he 's special . He 's been tough on us . But he 's tough on a lot of teams
column8: not just us . I hope we see him again because we want to get him sooner or later . " 	 On May 9
column9: Kershaw ( 11 - 7 ) held the Rockies to two hits over eight innings in a 2 - 0 win . In his final regular - season start last year
column10: he pitched six scoreless innings in a no - decision as the Dodgers won 5 - 0 to clinch their second straight National League West title . 	 " He just pounded the zone with his fastball tonight and located it well . That 's what he did to me
column11: " Todd Helton said after going 0 - for-3 against Kershaw with two strikeouts . " He was really aggressive and he did n't throw it down the middle of the plate . The first time I saw him
column12: I knew he was going to be a good pitcher because his stuff was that good . " 	 Kershaw allowed five hits
column13: struck out six and walked three . The 22 - year - old left - hander
column14: who has n't pitched a 1 - 2 - 3 first inning in any of his 25 starts this season
column15: walked Eric Young to open the game before stranding him at third . 	 " I really do n't care how the first inning goes
column16: as long as I do n't give up runs
column17: " Kershaw said . " If people get on base
column18: they get on base . The first inning is hard for a lot of pitchers to settle in . There were some jams later in the game that were good to get out of -- but in the first inning
column19: you 've just got to get settled in . Other than a couple of walks to the leadoff hitter
column20: which you really ca n't do
column21: I thought I threw the ball OK . " 	 The Dodgers ' beleaguered bullpen blew ninth - inning leads twice during a 2 - 5 trip through Philadelphia and Atlanta in which Joe Torre took the closer 's role away from All - Star Jonathan Broxton following a backbreaking 10 - 9 defeat . Los Angeles remains 11 games behind San Diego in the NL West with 42 remaining . 	 " It 's not fun . It 's frustrating . But that 's the good thing about baseball . You play every day
column22: " Kershaw said . " Our team 's not any different from when we were 10 games over .500 at the All - Star break . " 	 Scott Podsednik and James Loney had two - run doubles during a five - run fifth against Jhoulys Chacin ( 5 - 9 ) . The 22 - year - old right - hander pitched five innings
column25: five hits and five walks . 	 Chacin
column26: returning to the Rockies ' rotation because of injuries to Jeff Francis and Aaron Cook
column27: was recalled from Triple - A Colorado Springs to fill the roster spot that became available when right - hander Taylor Buchholz was put on the 15 - day disabled list because of lower back stiffness . 	 Chacin was 5 - 5 with a 3.64 ERA in 12 starts from May 2 through July 2
column28: then was sent to the bullpen when Jorge De La Rosa came off the disabled list after missing more than two months because of a torn tendon in his left middle finger . One of Chacin 's starts was at Dodger Stadium on May 8
column29: when he pitched 7 1/3 innings in an 8 - 0 win . He made six appearances in relief before being optioned to the minors on July 24 . 	 " It 's definitely not easy to take
column30: but every team has to deal with it
column31: " Tulowitzki said of the state of flux in the Rockies ' rotation . " You have to respond because if you make excuses
column32: you 're going to drop games . So different guys have to step up . " 	 Kershaw and Chacin matched zeros until the fifth . Jamey Carroll drew a leadoff walk for the Dodgers and took third on a hit - and - run single by A.J. Ellis
column33: who was sacrificed to second by Kershaw as Carroll held up . Podsednik

column2: Fla. -- This was one nice series for Evan Longoria and the Tampa Bay Rays . 	 Longoria hit a solo homer and drove in four runs to help the Rays beat the Texas Rangers 8 - 6 on Wednesday
column3: completing a sweep of the three - game set between potential playoff opponents . 	 " We did it against a real good ballclub
column4: " Longoria said . " I think everybody at this point understands that these games are really starting to become big . " 	 Longoria also had a pair of RBI doubles and a sacrifice fly . The All - Star third baseman had three RBIs in Tampa Bay 's 10 - 1 victory Tuesday night . 	 " He had a great series
column5: " Texas manager Ron Washington said . " We could n't stop him from the first game on . " 	 Longoria had seven hits -- including five for extra bases -- in 12 at - bats with eight RBIs during the sweep . He entered the game hitting .234 over his previous 25 games . 	 James Shields ( 11 - 11 ) allowed two runs and four hits over seven innings
column6: stopping a personal two - game slide . He had given up 12 runs over nine innings in his previous two outings . 	 " We 're playing really well right now
column7: " Shields said . " We 've got a lot of confidence at home . I think we 've got that home - field advantage back . " 	 The Rays have won 19 of their last 24 games at Tropicana Field . 	 Tampa Bay
column8: which began the day tied with the New York Yankees for the AL East lead
column9: has won five straight overall . 	 " Absolutely it 's a confidence builder
column10: " Rays manager Joe Maddon said . 	 Taylor Teagarden and Mitch Moreland homered for the AL West - leading Rangers
column11: who are 7 - 10 since July 30 . AL batting leader Josh Hamilton had a run - scoring grounder in the eighth but went 0 for 4 for the day and 1 for 10 in the series . 	 " You just move on
column12: " Washington said . " We 'll be better equipped the next time we see them . Stay tuned . " 	 Moreland belted a two - run shot off Lance Cormier in the ninth but Rafael Soriano came in and got the final two outs for his 35th save . 	 Longoria hit an RBI double off Derek Holland ( 2 - 2 ) in the first and a solo drive in the fourth for his first homer in 20 games
column13: making it 2 - 0 . 	 Tampa Bay went up 5 - 1 in the fifth on B.J. Upton 's 11th homer
column14: Longoria 's run - scoring double and a bases - loaded walk to pinch - hitter Matt Joyce . 	 Joyce also singled in a run in the seventh and Longoria added a sacrifice fly in the eighth . 	 Teagarden cut the Rangers ' deficit to 2 - 1 with a fifth - inning homer . He has connected three times in his last five starts . 	 Holland
column15: recalled from Triple - A Oklahoma City before the game
column16: made his first big league start since May 30 . The left - hander gave up five runs and six hits in 4 1/3 innings . 	 " The big thing was I fell behind on a lot of hitters and you know that will cost you
column17: " Holland said . 	 Andres Blanco helped the Rangers close to 5 - 2 in the sixth
column18: taking advantage of a pair of miscues by Shields . Blanco reached on an infield single and went to third when Shields was charged with an error for an errant pickoff attempt . He scored on a wild pitch . 	 The victory was the 900th for the Rays
column19: who started play in 1998 . 	 Game notes 	  Shields has given up 29 homers this season . ... Rangers 3B Michael Young ( stiff neck ) was out of the lineup for the second straight game . ... Tampa Bay RHPs Jeff Niemann and Wade Davis
column20: both sidelined with strained right shoulders

column1: ST . LOUIS -- No shutout for Randy Wolf . No save for John Axford . And neither seemed to mind when Trevor Hoffman finished this one . 	 Hoffman struck out Brendan Ryan with the bases loaded for his 598th save and the Milwaukee Brewers beat the slumping St. Louis Cardinals 3 - 2 on Wednesday
column2: handing 17 - game winner Adam Wainwright his first home loss of the season . 	 Hoffman
column4: has two saves this month as the Brewers ' backup option behind Axford . Prior to that
column5: his last save was May 7 . 	 " I was excited for that right away
column6: " Axford said after a couple fielding miscues led to him being pulled with two down . " I came in upset and right away I let it go . 	 " Hoffy 's out there and we 're cheering him on
column7: " he said . 	 Wolf pitched three - hit ball into the ninth inning and rookie Lorenzo Cain had two hits
column8: scored twice and drove in a run . He also had a key steal to set up Milwaukee 's first run in the fifth . 	 The 42 - year - old Hoffman needed just three pitches to retire Ryan after the Cardinals pushed across a pair of runs in the ninth . 	 After sweeping the mini two - game series
column9: the Brewers are 18 - 9 at Busch Stadium the last three seasons . The Cardinals have lost four straight to drop out of the top spot in the NL Central . 	 " What you 're geared to do offensively is find something you can do something with and make something happen
column10: " manager Tony La Russa said . " That 's our challenge and we have n't done it the last couple of days . " 	 Wolf was happy to outpitch Wainwright
column11: who he said was " probably the front - runner right now for the Cy Young " Award . 	 " I joked before the game that if I throw a shutout
column12: at least I guaranteed a no - decision
column13: " Wolf said . " It 's exciting to go against a pitcher like this
column14: a team like that . " 	 Wainwright ( 17 - 7 ) gave up three runs and seven hits in seven innings but missed a chance to become the majors ' first 18 - game winner . He allowed multiple runs for the first time in four starts when the Brewers scored twice in the seventh for a 3 - 0 lead . 	 Wainwright entered on a bit of a roll
column15: with a 3 - 0 mark and a sparkling 0.39 ERA over his previous three outings . The right - hander dropped to 11 - 1 with a 1.42 ERA in 13 home starts this season . 	 " You ca n't win every one forever
column16: but he certainly did his part
column17: " La Russa said . " He competed like a maniac . They beat a really
column18: really good pitcher . " 	 Wolf ( 10 - 9 ) allowed only two harmless singles -- one by Wainwright -- and was on the verge of his first complete game in nearly two seasons before he was removed after Albert Pujols ' one - out double in the ninth . Axford surrendered an RBI double to Matt Holliday and a second run scored when first baseman Prince Fielder botched Aaron Miles ' grounder . 	 " I did n't read the spin on it too good
column19: " Fielder said . 	 Earlier in the inning
column20: Fielder hurt his wrist on a tag play . He told manager Ken Macha he was fine
column21: but Macha said
column22: " Let 's see . With Prince you never know . Hopefully he ices it up . " 	 Both of the doubles were to the left
column23: and Ryan Braun appeared to have a chance at snaring both . After Axford walked pinch - hitter Colby Rasmus on four pitches
column24: Hoffman earned his seventh save in 12 opportunities . 	 " You 've got to get 27 outs
column25: " Macha said . " Sometimes the last three are the toughest . " 	 Before the ninth
column26: the Cardinals had put only one runner in scoring position . 	 Wainwright had been 2 - 0 with an 0.50 ERA and two complete games against the Brewers this season
column27: including his first career shutout . Despite the setback
column28: the right - hander extended his major league record with a 28th consecutive quality start at home . 	 The Cardinals have been one of the NL 's best home teams up to this point but fell to 39 - 22 . 	 Cain 's speed helped the Brewers take the lead . He led off the fifth with a double and stole third with one out . He then scored when Wainwright tried to shovel George Kottaras ' RBI dribbler to catcher Yadier Molina and ended up with no play . 	 Cain hit a run - scoring triple in the seventh and scored on Alcides Escobar 's sacrifice fly . 	 The Cardinals began the day two games behind the Cincinnati Reds in the NL Central and with several hitters slumping . Leadoff man Felipe Lopez is 4 - for-41
column29: No . 2 hitter Jon Jay struck out for the fifth straight time in the fourth
column30: Holliday is 2 - for-15 and Molina is 1 - for-13 . Allen Craig had been 0 - for-14 with five strikeouts before getting a bloop hit in the fifth . 	 Game notes 	  Molina made his 21st consecutive start at catcher . Backup Jason LaRue is on the DL with a concussion from the Reds fracas last week and the team swapped rookie subs
column31: recalling Bryan Anderson from Triple - A Memphis and sending Steven Hill down . ... Two days after signing near the deadline
column32: Cardinals first - round draft pick Zack Cox was on the field for pregame drills . Cox is headed for the minors . ... The Brewers have played five straight one - run games
column33: going 3 - 2 . ... Shortstop Escobar left due to cramping with two outs in the ninth and was replaced by Craig Counsell . He said he was fine after the game . 	 Jonathan India finished ahead of Cardinals OF Dylan Carlson and Marlins starter Trevor Rogers for NL Rookie of the Year . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column34: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column35: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career .

column1: CHICAGO -- The Chicago Cubs sent a parade of rookies to the mound during another loss at Wrigley Field before saying goodbye to a popular former All - Star . 	 There were no such problems for the San Diego Padres
column2: who just keep following the same formula to more victories . 	 Matt Stairs
column3: taking advantage of a rare outfield start
column4: hit a two - run double and Adrian Gonzalez homered
column5: powering San Diego to a 5 - 1 victory over Chicago on Wednesday . 	 The reeling Cubs announced after the game that they had traded Derrek Lee to the Atlanta Braves for three minor leaguers . The big first baseman was still at Chicago 's cozy ballpark when the deal went down
column6: watching the Padres add another win to the NL 's best record . 	 Clayton Richard allowed one run and seven hits in 6 2/3 innings for the Padres
column7: who have outscored opponents 53 - 20 while winning nine of their last 10 games . San Diego ( 72 - 47 ) is 25 games over .500 for the first time since its pennant - winning 1998 season . 	 " Today 's game is how we play
column8: " manager Bud Black said . " We 're having good pitching performances and we 're playing good defense . The way we 're playing makes us confident going into every game . " 	 The disappointing Cubs ( 50 - 71 ) -- whose season - opening payroll was more than $ 100 million greater than that of the Padres -- lost their sixth straight home game and are 4 - 17 overall since July 27 . 	 Lee arrived in Chicago with great fanfare in 2004
column9: joining a club that lost to the Florida Marlins in the NL Championship Series . But the Cubs did n't make the playoffs in ' 04
column10: and the division - winning teams of 2007 and 2008 went a combined 0 - 6 in the playoffs . 	 After joining Ted Lilly
column11: Ryan Theriot and Mike Fontenot as recently traded Cubs
column12: Lee was asked if the culture of losing -- 102 title - free years -- has contributed to the failure . 	 " I think so . Having to hear about losing kind of puts you in a negative environment
column13: " Lee said . " I do n't think that 's conducive to winning . I think you want a little more positive energy going on . 	 " But I also think everyone understands that when they come here . That 's what you 're going to hear until the team wins . Honestly
column14: it 's one of the enticing things . Everyone wants to come here and be on that team that finally breaks the so - called curse
column15: " he said . 	 One of baseball 's top pinch - hitters
column16: Stairs was making his 12th start for the Padres -- his 12th team in 18 seasons . He did n't seem at all rusty when he faced Casey Coleman in the first inning with the bases loaded
column17: doubling off the top of the left - field wall to give Richard all the support he would need . 	 Long considered a defensive liability
column18: Stairs also made a run - saving catch in left field in the second inning . 	 " If I dive for it tomorrow there 's a pretty good chance I miss it
column19: " Stairs said . " Maybe most guys catch that [ without diving ] because they 're a little quicker than I am . " 	 Gonzalez hit a solo drive in the third for his 23rd homer and fifth in his last six games at Wrigley . Gonzalez
column20: who also singled and walked three times
column21: has a career .329 average in Chicago 's longtime home . 	 " We consistently have quality at - bats
column22: " he said . " We make pitchers work for outs . Over the course of a game we try to wear the pitcher down
column23: and then we have good enough pitching that when we score a couple runs it 's going to be enough . " 	 Gonzalez scored for the third time on Andrew Cashner 's eighth - inning wild pitch and Chase Headley added a sacrifice fly in the ninth . 	 Coleman ( 0 - 1 ) allowed three runs and six hits over 4 1/3 innings in his first start for the Cubs . The right - hander was followed by five more rookies
column24: setting a single - game franchise record on the mound . 	 Alfonso Soriano and Jeff Baker hit consecutive doubles in the second for the Cubs
column25: but that was all they could muster against Richard ( 11 - 5 )
column26: who improved to 4 - 0 in his last five starts . 	 It did n't matter to him that he defeated a beaten - down team . 	 " You ca n't look at your opponent
column27: even if they 're struggling
column28: as a lesser opponent
column29: " Richard said . " Everyone is here for a reason
column30: and as a pitcher we have to attack . " 	 Game notes 	  San Diego improved to 36 - 25 on the road and 25 - 12 in day games . ... Padres center fielder Tony Gwynn left in the sixth inning with what the team called a sprained right wrist . He was injured while fouling off a pitch . ... Before Wednesday
column31: Richard was 1 - 6 with a 5.61 ERA in day starts
column32: compared to 20 - 9 and 3.90 at night . ... Slumping Cubs rookie Tyler Colvin will return to the outfield Thursday after getting a four - game " breather
column33: " manager Lou Piniella said . ... The announced attendance at Wrigley was a season - low 33
