column2: Calif. -- The biggest reason for the Oakland Athletics ' perfect record this season when leading after eight innings is their stingy relievers . 	 On a day when the normally reliable bullpen failed
column3: Cliff Pennington bailed the team out . 	 After failing to get a sacrifice down
column4: Pennington managed to win the game with an RBI single in the bottom of the ninth inning that gave the A 's a 5 - 4 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Wednesday . 	 " Our bullpen has been the strength of our team all year
column5: " Pennington said . " For the offense to pick them up one time is nice . " 	 The A 's blew a 4 - 1 lead in the top of the ninth but managed to pull out the victory to remain undefeated in 51 games this season when they led after eight innings . 	 Steve Tolleson started the winning rally with a leadoff single against Casey Janssen ( 4 - 1 ) . Pennington tried to lay down a bunt but was unable to do it before getting two strikes . After Tolleson advanced on a passed ball by Jose Molina
column6: Pennington was looking to advance the runner with a grounder to the right side . 	 Pennington did just that and ended up winning the game when the ball made it to right field . Tolleson easily beat Dewayne Wise 's throw home to score the winning run . 	 " At contact
column7: I knew I was going to be able to move him up
column8: " Pennington said . " When I looked up and saw where [ second baseman Aaron ] Hill was playing
column10: ' That has a chance to get through . ' " 	 Gio Gonzalez allowed two hits in seven innings and Coco Crisp had a homer
column11: two doubles and two RBIs for the A 's
column12: who won their sixth straight home series . 	 " It 's good that we 're showing signs of life that we 're going out there battling and sticking to it
column13: " Gonzalez said . " We look at it as a step forward . " 	 Fill - in closer Michael Wuertz was unable to preserve a three - run lead
column14: blowing his first save in seven chances in place of injured All - Star Andrew Bailey . 	 The Blue Jays entered the ninth with just two hits
column15: including an infield popup that was lost in the sun . But Adam Lind started the rally with a double . One out later
column16: Wuertz threw eight straight balls to Lyle Overbay and Edwin Encarnacion to load the bases . 	 J.P. Arencibia hit an RBI single to make it 4 - 2 and knock out Wuertz . Jerry Blevins came on and surrendered a tying two - run single to Fred Lewis . Brad Ziegler ( 3 - 4 ) got out of the jam by getting Yunel Escobar to hit into a double play . 	 " We did n't swing the bats at all well here
column17: " manager Cito Gaston said . " We did win one game and came back and tie one up . We just did n't hit the ball like we have been . " 	 Toronto 's lone run against Gonzalez was the result of bright sun and a lucky break . With runners on first and second and two outs in the fifth
column18: Lewis hit a high popup in front of the plate . Third baseman Kevin Kouzmanoff and catcher Kurt Suzuki lost the ball in the sun and Lewis got credit for an RBI single . 	 The only other hit off Gonzalez was Vernon Wells ' second - inning double . The left - hander
column19: quietly having a breakout season
column20: struck out six and walked four . 	 The Blue Jays also lost a fly ball in the sun in the fifth but it did n't hurt them . Crisp was caught too far off second base after the ball fell in shallow left - center and was tagged out in a rundown . 	 " The sun was in the right spot today for a couple of cheap hits to land in
column21: " A 's manager Bob Geren said . 	 Toronto starter Marc Rzepczynski
column22: who had walked only two batters in 18 1/3 innings in the majors this season
column23: walked the first three batters . Suzuki and Kouzmanoff hit run - scoring groundouts to give the A 's a 2 - 0 lead . 	 Pennington then walked with two outs in the second and scored on Crisp 's double . Rzepczynski left after walking Conor Jackson with one out in the fifth for his fifth walk of the game . 	 " My sinker was either running or sinking straight down especially in the first inning when I was throwing them
column24: " Rzepczynski said . " They were either down or away . I just had to relax but I had a hard time throwing a fastball for a strike . Today the fastball was also running and I had no control over it . So when you do n't control your fastball it 's hard to pitch . " 	 Game notes 	  Oakland 's starters have allowed one or fewer earned runs in eight of their past 11 games . ... Rzepczynski became the first Toronto starter to walk at least five and strike out nobody in a game since Miguel Batista on Aug. 13
column26: against the Baltimore Orioles . ... Bailey ( rib cage ) will make a rehab appearance at Triple - A Sacramento on Friday . ... Arencibia snapped an 0 - for-15 slide with his single in the ninth . He was optioned to Triple - A Las Vegas after the game and the Blue Jays will replace him Friday in Boston . column1: BALTIMORE -- No one would have blamed light - hitting Matt Tuiasosopo for blabbing endlessly about his second home run in two games . 	 Instead
column2: the Seattle Mariners utility player spoke excitedly about another rare occurrence : his fielding gem in the outfield . 	 Tuiasosopo extended his unlikely power surge with a three - run homer and the Mariners beat the Baltimore Orioles 6 - 5 on Wednesday night for their season - high fourth straight series win . 	 Tuiasosopo 's drive off Jeremy Guthrie ( 7 - 12 ) in the second inning put Seattle ahead for good . Tuiasosopo has two homers and seven RBIs over the last two nights after totaling one homer and two RBIs in his first 30 games . 	 He also prevented the tying run from scoring in the eighth
column3: making a diving catch of a two - out liner to left by Matt Wieters with Adam Jones running from first base on the pitch . 	 " I do n't make that catch and a run scores . It was definitely a thrill
column4: " Tuiasosopo said . 	 It was his fifth start this season in the outfield
column5: compared to 11 starts in the infield . 	 Asked the last time he made a catch like that
column6: Tuiasosopo recalled making a similar play in high school . He said he nearly caught one like that in the minors
column7: " but I missed it . " 	 On this occasion
column8: the ball stuck in his glove after his dive toward the left - field line . 	 " The catch was as big as the home run at the time
column9: " said Seattle interim manager Daren Brown
column10: whose record improved to 6 - 3 since he took over for Don Wakamatsu . 	 Give Brown credit -- after Tuiasosopo helped the Mariners win on Tuesday
column11: he was back in the starting lineup again Wednesday . 	 " Very few times have I started two games in a row
column12: " Tuiasosopo said . 	 David Pauley ( 2 - 4 ) allowed four runs and five hits in six - plus innings to win his second straight start after opening his big league career with seven consecutive losing decisions . 	 David Aardsma worked the ninth for his 24th save . After Cesar Izturis reached second with one out
column13: Aardsma struck out Brian Roberts and retired Nick Markakis on a sharply hit comebacker . 	 The Mariners took two of three from Baltimore
column14: their third consecutive series win under Brown
column15: who replaced Wakamatsu after Seattle captured a three - game set against the Kansas City Royals . 	 Wieters homered and Luke Scott went 2 - for-3 with two RBIs for Baltimore
column16: now 10 - 6 under manager Buck Showalter . After winning their first three series under their new manager
column17: the Orioles have dropped two straight . 	 Guthrie gave up six runs
column18: five earned
column19: and eight hits in eight innings . He won his previous three starts and had a 1.52 ERA over his last six outings . 	 He most lamented the slider he threw to Tuiasosopo on a 2 - 1 pitch in the second . 	 " It was n't the right pitch nor did I execute it like it should have been executed
column20: " Guthrie said . 	 Wieters ' two - run shot chased Pauley and made it 5 - 4 in the seventh . 	 " I was a bit angry . I challenged him and he hit it for a home run
column21: " said Pauley
column22: who pitched in Baltimore 's minor league system last year . 	 Casey Kotchman hit an RBI double for Seattle in the eighth
column23: but Baltimore got a run back in the bottom half when Scott doubled off Jamey Wright
column24: took third on a balk and scored on a wild pitch . 	 Tuiasosopo prevented further damage with his outstanding catch in left . 	 " That was a major league play

column26: Seattle went up 3 - 2 in the second . Guthrie gave up two hits

column1: PHILADELPHIA -- Jimmy Rollins is at his best in the biggest games . 	 Rollins hit a three - run homer
column2: Joe Blanton pitched neatly into the seventh and the Philadelphia Phillies beat the San Francisco Giants 8 - 2 on Wednesday night . 	 The two - time NL champions have won 20 of 25 and moved two games ahead of the Giants in the wild - card race . The Phillies remained 2 1/2 games behind Atlanta in the East . 	 " When there 's a lot of focus on our team
column4: " manager Charlie Manuel said . " This is when Jimmy likes to play
column5: or it seems that way . " 	 Andres Torres and Pat Burrell homered for the Giants
column6: who have lost three straight . 	 Blanton ( 5 - 6 ) allowed two runs and eight hits
column7: striking out seven in 6 1/3 innings . 	 Rollins singled
column8: tripled and homered off Matt Cain ( 9 - 10 ) . He flied out against Jeremy Affeldt in the seventh and grounded out against Guillermo Mota in the eighth . column11: who missed 54 games this season with a calf injury . " My hitting area is starting to come to me . It does n't feel like the plate is in the other batter 's box . " 	 Pinch - hitter Domonic Brown blasted a solo homer into the second deck in right with two outs in the eighth
column12: earning the rookie a curtain call from the sellout crowd . It also gave Rollins another chance to go for a double

column14: " Cain said . 	 Carlos Ruiz put the Phillies ahead 2 - 1 with an RBI single during a four - run fourth . He has 21 RBIs in his last 19 games . 	 Before Ruiz 's hit
column15: second baseman Mike Fontenot booted Ross Gload 's one - out grounder . The error proved costly when Rollins came up with two runners on and two outs . Rollins drove one deep into the seats in right to make it 5 - 1 . His shot ended a string of 49 straight innings without a homer for Philadelphia . 	 Burrell cut it to 5 - 2 in the sixth with his 12th homer in 58 games with the Giants . He has homered in his first two games back at Citizens Bank Park since helping the Phillies win the 2008 World Series . 	 " We 're not scoring a lot of runs
column16: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " We 've got to get our offense going . There 's a lot of baseball left . This team 's been resilient . We 'll bounce back . " 	 Raul Ibanez hit an RBI triple and Jayson Werth followed with a double to extend Philadelphia 's lead to 7 - 2 in the seventh . 	 Torres crushed his 12th homer into the second deck in right field leading off the game . 	 Blanton allowed just one run in the first after giving up two or more in five of his eight previous starts . Overall

column1: BOSTON -- Daniel Nava took one for the team . Then he stole one from the other team . 	 The Red Sox left fielder drove in the go - ahead run when he was hit by a pitch with the bases loaded
column2: then he prevented the Los Angeles Angels from scoring with a diving catch to give Boston a 7 - 5 victory on Wednesday night . 	 The Red Sox led by one run when Nava made a diving catch on Maicer Izturis ' sinking liner with two on and two out in the eighth . 	 " It 's a do - or - die play
column4: who homered for Boston . " That ball gets by him
column5: they probably take the lead . That 's a play you 've got to take a chance on . You 've got to give it all you 've got . That 's what he did . " 	 Adrian Beltre also homered for Boston
column6: which improved to 9 - 0 against the Angels this season . John Lackey ( 11 - 7 ) won for the third straight time against his former team
column7: allowing five runs and 10 hits in seven innings
column8: picking up the win when the Red Sox overcame a 5 - 4 deficit in the bottom of the seventh . 	 Jonathan Papelbon struck out the side in the ninth for his 30th save . 	 Kevin Jepsen ( 2 - 3 ) threw a bases - loaded wild pitch and
column9: after an intentional walk reloaded the bases
column10: hit Nava with an 0 - 2 pitch to bring in the go - ahead run . 	 " I was in an 0 - 2 hole . I do n't know how great it was . I 'll take it
column11: " Nava said . " We did n't exactly do it like we wanted to
column12: but we got it done . " 	 Jepsen allowed two runs and two hits
column13: walked two and struck out one . 	 He gave up a leadoff single to Victor Martinez
column14: followed by David Ortiz 's double off the Green Monster . One out later
column15: Mike Lowell walked on a 3 - 2 pitch to load the bases . With pinch - hitter J.D. Drew up
column16: Jepsen bounced a curveball in front of the plate and past catcher Jeff Mathis . 	 Martinez scored to tie the game
column17: and the other runners moved up . Drew was intentionally walked
column18: and Jepsen hit Nava with an 0 - 2 pitch to make it 6 - 5 . 	 " He bounced a curveball and yanked a fastball inside
column19: " Angels manager Mike Scioscia said . " He was trying to elevate . He had the right idea
column20: but just did n't execute . " 	 Boston added a run when Marco Scutaro doubled to lead off the eighth and scored on Martinez 's single . 	 Beltre had an RBI single in the first
column21: but the Angels tied it on Mike Napoli 's homer into the Monster seats . Napoli is the 18th major league catcher -- and first for the Angels -- to have at least 20 homers in each of his first three seasons . 	 Alberto Callaspo hit a three - run homer just past the Pesky Pole to give the Angels a 5 - 2 lead in the fifth
column22: but Beltre responded with a two - run homer in the bottom half . 	 Scott Kazmir
column23: who had won just once in his previous six starts
column24: was deprived of the win when Boston rallied in the seventh . Kazmir allowed four runs and eight hits in five innings . 	 Game notes 	  Lackey had lasted at least eight innings in each of his previous three starts . ... The Angels skipped batting practice . " Anytime when a team 's struggling
column25: less is more
column26: " Scioscia said . " If anything
column27: our guys are working too hard . " ... There were three close calls on homers
column28: but the umpires did n't need to see a replay on any of them . A fan reached over the top of the Monster to knock down Bobby Abreu 's fly ball in the third
column29: and he was given a double . Callaspo 's homer also was touched by a fan
column30: but it was ruled to be a homer anyway . In the eighth
column31: Scutaro 's line drive also bounced off the short wall down the right - field line
column32: knocking loose a fan 's hat ; it was ruled a double . ... Napoli played first base . ... Pedroia
column33: who missed 44 games with a broken bone in his left foot
column34: singled and walked to improve to 17 - for-33 against Kazmir . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: ATLANTA -- The Atlanta Braves know the routine . 	 Get it down to their final swing . Come through with the big hit . Run onto the field to celebrate . 	 The Atlanta Braves did it again in their last at - bat
column2: beating the Washington Nationals 3 - 2 on Jason Heyward 's two - out
column3: run - scoring single in the ninth inning Wednesday night . 	 " Whew ! " manager Bobby Cox said . " We need a breather once in a while . " 	 Atlanta won for the 21st time on its final swing
column5: and improved baseball 's best home record to 44 - 16
column6: maintaining their 2-game lead on the Philadelphia Phillies in the NL East . The Phillies kept pace by beating the San Francisco Giants 8 - 2 . 	 With one out
column7: Rick Ankiel blooped a broken - bat single just over the outstretched glove of second baseman Adam Kennedy . Sean Burnett ( 0 - 7 ) was replaced by Tyler Clippard
column8: who made matters worse by walking David Ross . Clippard struck out Omar Infante
column9: but Heyward lined a 3 - 0 pitch to left - center to bring home Ankiel without a throw . 	 " It was n't the best pitch to hit
column11: who was mobbed by his teammates near second base
column12: " but it was enough to get the job done . " 	 Clippard 's pitch was down and away . Not enough
column14: to keep the Braves rookie star from delivering the fifth walk - off hit of his young career . 	 " I was n't really throwing strikes
column15: " Clippard said . 	 Billy Wagner ( 7 - 2 ) struck out the side in the ninth . 	 The Braves ' fourth straight win came hours after they acquired slugging first baseman Derrek Lee from the Chicago Cubs for three minor league pitchers . Lee will join the team when it gets to Wrigley Field on Friday for the start of a weekend series . 	 " We 're excited about it
column16: " said Tim Hudson
column17: who pitched seven strong innings but was n't around for his 15th win . " It lets us know [ the front office ] is on the same page as us . We want to win . There 's no egos in here . " 	 In the meantime
column18: the Braves did just fine in their next - to - last game before Lee comes aboard . 	 Hudson allowed two runs and eight hits -- all singles -- and benefited from four double plays . Washington starter Livan Hernandez allowed two runs over seven innings
column19: pitching around nine hits and getting a heads - up play from center fielder Roger Bernadina in the sixth . 	 Martin Prado tried to tag up at first on a flyout to the warning track in the sixth . Bernadina was n't fooled
column20: making a strong throw to second that nipped Prado . 	 For the second straight night
column21: the Nationals took a 2 - 0 lead . For the second night in a row
column22: it did n't matter . 	 Michael Morse and Willie Harris got the third started with consecutive singles . With one out
column23: Bernadina lined a run - scoring hit to right
column24: but he was tagged out trying to reach second on the throw home . Ryan Zimmerman drove home another run with a two - out single to left . 	 In the fourth
column25: the Braves loaded the bases with no outs on Prado 's leadoff double and two walks . Hernandez was on the verge of escaping with minimal damage when Melky Cabrera hit into a double play -- Prado scored on the play -- but the Nationals ' defense made a boneheaded play . 	 Alex Gonzalez lofted a popup into short right field . Morse came charging in from right field
column26: Kennedy drifted out -- then both veered off at the last second
column27: apparently thinking the other had called for the ball . It fell for a gift single that brought home the tying run . 	 The Nationals took another blow in the eighth when Zimmerman was tossed by home plate umpire Scott Barry after striking out to end the inning . 	 Zimmerman slammed down his bat and helmet
column28: upset only at himself for swinging at a low pitch from Jonny Venters
column29: but Barry took exception and gave him the heave . Walking toward his position
column30: Zimmerman spun around in disbelief . Manager Jim Riggleman charged out of the dugout and got ejected
column31: too
column32: after an extended argument with the ump . 	 " I was frustrated about striking out
column33: " Zimmerman said . " He thought I was throwing my helmet at him . " 	 Game notes 	  The Nationals placed catcher Wil Nieves on the temporary leave list so he could be with his wife
column34: who 's expecting a child . Catcher Wilson Ramos was recalled from Triple - A Syracuse to fill in while Nieves is away . ... Washington will make another roster move Thursday
column35: when outfielder Nyjer Morgan is eligible for come off the 15 - day DL . Outfielder Josh Willingham ( knee ) will replace Morgan on the DL . ... The Braves called up infielder Brandon Hicks from Triple - A Gwinnett for what figures to be a short stay . He 'll likely return to the minors when Lee joins the Braves in Chicago on Friday . ... The Braves ( 71 - 49 ) have n't been 22 games over .500 since Sept. 27

column1: HOUSTON -- With the big game that Jose Reyes had
column2: it was fitting that he helped end it . 	 Reyes matched a season high with four hits and scored on a sacrifice fly by slumping Ike Davis in the 14th inning to give the New York Mets a 3 - 2 win over the Houston Astros on Wednesday night . 	 Reyes stole third base twice after the ninth inning
column4: which is tied for most in the National League
column5: and drew a key walk in the victory . 	 " It was a real good night and it 's even better when you get a win
column6: " Reyes said . " I 'll trade four hits anytime for a win . So that was a real good game for us . " 	 After Geoff Blum hit a tying home run for the Astros in the ninth
column7: the Mets went ahead without a hit . 	 Reyes drew a leadoff walk in the 14th
column8: moved up on a sacrifice and stole third . Mike Hessman walked and Gustavo Chacin ( 1 - 2 ) intentionally walked Carlos Beltran for the second time to bring up Davis . 	 " He 's just trying to push the envelope and he 's one of the best at that
column9: " Mets manager Jerry Manuel said of Reyes . " He was on five or six times and only scored one run . Wow
column10: that 's hard to believe . But he had a good night
column13: got some hits for us and did some things . He 's playing extremely well . " 	 Davis
column14: who grounded into a bases - loaded forceout in the 10th and singled in the 13th
column15: lifted a fly to right field that put the Mets ahead . 	 Davis ended a prolonged drought with an earlier single . 	 " That two - strike hit got a little confidence back and then I popped it up to get the runner in to get the win
column16: " he said . " [ I 'll ] just go into tomorrow 's game with a little momentum . " 	 Mets star third baseman David Wright singled with two outs in the 12th inning . He was replaced by a pinch - runner after talking to a trainer for a minute and slowly walked off the field . 	 Wright said he was vomiting from about the fifth inning on and that he became too lightheaded to stay in the game after that hit . He was n't feeling much better after the game and a bottle of Pedialyte
column17: a children 's hydration drink
column18: sat in his locker . 	 Mets starter R.A. Dickey pitched a one - hit shutout against Philadelphia in his previous outing
column19: and the knuckleballer took a 2 - 1 lead into the ninth . With one out
column20: Blum hit his first home run since Sept. 16 . 	 Elmer Dessens ( 3 - 1 ) pitched the 13th for the win . Manny Acosta got three groundouts on five pitches in the 14th for his first save
column21: ending a game that took 4 hours
column22: 18 minutes . 	 It was the longest game of the season for the Astros . The Mets had played on far longer
column23: going 20 innings in a 2 - 1 win over the Cardinals in April . 	 " Well
column24: we were kind of we were done
column25: " Astros manager Brad Mills said . " We were done with position players and pitchers [ in the 13th ] . We were done
column26: we were all out of everything . We [ did n't bunt ] and tried to press the issue a little bit because of that
column27: because of where we were out [ of players ] . 	 Jason Bourgeois singled with no outs in the 13th for Houston 's first hit since the ninth
column28: but he was caught stealing . Angel Sanchez singled with two outs
column29: but Dessens retired Hunter Pence to send it to the 14th . 	 Wilton Lopez threw a scoreless 11th and 12th for Houston and Bobby Parnell did the same for New York . 	 Hisanori Takahashi
column30: pitching in the late innings because Mets closer Francisco Rodriguez is gone
column31: got the last two outs in the ninth before working a perfect 10th . 	 Reyes singled in the 10th off Brandon Lyon and moved up on a bunt single by Angel Pagan . The Astros intentionally walked Beltran with one out after a double steal by Reyes and Pagan to load the bases . 	 Davis grounded into a force out that left Reyes out at home before Pence caught a fly ball by Jeff Francoeur for the third out . 	 Rookie Ruben Tejada doubled with one out in the seventh inning to break an 0 - for-28 hitting slump . That drought was the longest by a Mets position player since Jason Phillips went 0 - for-29 in April 2004 . 	 Dickey followed with his first career double to send Tejada home and make it 1 - 0 . Reyes singled before Dickey scored on a groundout by Pagan to push the score to 2 - 0 . 	 Sanchez got Houston within 2 - 1 with an RBI single with one out in the eighth inning . Humberto Quintero and Jason Michaels both singled before a sacrifice bunt by Michael Bourn set up that score . Dickey struck out Pence before Carlos Lee grounded out to limit the damage . 	 Astros starter Brett Myers and Dickey dueled through six scoreless innings . 	 Myers pitched seven innings . He has lasted at least six innings in each of his 25 starts
column32: extending his franchise record to start a season . 	 Game notes 	  The Astros placed reliever Matt Lindstrom on the 15 - day disabled list retroactive to Monday with a lower back strain and recalled LHP Fernando Abad from Triple - A Round Rock after the game . ... 37 - year - old 2B Blum got a loud round of applause when he made a dive and landed in a belly - flop to grab a line drive by Tejada in the ninth . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column2: Mo. -- Bruce Chen was hardly fine . Thanks to the Kansas City hitters
column3: he did n't need to be so sharp . 	 Yuniesky Betancourt homered and drove in three runs
column4: leading Chen and the Royals over the Cleveland Indians 9 - 7 Wednesday night . 	 Betancourt had a two - run single in the fourth inning and hit his 12th homer
column6: in the sixth as the Royals took a 9 - 4 lead . He has hit .421 with 10 RBIs in his past 11 games . 	 Mitch Maier hit a two - run triple and Billy Butler also drove in a pair of runs for Kansas City . Gregor Blanco added two doubles . 	 It was the Royals ' highest - scoring game since a 10 - 3 win over St. Louis on June 27 . 	 " Every bit of the order we had offensive production
column7: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " All and up down the lineup it was a good night offensively . Bruce did a pretty good job and got us into the sixth . His command fluctuated a little bit
column8: but he did enough to get the big out when he needed . " 	 Chen ( 8 - 6 ) benefited from the Royals ' offensive splurge to win for the third time in four August starts . He gave up four runs on 11 hits in 5 2/3 innings . 	 " Both teams were swinging the bats real well . " Chen said . " I tried to make good pitches and pound the strike zone . Luckily
column9: I was able to minimize the damage so we could win . I was making good pitches when I needed . " 	 Chen went 1 - 13 with three big league clubs from 2006 - 09 and missed the 2008 season after elbow surgery . 	 " I 've gone through a lot of ups and downs
column10: " he said . " I 've never given up . I feel like I 'm having a good year . I like playing this game . I feel like I can keep pitching at this level . " 	 Fausto Carmona ( 11 - 11 ) fell to 1 - 4 in his past five starts . He allowed seven runs on nine hits
column11: a walk and a hit batter in five innings . 	 " The problem tonight was getting the ball up
column12: " Carmona said . " I gave up a lot of base hits on sinkers . Every pitch was up -- the sinker
column14: the slider . I got a couple of ground balls with the sinker
column15: but they were hit where nobody could catch them . Everything was up . " 	 Joakim Soria gave up a single and walk in the ninth
column16: but held on for his 35th save
column17: which ties for the American League lead
column18: in 37 opportunities . 	 Asdrubal Cabrera and Shin - Soo Choo each had three hits and drove in two runs for Cleveland . 	 Choo 's double in the three - run eighth scored Michael Brantley and Cabrera
column19: trimming the Royals ' lead to 9 - 7 . The Indians had 17 hits
column20: but stranded 11 runners . 	 " Hits do n't win games
column21: " Indians manager Manny Acta said . " Hits with runners in scoring position win games . We put up a fight at the end but it was not enough . Sometimes you get less than that and score more . It 's been a struggle for us . It 's not how many hits you get
column22: it 's how many runs you score
column23: but we scored enough runs . We just did n't pitch well . " 	 Shelley Duncan led off the Indians ' second with his seventh home run
column24: snapping an 0 - for-19 slump . Chris Gimenez 's double in the sixth scored Jayson Nix and Jason Donald . 	 Billy Butler grounded into his major league - leading 26th double play in the third inning
column25: tying a Royals single season record . John Wathan grounded into 26 double plays in 1982 . 	 Game notes 	  Kansas State basketball coach Frank Martin threw out the ceremonial first pitch . ... OF Jai Miller

column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- Joe Mauer put his smooth batting - title swing on a fifth - inning fastball from Gavin Floyd and watched it soar to left field
column2: as it has so many times this season at Minnesota 's new ballpark . 	 Another fly ball to the warning track
column5: the ball reached the seats . 	 Mauer had four hits
column6: two RBIs and his first regular - season home run at Target Field
column7: leading the Twins past the Chicago White Sox 7 - 6 on Wednesday night to increase their season - high lead in the AL Central to five games . 	 " I 've hit a lot of balls that way that have died
column8: so it 's good to get one over the wall
column10: who is batting .446 in 112 at - bats since the All - Star break with 15 doubles and 30 RBIs . 	 The Twins trailed 5 - 3 entering the bottom of the fifth against Floyd ( 8 - 10 )
column11: but Mauer 's opposite - field solo shot cut into the lead before a three - run sixth sealed it . 	 The Twins have won nine straight at home and 24 of their last 31 overall . Mauer
column13: has been a huge part of that
column14: raising his batting average to .335 during his midsummer surge . This was his eighth homer of the season
column15: down from a career - high 28 last year
column16: due in part to the deceptively deep power alleys at Target Field . 	 " It messes on you mentally
column17: " Mauer acknowledged . " You try to do different things that are out of what makes you do well . Yeah
column18: I fell into that trap a little bit
column19: but you try to just have good at - bats and stick with your game . " 	 Matt Capps gave up a run in the ninth one night after blowing the save
column20: but he recovered in time for his 31st save of the season -- five with Minnesota . Jeff Manship ( 1 - 0 ) and Jesse Crain got six outs in relief for a struggling Francisco Liriano . 	 Andruw Jones hit a three - run homer for the White Sox
column21: but they fell to 15 - 17 since their 26 - 5 run that stretched one game past the All - Star break . They are 4 - 10 this season against the Twins
column22: who improved to 33 - 17 against the Central and reached 20 games above .500 for the first time in nearly two years . 	 The Twins
column23: who had to rally from big deficits to win division titles in 2006 and 2009
column24: were wary of expressing too much confidence . 	 " It 's not that we have their number
column25: " right fielder Jason Kubel said . " We 've just been playing well . " 	 Liriano walked four and needed 106 pitches to get through five innings
column26: slamming his glove and cap down in disgust when he reached the dugout at the end of his last inning . The Sox got their fifth run when he fielded Carlos Quentin 's comebacker and threw to second for a force
column27: allowing Alex Rios to race home and score when the relay to first was a bit late to get the double play . 	 But Liriano was all over the place
column28: giving up consecutive walks to start the second before Jones smashed his 17th homer into the bullpen for a 3 - 2 lead right after pitching coach Rick Anderson came out for a visit . 	 That ended a streak of 96 1/3 innings by Liriano without giving up a long ball
column29: the second - most in Twins history . Bert Blyleven went 99 innings in 1974 - 75 . Liriano has allowed only three homers this season . 	 Manager Ozzie Guillen was upset the White Sox did n't take further advantage of Liriano 's wildness . 	 " We should 've scored more runs
column30: " Guillen said . " We could n't get it done . " 	 The players tried to stay positive . 	 " There are so many games left
column31: and teams go on streaks
column32: " Floyd said . " We all believe that we can still do it . There 's no doubt about that . So we need to keep battling . " 	 But this was another unquestionably stinging defeat . 	 " We 've got like a month left
column34: " Jones said . " We need to go out there and see what happens . 	 Jim Thome struck out three times
column35: but he walked after Michael Cuddyer 's chalk - dust double down the third - base line to start the sixth . Delmon Young doubled in Cuddyer to tie the game at 5
column36: and Danny Valencia hit a grounder that shortstop Alexei Ramirez grabbed with an off - balance scoop . 	 Ramirez fired across his body to try to get the not - so - sleek Thome
column37: who was thrown out at the plate on Tuesday
column38: but the ball arrived home late and off target while a sure out at first base was wasted . J.J. Hardy 's sacrifice fly
column39: caught by Juan Pierre as he banged into the left - field wall
column40: drove in Young for a two - run lead . 	 Game notes 	  Mauer 's double was his 39th
column41: tied for most in the league and already a career high . ... Pierre stole two bases to give him a majors - most 47 . The last time a White Sox player led the league in that category was Luis Aparicio in 1962 . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: PHOENIX -- Dusty Baker rarely uses the squeeze bunt
column2: let alone trying it with a 40 - year - old on third base with one out in the ninth inning . 	 But Jim Edmonds showed some hustle scoring from third base on pinch - hitter Chris Heisey 's perfectly executed bunt that scored the go - ahead run as the Cincinnati Reds rallied from a four - run deficit to beat the Arizona Diamondbacks 11 - 7 on Wednesday night . 	 Heisey dropped his bunt down the third base line and beat the throw to first base . He eventually scored on a sacrifice fly by Paul Janish
column4: trailing 7 - 3 in the top of the eighth
column5: struck for eight runs in the eighth and ninth in front of the smallest crowd in Diamondbacks history . 	 The Diamondbacks ' bullpen was the team 's undoing once again in a wild back - and - forth game that also featured some shoddy defense . Reliever Sam Demel gave up four runs in the top of the eighth on four straight hits . On came Aaron Heilman ( 3 - 4 )
column6: who allowed an RBI double in the eighth before serving up what would be the winning run in the ninth
column7: and three more after that . 	 " Every ball they hit was down the middle of the plate
column8: " Heilman said . 	 The Reds got help from an overthrow to home plate by Diamondbacks right fielder Justin Upton in the eighth . That allowed a run to score and kept the inning alive for Brandon Phillips to tie the game at 7 with a double
column9: and set the stage for the Reds ' 35th come - from - behind win of the season . 	 " The more you do things
column10: and the more you do them right
column11: and the more you believe it
column13: " Baker said . 	 " Gutsy call by Dusty
column15: whose two - run double in the ninth capped the comeback . " That was exciting and a lot of fun . " 	 Two - run homers from Chris Young and Adam LaRoche gave the Diamondbacks its biggest lead . Only 15
column16: 509 were on hand at Chase Field to see them rally from a 3 - 1 deficit with four runs in the fifth off starter Edinson Volquez . The right - hander was making his seventh start since returning from Tommy John surgery July 17 and struggled with his control early . 	 Volquez 's problems led to the Diamondbacks ' first run
column17: but his defense was mostly to blame for Arizona 's big inning . An error by left fielder Jonny Gomes allowed pinch - hitter Ryan Church to take second on a single with one out
column18: then Gomes and center fielder Drew Stubbs failed to hit the cutoff man on singles by Stephen Drew and Upton
column19: allowing both to take an extra base . Upton 's hit drove in Church and Drew to tie the game . 	 After getting Kelly Johnson to fly out
column20: Volquez lost the battle with Young
column21: who was hitting cleanup for only the second time this season . Volquez was removed after 4 2/3 innings . 	 The Reds took a three - game lead in the NL Central over the St. Louis Cardinals . 	 Cincinnati got solo home runs from Edmonds and Jay Bruce
column22: and Phillips took over the NL lead in runs scored with 84 . 	 " I could be critical of myself the way I handled the bullpen
column23: " Diamondbacks manager Kirk Gibson said . " Let 's not put it all on those guys . " 	 Edmonds
column24: acquired in a trade with Milwaukee on Aug. 9
column25: got the start at first base in place of All - Star Joey Votto
column26: who was scratched due to tightness in his back but could return to the lineup Thursday . 	 Arthur Rhodes ( 4 - 3 ) pitched a scoreless eighth to earn the win . 	 The record - low crowd came only two weeks after the previous franchise low
column27: when 15
column28: 670 watched the last - place Diamondbacks play Washington on Aug. 4 . 	 Game notes 	  Baker confirmed after the game that the Reds have offered him a contract extension
column29: adding that " It will take care of itself . " Baker is in the last year of a three - year contract he signed after the 2007 season
column30: and after two losing seasons
column31: has the Reds in position for the postseason . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: LOS ANGELES -- The start of the game was rough for Colorado 's Jason Hammel when he allowed a first - inning run to score on his second wild pitch to Andre Ethier . 	 Dodgers reliever Octavio Dotel did him one better . 	 Melvin Mora scored the go - ahead run on one of Dotel 's three wild pitches in the 10th
column2: and the Rockies nailed a runner at the plate for the final out Wednesday night to beat the Los Angeles Dodgers 3 - 2 . 	 " It 's just tough ; that 's all I can tell you
column3: " manager Joe Torre said . " He was just wild
column4: and unfortunately it cost us . We came away empty and wasted good pitching . " 	 After Dotel 's wild flings put the Rockies ahead
column5: they preserved the lead with two good throws . 	 With two outs in the bottom of the 10th and Reed Johnson on first base
column6: Scott Podsednik blooped a single in front of center fielder Dexter Fowler . 	 The ball skittered away
column7: but Fowler recovered quickly and threw to strong - armed shortstop Troy Tulowitzki near the second - base bag . 	 Third - base coach Larry Bowa frantically waved home Johnson
column8: but Tulowitzki 's relay to catcher Miguel Olivo beat the sliding Dodgers runner by several feet . 	 " We were shading Scotty a little deeper than normal
column10: because we did n't want the ball driven over any of our outfielders ' heads in that situation and give them an easy tying run
column11: " Rockies manager Jim Tracy said . " But it got between the infielders and outfielders
column13: find the ball very quickly and get it in . 	 " We had to make that type of a throw
column14: and that accurate of a throw
column15: or Reed Johnson was going to score . That is a lethal throwing arm at shortstop . Actually
column16: either [ Clint ] Barmes or Tulowitzki could make that throw . But if you have a choice in that situation
column17: from an arm strength standpoint
column18: the right guy threw the ball to the plate . " 	 The last out wrapped up a night of stellar defensive plays . 	 Rockies right fielder Carlos Gonzalez
column19: who began the day third in the National League batting race
column20: left with a bruised right knee after slamming against the fence and robbing Casey Blake of an RBI double to end the sixth inning . 	 Gonzalez was down on the warning track for several minutes with the ball still in his glove
column21: surrounded by Tracy and two trainers . Gonzalez left the field under his own power and exchanged high - fives in the dugout with his teammates . 	 " We had an incredible catch in right field that may have been the difference in the game
column23: Gonzalez will not be available for us tomorrow
column24: but we 're very hopeful of the fact that we will have him back on Friday . That 's what I was just told . " 	 The game was 2 - all in the 10th when Dotel ( 2 - 3 ) walked Mora with one out . Mora stole second on a strikeout by Eric Young
column25: then advanced on a wild pitch to Fowler
column26: who eventually walked . 	 Jason Giambi pinch - hit for Ryan Spilborghs
column27: and Mora came home as Dotel bounced another pitch past rookie catcher A.J. Ellis . Dotel uncorked one more wild one before retiring Tulowitzki on a grounder . 	 Rafael Betancourt ( 3 - 1 ) got the win
column28: striking out both batters he faced in the ninth . Huston Street got three outs for his ninth save in 12 chances . 	 The Rockies ' clubhouse was anything but celebratory
column29: because it was Brad Hawpe 's final game with the club he spent his first seven big league seasons with . 	 " I got my release
column30: " Hawpe said . " It 's sad to be leaving this team
column31: but that 's part of the game . In six weeks I was not going to be under contract and was going to be a free agent
column32: and things were n't going to work out for me to be here . So we had a bunch of discussions over the last few days . " 	 Hawpe
column33: one of the cornerstones of the Rockies ' 2007 NL championship team and a first - time All - Star last season
column34: cleared waivers on Wednesday amid talk he would be released . He 's hitting .255 with seven homers and 37 RBIs
column35: and he ended his Rockies career with a pinch - hit single in the seventh . The move does n't become official until Thursday
column36: when rookie reliever Matt Reynolds is expected to be activated . 	 " They said
column37: ' We 've got guys that have got to play in the outfield who are younger and are going to be with the team next year . So you can either continue to play or we can give you an opportunity to find another team that would need you in their lineup . ' So I 'm taking that opportunity and running with it . But I 'm going to be sad
column38: obviously
column39: " Hawpe said . 	 Tracy declined to talk about Hawpe 's impending departure after the game but had nothing but praise for him during batting practice . 	 " He 's been an integral part of this ballclub for a long period of time and he 's done a lot of very special things and had some very special moments here
column40: " Tracy said . " He has been a huge guy in our clubhouse
column41: as far as setting the tone as to how a winning major league player conducts himself . He gets all of that
column42: which is why this situation is so very difficult for me . It 's really hard . " 	 Hammel allowed two runs and two hits over six innings
column43: striking out four and walking four . 	 Game notes 	  Dodgers SS Rafael Furcal had a setback in his rehab from a strained lower back than has sidelined him since Aug. 3 . He will be re - examined on Thursday and undergo a bone scan . " I 'm trying to play
column45: but I have n't felt good the last couple
column47: " Furcal said . " I feel bad . " ... Dodgers LF Manny Ramirez ( calf injury )
column48: began a minor league rehab assignment Wednesday night with high Class A Inland Empire . But there 's no timetable for his return . " It 's going to have to eventually be him telling us
column49: " Torre said . " He has to test it to the point of feeling comfortable going out there
column50: because we do n't have the DH in this league and he is going to have to play [ left field ] . " 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column51: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column52: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: NEW YORK -- Robinson Cano and the New York Yankees turned a tight game into a rout during one dizzying spin through the batting order . 	 Cano hit a tiebreaking double and a two - run homer in New York 's nine - run sixth inning
column2: sending Phil Hughes and the Yankees to an 11 - 5 victory over the Detroit Tigers on Thursday . 	 Austin Kearns added a two - run double and Derek Jeter a two - run triple as New York 's offense
column3: still missing Alex Rodriguez and Lance Berkman because of injuries
column4: broke loose for the second consecutive day . 	 " Big hits by a lot of people
column5: " manager Joe Girardi said . " Our guys are picking up the slack . " 	 The big inning spoiled a homecoming for 21 - year - old Tigers pitcher Rick Porcello
column6: who made his first career start at Yankee Stadium . Porcello attended Seton Hall Prep in nearby West Orange
column8: and said he left at least 40 tickets for family and friends . 	 " I wish I could have done better for them
column9: " Porcello said . " It 's frustrating because I felt I had good stuff today . I did n't go out there completely overmatched . I felt comfortable out there . " 	 Miguel Cabrera hit his third homer in two games and fourth of the series for Detroit
column10: but there was no carry - over of beanballs from a testy game the night before . 	 The Yankees took the final three in a four - game series with the fading Tigers
column11: winning a series for the first time since taking three of four in Cleveland from July 26 - 29 . New York began the day tied with the Tampa Bay Rays atop the AL East . 	 Cano has homered in three straight wins while batting in A - Rod 's cleanup spot . He had three hits and scored three times . 	 " He has been tremendous
column12: " Girardi said . " He 's a dangerous hitter and he had a big day again today . We 've been without Alex for a few days and he 's stepped up . He 's stepped up all year for us . " 	 Porcello was handed a 2 - 0 lead on Cabrera 's first - inning homer
column13: giving the All - Star slugger 100 RBIs for the seventh consecutive season . But the right - hander
column14: who held New York hitless for 3 1/3 innings
column15: could n't hold it . 	 The Yankees had n't gotten a ball out of the infield before managing three straight singles in the fourth . Nick Swisher 's hit on a 3 - 0 pitch drove in one run and former Tiger Curtis Granderson tied it with a two - out single . 	 That 's how it stayed until the sixth
column16: when Mark Teixeira drew a leadoff walk after falling behind 0 - 2 in the count and scored on Cano 's double . 	 Swisher walked and Jorge Posada chased Porcello ( 5 - 11 ) with an RBI single on a 3 - 0 pitch for his 1
column17: 559th hit
column18: surpassing fellow catcher Thurman Munson for 17th place on the Yankees ' career list . 	 " I really enjoy the way he played and I really look up to him
column19: " Posada said . " It means a lot to me that I passed him today . " 	 After another walk
column20: Kearns greeted Robbie Weinhardt with a double to center . Granderson scored on a passed ball
column21: Jeter tripled off the center - field fence and Cano hit his 24th homer
column22: a drive to center that made it 11 - 2 and capped the scoring in a 34 - minute half - inning . 	 " It happened pretty quick
column23: " Kearns said . 	 Suddenly enjoying a big cushion
column24: Girardi took the opportunity to pull Hughes ( 15 - 5 ) after 84 pitches -- 61 for strikes . The right - hander retired his final 11 batters and gave up four hits in six innings . He struck out six and walked none . 	 Hughes was helped by two excellent defensive plays in a row in the fourth
column25: by Teixeira at first base and Granderson in center . 	 " I got some early swings and some early outs
column26: " Hughes said . 	 Sergio Mitre worked three innings for his first major league save . He allowed three runs
column27: including a solo homer by Jhonny Peralta . 	 " The wheels kind of fell off in the one inning a little bit
column28: " Tigers manager Jim Leyland said . " You ca n't make the mistakes we 're making right now . " 	 With a runner aboard and two outs in the first
column29: Cabrera drove a 3 - 2 breaking ball into the Yankees ' bullpen in right - center for his 31st home run . The slugger connected twice Wednesday night
column30: then was plunked in the back by an eighth - inning pitch from Chad Gaudin . 	 " That dude 's good . It seems like wherever you pitch him he can leave the ballpark
column31: " Swisher said . " Glad to get him out of here . " 	 Game notes 	  Tigers DH Johnny Damon received several warm hands as he wrapped up a return to Yankee Stadium . He went 2 - for-13 in the series . ... Detroit finished 3 - 4 on a seven - game road trip . ... The Yankees put Berkman on the 15 - day disabled list
column33: with a sprained right ankle and recalled infielder Eduardo Nunez from Triple - A Scranton / Wilkes - Barre . Nunez made his major league debut when he replaced Jeter at short in the seventh . ... Rodriguez ( strained left calf ) was out of the lineup for the third straight game and remains day to day . Ramiro Pena started at third . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column2: John Lannan is racking up quality starts and trimming points from his ERA . 	 Lannan pitched into the sixth inning and Nyjer Morgan had two hits in his return from the disabled list
column3: helping the Washington Nationals beat the Atlanta Braves 6 - 2 on Thursday . 	 Lannan ( 5 - 5 ) gave up two runs and seven hits in 5 1/3 innings
column4: improving to 3 - 0 with a 3.09 ERA in four starts since he returned from a six - week stay at Double - A Harrisburg . His ERA is down to 5.13 for the season after standing at 5.76 when he was demoted . 	 " I think I 'm close
column5: " the left - hander said when asked if he is close to returning to his top form . " That 's the main thing for me
column6: going out with confidence and conviction . ... I felt good . I was throwing fastballs on both sides of the plate . " 	 The NL East - leading Braves
column8: wrapped up a 5 - 2 homestand and will get a boost Friday when newly acquired first baseman Derrek Lee makes his first start for Atlanta in the opener of a weekend series in Chicago . Lee was acquired from the Cubs on Wednesday for three minor leaguers . 	 " We won both series ; we have to say it was a real good homestand
column10: who was anxious to see Lee in an Atlanta uniform . " We ca n't win every game . I keep thinking we can and ... we 've never done it yet . " 	 Eric Hinske played first base for Atlanta on Thursday and went 0 - for-4 with three strikeouts . 	 Morgan also scored twice and Willie Harris added a two - run homer in the ninth for Washington
column11: which jumped out to a 4 - 0 lead against Derek Lowe ( 11 - 11 ) . 	 Harris ' drive off Kyle Farnsworth drove in Adam Kennedy
column12: who led off with a walk . The homer by Harris
column16: landed in the Braves ' bullpen behind the right - field wall . 	 " I 'm a Georgia guy
column17: " Harris said . " It 's always good to win here against your old team . It makes you feel better . It may make your old team think maybe they should have kept you . " 	 Lowe pitched seven innings
column18: yielding six hits
column19: and was admittedly bothered by the warm weather . The temperature for the first pitch was 86 degrees and climbing . 	 " It 's a constant battle of the heat
column20: " Lowe said . " I ca n't remember pitching this many day games in my life in one year . That being said
column21: everyone 's out there in the same scenario . I get hot during night games . These day games are killing me . So I 'm happy I made it seven innings . " 	 Michael Morse
column22: making only his fourth start of the season at first base
column23: helped Washington get off to a fast start with a solo drive in the second inning for his ninth homer . 	 The shot ended a streak of 84 1/3 consecutive innings without a homer allowed by an Atlanta pitcher . 	 Morgan
column24: who returned from a sore hip
column25: singled to center in the third
column26: stole second and scored on Ian Desmond 's single . 	 Morgan led off the fifth with a single to left . He advanced to second on a wild pitch and scored on Roger Bernadina 's double to right . Ryan Zimmerman drove in Bernadina with a single to left to push the lead to 4 - 0 . 	 Nationals manager Jim Riggleman said he will give Bernadina
column27: a rookie
column28: a look in left field . Josh Willingham was placed on the 15 - day disabled list and will have surgery next week to repair a medial meniscus tear in his left knee . Riggleman said it is unlikely Willingham will return this season . 	 The Braves scored two runs off Lannan in the sixth . Omar Infante and Jason Heyward reached on singles and scored on Matt Diaz 's double to the right - field corner . 	 Catcher Wilson Ramos was 0 - for-4 in his first start for the Nationals since he was acquired in the July 30 trade that sent closer Matt Capps to the Minnesota Twins . 	 Game notes 	  The series attracted the two smallest crowds of the season at Turner Field . Thursday 's total of 15

column1: BALTIMORE -- Brian Matusz did his homework before facing the Texas Rangers
column2: a team he struggled against throughout his brief major league career . 	 The study session produced the desired results . 	 Matusz allowed five hits over eight innings
column3: and the Baltimore Orioles used a four - run seventh to defeat Colby Lewis and the skidding Rangers 4 - 0 on Thursday night . 	 Matusz ( 5 - 12 ) came in with a 10.95 ERA against Texas in three career starts
column4: including two this season in which he yielded a combined 11 runs over 5 1/3 innings . 	 This time
column6: struck out six and allowed only two runners to get past first base . No one got as far as third against the left - hander
column7: although Andres Blanco made a run for it before getting tagged out in a heated play . 	 " It definitely felt good out there today
column8: especially coming off two bad outings against Texas this year
column9: " Matusz said . " It 's a lineup that 's really hurt me in the past . " 	 He got ready for his start by discussing each batter with pitching coach Rick Kranitz and catcher Matt Wieters . 	 " I really wanted to make sure I was prepared and had a game plan

column18: who was tagged out at third by Wigginton while trying to stretch a double into a triple . Wigginton blocked the base with his leg

column23: " Blanco said . " It 's just kind of frustration . You get out

column26: when Daniel Cabrera

" Sometimes you get pitchers that go out there and they do n't have the luxury of getting runs

column2: Jonathan Sanchez did his talking on the mound . 	 Sanchez allowed just two hits while pitching into the ninth inning and Buster Posey lined a pair of RBI doubles
column3: leading the San Francisco Giants over the Philadelphia Phillies 5 - 2 on Thursday night . 	 The Giants averted a sweep in a matchup of NL wild - card contenders
column4: stopping their three - game slide and ending the Phillies ' four - game winning streak . 	 " The last thing you want to do is dig yourself too big a hole . I thought this was a big game for the guys
column5: " manager Bruce Bochy said . " We came out after a tough series against San Diego at home
column6: then lost the first two here . To get this last one against a very tough pitcher is big for this club . " 	 Sanchez publicly predicted a sweep before the Giants faced the NL West - leading San Diego Padres
column7: but the Padres beat the left - hander in the opening game and took two of three . 	 Sanchez ( 9 - 8) redeemed himself against the Phillies
column8: becoming the first Giants starting pitcher to record a win in 15 games
column9: dating to his victory over the Colorado Rockies on Aug. 3 . No runner reached second base against the lefty
column10: who retired 15 straight after hitting Chase Utley with a pitch in the fourth . 	 " He had a great look about him
column11: " Bochy said . " The last couple of starts
column13: he 'd probably like to take all of that back
column14: but you ca n't once you say it . He looked very determined to get back on track . " 	 Sanchez
column15: who was vying for his first complete game since his no - hitter against San Diego on July 10
column17: came out to start the ninth with a 5 - 0 lead . He gave up a leadoff single to Shane Victorino and was pulled with a 2 - 0 count on Placido Polanco . 	 Sergio Romo retired Polanco on a fly ball
column18: but Utley singled and Mike Sweeney hit a two - out
column19: two - run double . Bochy then went to closer Brian Wilson
column20: who retired Raul Ibanez on a fly ball for his 34th save in 37 opportunities . 	 " We needed the game
column21: to start winning again
column22: " Sanchez said . " We lost three games in row . To come back is good for us . I was just trying to go out
column23: get ahead and make them swing . " 	 Victorino had the Phillies ' first hit
column24: a hard single up the middle in the third . 	 Pablo Sandoval connected for the Giants
column25: hitting his ninth homer of the season and first while batting right - handed . Last season
column26: he hit 25 homers
column27: six off left - handed pitchers . 	 The Giants
column28: who had scored three or fewer runs in each of their past five games
column29: jumped on Cole Hamels ( 7 - 10 ) for three in the first . Freddy Sanchez singled and scored on a double by Posey
column30: who is 11 - for-25 ( .444 ) in his last six games . Jose Guillen and Juan Uribe added RBI singles later in the inning . 	 Sanchez took it from there . 	 " You get a couple of runs and you start pitching relaxed
column31: " Sanchez said . 	 Hamels had received eight runs of support in his previous six starts combined
column32: including losing consecutive 1 - 0 decisions . He departed after yielding five runs and seven hits in five innings . 	 " I was n't able to hit my spots
column33: " Hamels said . " When I finally did
column34: they hit me . You have to get ahead of them . I was n't able to execute . When you give up three in the first
column35: it 's tough to come back . When they put up five
column36: it 's really tough . " 	 The Giants needed a win before heading to St. Louis for a three - game series against the Cardinals
column37: in contention in the NL Central . 	 " Everybody 's destiny is in front of them
column38: " Bochy said . " It 's how you play and you have to win ballgames . It 's not about looking for help . You have to take care of business if you 're going to get there . " 	 Game notes 	  The attendance of 45

column1: PITTSBURGH -- Alex Sanabia did n't change anything about his approach when he found out he would be facing a major league team instead of starting against one from the Pacific Coast League . 	 Sanabia pitched 7 2/3 innings of four - hit ball
column2: Gaby Sanchez hit a three - run homer and the Florida Marlins beat the Pittsburgh Pirates 4 - 2 on Thursday night . 	 " That 's why he 's up here
column3: " Sanchez said of Sanabia after the Marlins won their third straight . " He went out there and shut them down . " 	 Sanabia ( 2 - 1 ) allowed one run
column4: struck out five and walked none in his fifth career start . The right - hander was recalled from Triple - A New Orleans on Wednesday night after Sean West was scratched from his start due to right knee inflammation . 	 Sanabia was 6 - 1 with a 1.92 ERA in 16 minor - league starts this season . He has allowed one run or less in four of his five starts for the Marlins . 	 " I 'm keeping things the same
column6: a 32nd - round draft pick in 2006 . " When I 'm up here
column7: I 'm still doing the same I do [ in the minors ] . I 'm not changing anything . " 	 Sanabia had allowed only two singles and had faced only one more than the minimum until Chris Snyder and Argenis Diaz hit consecutive two - out doubles in the eighth to chase him . 	 Clay Hensley struck out pinch - hitter Delwyn Young to end the inning . Leo Nunez allowed Andrew McCutchen 's 12th homer before finishing for his 28th save and second in as many nights . 	 " [ Sanabia ] was outstanding
column8: " Marlins manager Edwin Rodriguez said . " He was in New Orleans ready to start

column18: allowing 29 earned runs in 32 1/3 innings over the dismal stretch . 	 Pittsburgh has lost of 10 of 11 and 21 of 27 and owns baseball 's worst record . The Pirates scored four runs over the final three games of the series . 	 " When the other guy 's putting up zeros

column1: BOSTON -- Torii Hunter could n't sleep at night
column2: not with his Los Angeles Angels mired in another losing streak . Their 0 - 9 record against the Red Sox this season was n't helping
column3: either . 	 So the Angels outfielder called a players - only meeting before Thursday night 's series and season finale against Boston

column6: " Hunter said after collecting three hits . " There 's music playing

column1: HOUSTON -- Houston 's last nine wins have been come - from - behind victories . 	 The Astros have rallied so often lately that they have come to expect a late comeback . 	 Carlos Lee hit a three - run homer in the seventh inning and the Astros did it again on Thursday night
column2: beating the New York Mets 3 - 2 . 	 " We 've been fighting back a lot lately and winning a lot of games coming from behind
column3: " Lee said . " Now we feel like it 's never over until it 's over . So it seems like we get a hit here and there ... and then a big hit . " 	 Angel Sanchez and Hunter Pence singled with no outs before Lee drove Pat Misch 's next pitch to the Crawford Boxes in left field . 	 " They found the right spots and then we kind of decided to go in with Lee
column4: " Misch said . " He guessed right and crushed it . I could have gotten it in a little bit farther
column6: and guessed right . He got it
column7: and that is what he gets paid to do . " 	 Misch ( 0 - 2 ) was rolling before the trouble in the seventh
column8: retiring 16 straight hitters after Pence 's two - out double in the first . 	 " We were 1 - for-19 or something like that against this guy until the seventh inning and to see the guys put some good at - bats together and get some hits was good
column9: " Houston manager Brad Mills said . " Being able to finally get some guys on and get something going was big . Of course when you get a big hit like that
column10: that 's huge . " 	 Bud Norris ( 6 - 7 ) pitched seven solid innings for Houston
column11: yielding two runs and two hits . Wilton Lopez worked the eighth before Brandon Lyon tossed a perfect ninth for his fifth save
column12: completing the three - hitter . 	 New York scored both of its runs in the fourth . Angel Pagan walked
column13: stole second and advanced on a groundout before coming home on Jeff Francoeur 's bouncer to shortstop . Chris Carter added a run - scoring infield hit . 	 Mets manager Jerry Manuel is disappointed with his team 's recent hitting slump . 	 " We have to do more offensively
column14: " Manuel said . " We have to find a way to get it done . That 's a poor effort on our part offensively . We just have to do better . Period . It 's pathetic . " 	 Norris settled down after the shaky fourth
column15: retiring the last 10 batters he faced . The right - hander struck out four and walked two while throwing 123 pitches
column16: improving to 4 - 0 with a 3.31 ERA in his last five starts . 	 " I went in the tunnel and took a deep breath and said : ' Hey
column17: it 's done . It 's over with . You 've still got to go out there and pitch
column18: ' " Norris said of getting back on track after the fourth inning . " My pitch count was already pretty high
column19: but my arm felt good and I had no trouble throwing a lot of pitches and I went out there and regrouped and pitched good from there on out . " 	 Lopez yielded a hit in the eighth and has n't allowed a run in his last 17 outings . 	 Misch gave up three runs and four hits in six - plus innings . 	 Misch singled with one out in the third for the first hit off Norris
column20: who retired the next two batters before running into trouble in the fourth inning . 	 Game notes 	  Houston placed IF Jeff Keppinger on the 15 - day DL with an injured left big toe and purchased the contract of IF Anderson Hernandez from Triple - A Round Rock after the game . ... The Astros activated INF Tommy Manzella from the DL . He had been out with a fractured left index finger . ... RHP Brian Moehler
column21: on the DL with a tear in his groin
column22: felt good after throwing three innings of a simulated game on Thursday . He could be ready to go on a rehabilitation assignment soon . ... The Mets optioned OF Fernando Martinez to Triple - A Buffalo to make room on the roster for Rod Barajas

column2: Mo. -- One night after collecting 17 hits and losing
column3: the Cleveland Indians made a season - high five errors
column4: had a runner thrown out at every base and won . 	 Shin - Soo Choo hit a tiebreaking RBI single in a five - run eighth inning and the Indians rallied to beat the Kansas City Royals 7 - 3 on Thursday night . 	 " We made a lot of mistakes and it was n't a pretty game
column5: " Indians manager Manny Acta said . " Five errors
column9: but it was not a pretty game . We put together a lot of good at - bats there in the eighth inning that won us the ballgame . " 	 Cleveland 's last victory when they committed five errors was July 12
column11: at Minnesota . 	 Asdrubal Cabrera had two hits and drove in two runs for the Indians
column12: while Matt LaPorta and Jayson Nix had two hits apiece . 	 LaPorta had a 13 - pitch at - bat in the eighth before hitting an RBI single to center off Royals starter Kyle Davies . 	 " It came down to the LaPorta at - bat
column13: " Davies said . " I threw him everything I had . He was able to foul off some really tough pitches . He fought them off . I had to throw him a strike 3 - 2 and I hung the cutter and he hit it . 	 " It 's really disappointing . We wanted to get the sweep . We had them 3 - 0
column14: one out in the eighth inning and nobody on and the starter is still in . " 	 Davies was pulled two pitches later after giving up a single to Jason Donald . 	 " It was nice to help out
column15: " LaPorta said . " I was just trying to stay out there . He kept throwing me good pitches and I just kept fouling them off . He threw a great game . My at - bat pushed him over a 100 [ pitches ]
column16: but he was still coming at me . He was still throwing 96 [ mph ] and mixing in breaking balls and changeups . He was still pitching well . I just kept fighting . " 	 Rafael Perez ( 4 - 0 )
column17: the fourth of five Indians pitchers
column18: pitched 1 1/3 scoreless innings and Chris Perez got four outs for his 15th save in 19 opportunities . 	 Alex Gordon had three hits and Wilson Betemit drove in two runs for Kansas City
column19: which had won three straight . Davies allowed three runs and seven hits in 7 1/3 innings . 	 Betemit hit a two - out
column20: two - run single in the fifth inning to give Kansas City a 3 - 0 lead . The Royals had a chance at a bigger inning
column21: with four singles
column22: a walk and an Indians error
column23: but Mitch Maier struck out to leave the bases loaded . 	 Cleveland had seven singles and a walk in the eighth
column24: sending 11 men to the plate . LaPorta and pinch - hitter Shelley Duncan had RBI singles . Cabrera drove in a run with a sacrifice fly before Choo 's clutch hit
column25: and Travis Hafner capped the big inning with a run - scoring infield hit . 	 Blake Wood ( 1 - 3 )
column26: who replaced Davies
column27: recorded just one out and was charged with two runs and two hits . 	 " It always stings when you play a game like that and lose it late
column28: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " They hurt more than the other ones . " 	 Cabrera also had an RBI double in Cleveland 's two - run ninth . 	 The Indians ' shoddy defense hurt them in the fourth when first baseman LaPorta 's throwing error allowed Billy Butler to score . LaPorta fielded Maier 's grounder with the bases loaded and threw wildly to home . 	 Cleveland center fielder Michael Brantley sprained his left ankle grounding out in the ninth . The Indians said X - rays were negative and Brantley is day to day . 	 Maier left after seven innings with a stiff neck and was replaced by Jai Miller
column29: who made his Royals debut . 	 Rookie right - hander Mitch Talbot allowed three runs
column30: two earned
column31: and eight hits in 4 2/3 innings for Cleveland . Talbot is winless in seven starts since a June 27 victory at Cincinnati . 	 " It was kind of crazy how we turned it around
column32: " Talbot said . 	 Game notes 	  Acta addressed his slumping team during a pregame meeting . " We 're a young team
column33: but I have the right to tell them that I 'm not happy with the way we 're playing the last 12 days
column34: " he said . " We wanted them to know we 're not going to be rebuilding forever . These guys are not September callups . These guys have a legit chance to be a long - term part of this club . It 's about making progress . That 's the reason for the meeting . " ... Royals RHP Gil Meche reports Saturday to Triple - A for a minor league rehab assignment as a reliever . Meche is on the 60 - day disabled list with a shoulder injury . ... column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- Just when the Minnesota Twins really looked to be grabbing hold of the AL Central division
column3: Mark Buehrle and the Chicago White Sox delivered an emphatic message : This race is far from over . 	 Konerko had five hits and four RBIs and Buehrle pitched seven shutout innings to help the White Sox slow surging Minnesota with an 11 - 0 romp on Thursday night . 	 Buehrle ( 12 - 9 ) allowed five hits and struck out four . Konerko hit his 31st home run and had a double and three singles among Chicago 's 21 hits to help the Sox avoid a sweep and shave the Twins ' lead to four games in the AL Central . 	 " We will fight to the end
column4: " manager Ozzie Guillen said . " How 's the fight going to go ? I do n't know how the fight is going to go
column5: but we 're going to fight like a champ . We 're not down . " 	 Carl Pavano ( 15 - 8) set a career high and tied a club record with 15 hits allowed . He gave up seven runs in six innings . The Twins lost at sold - out Target Field for the first time in 10 games and missed a chance to take a six - game lead in the division . 	 " We expect it to be all the way down to the end
column6: " Twins manager Ron Gardenhire said of the race . " We 'll attack it as is . " 	 Mark Teahen and Alexei Ramirez each had three hits and two RBIs for the White Sox . Ramirez 's two - run homer in the eighth off Glen Perkins made it 11 - 0 . 	 In the first two games of the series
column7: the Twins rallied in the late innings to win . With Buehrle dealing and the Sox slugging
column8: Minnesota had no chance in this one . 	 Buehrle allowed just three baserunners past first base all night long
column9: an encouraging sign for a guy who was 1 - 4 with a 6.69 ERA in his last six starts against the Twins . 	 The fast - working lefty was n't the only White Sox player who has struggled against the Twins . Chicago lost 10 of the first 14 meetings in the season series and there was talk that the Twins held some kind of mental edge that could prove too much to overcome in the final six weeks of the season . 	 But the Sox brushed that aside in a big way on Thursday night . 	 " Obviously
column10: you do n't want to get down too much
column11: " Buehrle said . " There 's 40 some odd games left
column12: but you get down to a team like this
column13: they 're a great team and the way they 've been playing . 	 " And the way we 've been playing
column14: if we dig ourselves too big of a hole
column15: then it 's going to be hard to come out of . Must win or not
column16: we won the game
column17: that 's all that matters . " 	 Pavano entered the game hoping to join CC Sabathia as the only two 16 - game winners in the AL . But as great as he has been all year for the Twins
column18: there were signs that a rougher start was coming . 	 The mustachioed righty allowed 132 baserunners in 125 innings before the All - Star break
column19: but the hits were starting to come in bunches recently . Pavano has allowed 48 baserunners in his last 25 1/3 innings pitched . 	 " Maybe I 'm getting a little too much of the plate and the ball 's up a little bit or maybe I 'm being a little too predictable as far as my pitch sequences
column20: " Pavano said . " It 's something I 'm going to have to revisit and look at and make some adjustments
column21: that 's for sure . " 	 He was able to pitch out of jams effectively in his previous four outings
column22: winning three of them . 	 No such luck this time around . 	 The White Sox jumped on Pavano early
column23: getting two runs and four hits
column24: including an RBI single by Teahen
column25: to take a 2 - 0 lead in the first . 	 Teahen added an RBI - triple in the third and A.J. Pierzynski followed with a double off the wall in right - center to make it 4 - 0 . 	 Konerko led off the fifth with a solo shot
column26: essentially putting the game out of reach for a Twins offense iced by Buehrle . 	 Twins right fielder Jason Kubel was asked if he thought this race would come down to the wire . 	 " I sure hope not
column27: " he said . " But if it does
column28: we 'll be ready . " 	 Game notes 	  Twins SS Nick Punto left the game in the fifth inning after straining his left hamstring on a slide into second base . It 's the same injury that landed him on the DL earlier this month . Gardenhire said Punto will be examined by team doctors on Friday . ... White Sox RHP J.J. Putz left the game in the eighth inning with right knee inflammation . He is listed as day - to - day . ... Buehrle got some help on defense
column29: too
column30: getting a great diving stab from ageless 3B Omar Vizquel to save a run . ... Chicago leadoff man Juan Pierre
column31: who had three hits
column32: was hit with a pitch by Perkins in the eighth . It 's the 17th time he 's been hit this year
column33: tying him with teammate Carlos Quentin for most in the AL . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: PHOENIX -- Another win for Cincinnati . Another hero for the Reds . 	 On Thursday night
column3: who with Jay Bruce hit back - to - back homers in the fourth inning to break a scoreless tie and Cincinnati beat the Arizona Diamondbacks 9 - 5 . 	 The victory gave the Reds a three - game sweep over the NL West cellar dwellers
column4: and was Cincinnati 's sixth straight win overall
column5: the team 's longest streak of the season . 	 The Reds took a season - high 3 1/2 - game lead over the St. Louis Cardinals for first place in the NL Central and won their seventh straight road game . 	 Hernandez
column6: on a .360 tear with two home runs since coming off the disabled list on July 22
column7: blasted a three - run shot to left field on the first pitch he saw from Joe Saunders ( 7 - 13 ) . Bruce followed with his second homer in as many nights . It was the seventh time the Reds hit back - to - back homers this season . 	 " I have n't been thinking that I was injured
column8: " Hernandez said . " I get ready the same way and try to stay patient and wait for the pitch I 'm looking for . Nothing more than trying to make good contact with the ball and I 'm being aggressive in the strike zone . ... I do n't try for home runs . " 	 Travis Wood
column9: called up from Triple - A Louisville on Thursday to join the starting rotation for the time being
column10: lasted 6 1/3 innings and allowed one run and four hits with six strikeouts . Wood ( 4 - 1 ) lowered his ERA to 2.51 . 	 " Everything was feeling pretty good
column11: " Wood said . " We 're playing well right now . Three here
column12: we 've got tough games in L.A. coming up
column13: so hopefully we can carry it over and just keep moving on with it . " 	 Hernandez 's homer drove in Scott Rolen
column16: whose single put runners at first and third with one out . 	 The Diamondbacks made it 4 - 1 on Mark Reynolds ' 27th home run in the bottom of the fifth . 	 Saunders gave up four runs and eight hits over six innings and lost his third straight game in his fifth start with Arizona . 	 Saunders
column17: dealing with flu - like symptoms
column18: gave up four runs and eight hits over six innings and lost his third straight game in his fifth start with Arizona . 	 " It is a simple fact that I made two bad pitches
column19: " Saunders said . " I should have known that Ramon was going to be aggressive with runners in scoring position . ... It was n't a bad pitch
column20: just probably the wrong pitch . " 	 The Reds added the rest of their runs in the eighth after a two - out fielding error by Diamondbacks left fielder Rusty Ryal
column21: who dropped what should have been the third out after making a catch . A walk and pinch - single by Laynce Nix followed
column22: then another walk and Drew Stubbs ' two - run single . 	 " Rusty made the error . The guy busts his tail every day and we have to pick him up
column23: " Diamondbacks manager Kirk Gibson said . " Sometimes it seems like we are far away but really not . When you play a team like this and they are on a roll like this
column24: it can be disappointing . " 	 The Reds ( 70 - 51 ) put five runs on the board in the eighth
column25: capped off with Joey Votto 's two - run double . Votto was back in the lineup after missing Wednesday 's game with a sore back . 	 The Diamondbacks had a four - run eighth that included a three - run home run by Chris Young . 	 Game notes 	  To make room for Wood
column26: the Reds optioned RHP Carlos Fisher to Triple - A Louisville . Fisher 's designation meant that rookie Mike Leake
column27: who has started 22 games but struggled in his past two
column28: was moved to the bullpen . Manager Dusty Baker said Fisher will get a September call - up . ... The official scorer changed what was ruled a sacrifice fly and RBI for Nix on Wednesday in the eighth inning to a fly out with no RBI and an error on Arizona RF Justin Upton for an overthrow of home plate . Hernandez scored on the play . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
