column2: Calif. -- Trevor Cahill was in trouble for the first time in a month . 	 Cliff Pennington bailed him out . 	 Pennington 's two - run go - ahead double in the sixth inning stood up and the Oakland Athletics beat the Tampa Bay Rays 4 - 3 Thursday night . 	 " He 's very talented
column5: " Oakland manager Bob Geren said of his All - Star pitcher . " He does n't let things bother him and it works to his advantage . It 's a real perfect pitcher 's mentality . " 	 Cahill allowed seven hits over eight innings
column6: and got some more help from Coco Crisp
column7: who made a game - turning catch to rob Matt Joyce of a home run . 	 Cahill ( 13 - 5 ) allowed just one earned run in his previous 33 innings
column8: gave up a pair of home runs and was on the hook for the loss until Pennington 's two - out hit off reliever Dan Wheeler gave the A 's their third straight win following a four - game losing streak . 	 The right - hander entered the game on a roll
column9: carrying a 0.27 ERA over his last five starts . He settled down after Evan Longoria 's solo homer in the sixth and retired seven of the final eight batters he faced . 	 " I 'm just trying to throw strikes and keep the walks down
column10: " Cahill said . " It helps when we have defense like we had tonight . Baseball 's kind of a streaky game and I 'm just on the positive side of a streak right now . I ca n't really attribute it to anything . " 	 Jerry Blevins pitched the ninth for his first career save . 	 Pennington also had a winning single in the bottom of the ninth of Wednesday 's 5 - 4 win over Toronto . 	 " Getting two - out hits is what this team has to do to win ballgames
column11: " Pennington said . " When we get a big two - out hit it 's just huge whoever it is . " 	 Tampa Bay had been cruising until then with a 3 - 1 lead . 	 " I felt real good about Danny in that spot on what was coming up right there
column12: " Rays manager Joe Maddon said . " He 's not normally one to walk somebody in that moment and it just happened . I liked him on Pennington
column13: too . It just did n't work . " 	 Just as critical was Oakland 's defense . 	 The A 's turned two double plays behind Cahill and got the big catch from Crisp
column14: who made a leaping grab at the wall to steal a home run from Joyce after the Rays had taken a 3 - 1 lead . 	 " That was such a big play when you look at it now
column15: " Geren said . " You never know on defense when you can make a play that can win a game for you but looking back
column16: that was one that really changed the outcome . " 	 Carlos Pena also homered for the Rays
column17: who snapped a five - game winning streak and fell one game behind the Yankees in the AL East . 	 It was the third straight win for Oakland after being held to one hit by Toronto 's Shaun Marcum on Monday . The A 's also made it back to .500 for the 21st time this season
column18: two shy of the franchise most set in 1947 by the Philadelphia A 's . 	 It was n't easy . 	 Tampa Bay starter Andy Sonnanstine stymied Oakland 's offense for five innings despite pitching with runners on base in every inning but one
column19: while his teammates muscled up in a rare show of power against Cahill . 	 Cahill had not allowed a home run since July 17 before giving up a two - run shot to Pena in the fourth and a solo shot to Longoria in the sixth . 	 Sonnanstine scattered five hits over 5 1/3 innings in just his third start of the season . The right - hander
column20: who began the season in the Rays ' bullpen
column21: walked three and struck out three before leaving with two runners on and out in the sixth . 	 Wheeler ( 2 - 1 ) relieved Sonnanstine and walked Kevin Kouzmanoff to load the bases then gave up an RBI grounder to Rajai Davis that made it 3 - 2 . Pennington followed with a line drive double down the right field line to give the A 's the lead . 	 Pena
column22: who had missed 14 games on the disabled list until being activated Monday
column23: went just 2 for 14 in the Rays ' three - game sweep of Texas before collecting a pair of hits off Cahill
column24: including his team - leading 24th homer . 	 Longoria 's homer with one out in the sixth made it 3 - 1 . Joyce nearly added to the Rays lead two batters later until Crisp jumped at the wall and caught the ball to rob Joyce of a home run . 	 Game notes 	  A 's closer Andrew Bailey will pitch one inning for Triple - A Sacramento on Friday

column1: LOS ANGELES -- The resurrection of Ted Lilly with the Los Angeles Dodgers is progressing by leaps and bounds . It seems like he keeps one - upping himself with every start . 	 The 34 - year - old left - hander threw a two - hitter to win his fourth straight outing since joining the Dodgers
column2: and Reed Johnson hit his first homer of the season in a 2 - 0 victory over the Colorado Rockies on Thursday night . 	 " Lilly 's had great starts every time out for us
column3: " manager Joe Torre said . " Tonight we needed a lift
column4: and he just took it on his shoulders and went for it . Teddy over the years -- and I had him in New York -- was like a five-
column5: six - inning guy because his pitch count would always be high . But I 've seen him mature in a different uniform . He 's come a long way . He has stood the test of time
column6: for me . " 	 Lilly ( 7 - 8) had a season - high 11 strikeouts
column7: walked two and retired 19 consecutive batters in his third career shutout . Dexter Fowler lined a double past third baseman Casey Blake and down the left - field line with one out in the first
column8: and the Rockies did n't get another baserunner until Troy Tulowitzki grounded a single through the middle with two outs in the seventh . 	 Lilly retired his final 20 batters in his Dodgers debut on Aug. 3 at Chavez Ravine when he pitched seven innings of two - hit ball in a 2 - 1 victory over San Diego . The two - time All - Star came to Los Angeles from the Chicago Cubs just before the non - waiver trade deadline along with second baseman Ryan Theriot . 	 " I 'm feeling good about what I 'm doing
column10: who has a 1.29 ERA since the trade . " I 'm going to enjoy this tonight
column11: but I know I 've got to be prepared for my next start against Milwaukee . I do n't think I 'm ever going to get totally comfortable
column12: because the competition 's too good for that . " 	 The 110 - pitch complete game was Lilly 's fifth in 277 career starts and first in 174 starts since Aug. 23
column14: when he beat Boston 3 - 0 at Toronto with a three - hitter and a career - high 13 strikeouts . 	 " It 's important to get that first strike and move the ball around from there
column15: " he said . " I 've had a few spurts where I 've gotten erratic . But for the most part
column16: I 've been able to throw strike one and work off of that
column17: whether it 's with the fastball or breaking ball . " 	 The complete - game shutout was the Dodgers ' third this season
column18: with one each by Chad Billingsley and Vicente Padilla . 	 " Lilly was living on the corners tonight
column19: " Rockies right fielder Ryan Spilborghs said . " He was doing a good job of hitting the corners on both sides of the plate and using his off - speed stuff . If his location 's there and he 's getting the corners
column21: that makes him really difficult . 	 " We hit some balls hard off of him that very easily could have turned our innings around . He did n't make a mistake missing any balls in the middle of the plate . And if he did
column22: we were fouling them off or hitting them right at their guys . " 	 The Rockies ' frustration boiled over in the eighth
column23: when Miguel Olivo was ejected by umpire Laz Diaz for arguing a called third strike on a curveball and slamming his bat with both hands . Manager Jim Tracy came out and acted as a shield between Olivo and Diaz
column24: but was not ejected . 	 " For a two - strike breaking ball
column25: I would have wanted it maybe a little bit lower
column26: but I definitely thought I threw it for a strike
column27: " Lilly said . " Obviously he did n't like the call . " 	 Jorge De La Rosa ( 4 - 4 ) allowed two runs
column28: five hits and four walks over seven innings for Colorado . The left - hander is 1 - 3 with a 5.16 ERA in eight starts since missing 67 games because of a torn tendon in his middle finger . 	 Johnson
column29: who was thrown out at the plate in the 10th inning Wednesday night for the final out of the Dodgers ' 3 - 2 loss
column30: drove De La Rosa 's 2 - 2 pitch into the left - field pavilion in the second inning after a walk to Blake . The homer was his first since June 19
column32: for the Cubs against Cleveland and Cliff Lee . 	 " I used my fastball more tonight and located it very good
column33: so they hit a lot of ground balls
column34: " De La Rosa said . " The pitch to Johnson was a mistake . I think he was looking for that pitch . I threw it right there and I paid for it . But that 's part of baseball . I was facing a very good pitcher
column35: so you 've got to give him credit . " 	 Game notes 	  The Dodgers placed Padilla on the 15 - day DL because of a bulging disk in his neck . Padilla
column37: has given up 12 runs
column38: 14 hits
column39: two homers and four walks in 9 1/3 innings since Aug. 4 . ... Todd Helton was 0 - for-2 with a walk and is 1 - for-29 against the Dodgers through the first nine meetings . He came into this season batting .294 against them with 38 homers and 122 RBIs . ... Johnson

column1: CHICAGO -- Derrek Lee struggled in his first game with the Atlanta Braves and still had a good time . 	 This was exactly what the big first baseman expected when he joined the NL East leaders . 	 Rick Ankiel hit a bases - loaded triple off a wild Carlos Marmol with two out in the ninth inning
column2: lifting Lee and the Braves to a 5 - 3 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Friday . 	 " You can see the difference with a winning team
column4: who was dealt to Atlanta on Wednesday after nearly seven seasons with the Cubs . " When you 're playing well
column5: you have the confidence . " 	 Marmol entered with a 3 - 2 lead and walked three of the first four batters he faced . After Melky Cabrera struck out
column6: Ankiel lined a 2 - 2 pitch into the right - field corner . 	 Atlanta leads the majors with 22 wins in its final at - bat and Ankiel
column7: who arrived last month in a trade with the Kansas City Royals
column8: was happy to finally do the honors . He entered the game with only three RBIs since joining the team . 	 " It 's almost like we get extra adrenaline -- whatever you want to call it -- when it comes to late in the game
column9: " Ankiel said . " It 's a special feeling . It always feels like we 're never out of it
column10: no matter what . " 	 Lee received a standing ovation before his first at - bat and went 0 - for-4 . He struck out
column11: flied out and lined out against best buddy Ryan Dempster before striking out against Marmol for the first out of the ninth . 	 Dempster stepped off the mound in the first inning so Lee could enjoy the applause . He waved his helmet to the crowd before flying out on the first pitch
column12: stranding a runner at third . 	 " I was happy to hear the crowd give him the ovation he deserved
column13: " Dempster said . " I thought I respected him a lot
column14: and then you really realize the respect you have for a guy like that . I 'm excited for him . He 's going to a first - place team
column15: playing with a great bunch of guys for a great manager . And he 's got a chance to go to the playoffs and win a World Series . " 	 The Cubs lost their eighth straight home game -- their longest skid in four years -- and fifth consecutive overall . 	 " A tough stretch
column16: " said Dempster
column17: who pitched eight strong innings but was denied his fourth straight victory . " Sometimes you find ways to lose instead of finding ways to win . " 	 Marmol ( 2 - 3 ) walked Martin Prado
column18: Brian McCann and Alex Gonzalez before Ankiel 's hit . It was his fifth blown save in 26 chances . 	 " You just ca n't walk people with a lead
column19: " Cubs manager Lou Piniella said . " We walk three of them
column20: and that 's what cost us the ballgame . " 	 Billy Wagner retired three straight hitters after Darwin Barney 's leadoff single in the Chicago ninth
column21: earning his 30th save and No . 415 for his career . He fanned two to move into a tie with Jesse Orosco for the most strikeouts by a left - handed reliever with 1
column22: 169 . 	 Ankiel also made a nice catch in center field to rob Starlin Castro in the first and later threw out Koyie Hill trying to stretch a single into a double . 	 " I told our trainer before the game that he was going to have a great series
column23: " Braves manager Bobby Cox said . Of the team 's NL - high 37th comeback victory
column24: he added : " We expect to do it . It 's happened so often . A different guy all the time . Amazing . " 	 Dempster allowed two runs and four hits
column25: retiring the last nine batters he faced . He is 3 - 0 with a 1.65 ERA in four starts this month . 	 Peter Moylan ( 5 - 2 ) pitched a perfect eighth in relief of Jair Jurrjens
column26: who gave up three runs and nine hits in seven innings for Atlanta . 	 Hill singled in a run in the second
column27: but Atlanta tied it in the third on Omar Infante 's home run and grabbed a 2 - 1 lead on Gonzalez 's RBI double in the fourth -- the final hit allowed by Dempster . 	 Aramis Ramirez homered in the bottom half for the Cubs and doubled in Marlon Byrd in the sixth . Ramirez has 12 homers and 33 RBIs in his last 37 games after failing to produce in the first half of the season . 	 Game notes 	  Cubs outfielder Tyler Colvin will play first base for the first time during next week 's series at Washington
column28: Piniella said . The Cubs want to see if Colvin
column29: who last played the position as a college sophomore
column30: is a legitimate option at first for next season . Piniella said he wanted Colvin 's first games there to come on the road

column1: BALTIMORE -- C.J. Wilson had his way with the Baltimore Orioles in a commanding performance that included a career - high 12 strikeouts . 	 Unfortunately
column2: the left - hander had no control over Texas Rangers manager Ron Washington . 	 Wilson came within an out of his third career complete game
column3: allowing only three hits in a 2 - 0 victory over the Orioles on Friday night that ended Texas ' four - game losing streak . 	 Wilson ( 12 - 5 ) retired 16 straight batters until Brian Roberts led off the ninth with a double . Before that
column4: the only two Baltimore hits were by Julio Lugo -- a first - inning single and a double in the third . 	 After Roberts ' double
column5: Wilson struck out Lugo and retired Felix Pie on a groundout . Then Washington emerged from the dugout
column6: and Wilson decided he was n't going to merely flip the ball to the manager and walk off the mound . 	 " He knows I hate getting pulled . He was like
column7: ' Do n't even think about it right now
column8: ' " Wilson said . " I just looked at him . He 's like
column9: ' Do n't even look at me like that . ' " 	 Washington
column11: got his way . Neftali Feliz entered and retired pinch - hitter Luke Scott on a foul pop up for his 30th save
column12: the first for Texas in August . 	 Mitch Moreland homered and Josh Hamilton had two hits and an RBI for the Rangers
column13: who ended a six - game road skid . 	 Wilson struck out every Baltimore starter at least once in surpassing his previous career high of 10 . 	 " It 's not about the strikeouts
column14: it 's more about keeping them contained
column15: " he said . " If every single dude hits a groundball to the shortstop
column16: we 're probably going to get them all out
column17: so it does n't really matter . " 	 Nick Markakis
column18: the lone left - handed batter in the Baltimore lineup
column19: fanned three times . After the third one
column20: in which all three strikes were called
column21: Markakis animatedly complained to home plate umpire Jeff Nelson and received his first career ejection . 	 " The first two at - bats ... he made good pitches
column22: " Markakis said . " I feel in that last at - bat
column23: I did n't get one strike thrown to me and I was on my way back to the dugout . " 	 Orioles manager Buck Showalter continued the argument after Markakis left and kept on griping into the ninth
column24: when he was finally ejected by Nelson after a close pitch to Texas ' Elvis Andrus was ruled outside the strike zone . It was Showalter 's first ejection since he made his debut with Baltimore on Aug. 3 . 	 " There are so many pitches during the course of a game that can go either way . We understand that completely
column25: " Showalter said . " We just want our share . That 's all . " 	 The defeat dropped the Orioles ' record under Showalter to 11 - 7 . 	 Baltimore starter Jake Arrieta ( 4 - 5 ) gave up two runs
column26: one earned
column27: and eight hits in 6 2/3 innings . The rookie allowed at least one runner in every inning but received aid from catcher Matt Wieters
column28: who threw out a would - be basestealer and picked a runner off second base . 	 " Two throws right on the money . You ca n't ask for more than that
column29: " Arrieta said . 	 Arrieta was good ; Wilson was better . 	 " He mixed it up
column30: in and out
column31: kept the ball down . That was the biggest thing I saw from him
column32: " Arrieta said . " It 's good to see that
column33: a pitcher throwing that well . I can really respect that . " 	 Moreland put the Rangers up 1 - 0 in the second inning with his third home run
column34: an opposite - field fly to left that carried just inside the foul pole and barely cleared the seven - foot wall . 	 Texas added an unearned run in the seventh . After shortstop Cesar Izturis mishandled a grounder
column35: Hamilton hit a two - out RBI single off Mark Hendrickson . 	 In an effort to stack the lineup with right - handed batters and switch - hitters
column36: Showalter started Lugo in left field . It was only the 12th career game in left for Lugo -- the third since 2001 -- and it did n't take long for his inexperience to show . 	 With two outs in the first
column37: Hamilton hit a rising liner to left that Lugo misjudged and could n't grab with a late leap . Hamilton got credit for a double to break an 0 - for-11 slump
column38: but the Orioles escaped damage when Vladimir Guerrero flied out . 	 Game notes 	  Before Moreland 's homer
column39: Texas was held scoreless for 25 straight innings at Camden Yards dating to last season . ... Baltimore had won five straight against the Rangers . ... The Orioles ' run of three straight starts of at least eight innings ended . ... Wilson came in 1 - 3 with a 7.15 ERA in 18 career games against Baltimore . column1: DETROIT -- Armando Galarraga does n't know why the Cleveland Indians ca n't hit him . 	 The Indians ca n't figure out how anyone else can . 	 Galarraga
column2: facing the Indians for the first time since his near - perfect game on June 2
column3: pitched seven shutout innings to lead the Detroit Tigers to a 6 - 0 victory Friday night . 	 " I guess I 'm just comfortable pitching against those guys
column5: who has only allowed four hits in 16 scoreless innings against the Indians . " Tonight
column6: every pitch was in the zone
column7: every pitch had a purpose and every pitch was on the corner . I just kept getting better and better . The sinker was good
column8: the changeup was unbelievable and so was the slider . " 	 For the first half of the game
column10: retiring the first 14 Cleveland hitters . 	 " It crossed my mind -- is this the good Lord somehow
column11: is he going to pitch a perfect game because he did n't get the other one
column12: " Tigers manager Jim Leyland said . " I did think that . I ca n't lie . But as usual
column13: I was wrong . " 	 Jayson Nix ended the drama with a double just over the glove of left fielder Don Kelly . 	 " It was a tough play
column14: but I wish I could have got it
column15: " Kelly said . " I was going full speed toward the wall
column16: and I did n't have a chance to look for the wall
column17: so it was tough . " 	 Cleveland manager Manny Acta said he had n't started thinking about Galarraga 's second run at history
column18: but he was quick to praise the Tigers pitcher for his performances against the Indians this season . 	 " He was brilliant tonight
column19: just like he was brilliant against us the last time
column20: " Acta said . " He deserves all the credit for what he 's done to us . He just keeps throwing strikes and they are all at the knees . That 's very tough to hit . " 	 Nix was n't with the Indians in June
column21: but he knew exactly what was happening
column22: especially after Brandon Inge had made a brilliant diving stop to rob Shelley Duncan of a hit earlier in the fifth . 	 " Everyone knows what happened in that game
column23: so when he got into the fifth inning again
column25: " Nix said . " When Inge made that play -- those are the plays you see in no - hitters -- you started thinking about it a little more . I know everyone in the crowd was thinking about it . " 	 Before Nix 's double
column26: Galarraga had retired 41 of the 42 Indians hitters he had faced this season . The only one to reach base had been Jason Donald
column27: who was mistakenly called safe by first - base umpire Jim Joyce on what would have been the 27th out of Galarraga 's perfect game . 	 " I will always feel happy about that game -- it was a great moment for me
column28: " Galarraga said . " I 'd change the last call so I pitched my perfect game
column29: but I 'd never change anything else about that day . " 	 After the hit
column30: Galarraga ( 4 - 5 ) received a loud ovation from the crowd of 33
column31: 936 . He finished by allowing three hits and matched a career high with eight strikeouts . He went 1 - 4 with a 5.12 ERA in 12 starts between the two outings against Cleveland . 	 " It has been a battle to find my mechanics
column32: but now everything is coming together again
column33: " he said . 	 While Galarraga was frustrating the Indians again
column34: the Tigers offense was ending a three - game losing streak by beating up Cleveland starter Justin Masterson . 	 The Tigers took a 1 - 0 lead in the first when catcher Lou Marson threw away Will Rhymes ' sacrifice - bunt attempt
column35: allowing Austin Jackson to score from second
column36: and doubled the lead later in the inning on Miguel Cabrera 's RBI single . 	 Gerald Laird and Jackson made it 4 - 0 with RBI singles in the second inning
column37: and Rhymes made it a five - run game with a run - scoring base hit in the fourth . 	 Masterson ( 4 - 12 ) dropped to 1 - 4 in his last nine starts
column38: allowing five runs on 11 hits and a walk in six innings . Masterson has now given up at least 10 hits four times this season
column39: tied for fifth in the major leagues . 	 " I was decently pleased
column40: because I got us through six innings
column41: " he said . " I did n't get many breaks tonight . It could have been worse
column42: but obviously
column43: it could have been a lot better . " 	 Kelly finished with a career - best four hits
column44: finishing with an RBI double off Hector Ambriz in the eighth . 	 Game notes 	  Tigers RF Magglio Ordonez
column45: who has been sidelined since fractured his right ankle on July 24

column1: NEW YORK -- Felix Hernandez watched with delight as Russell Branyan 's drive in the first inning landed in the New York Yankees ' bullpen for a three - run homer -- and some rare run support . 	 " It was like
column2: ' Yeah ! ' " Hernandez said . " Now you got to do your job . " 	 Oh
column4: giving up four hits in eight innings to lift the Seattle Mariners to a 6 - 0 victory Friday night and just miss becoming the first pitcher in more than 25 years to throw four straight complete games against the Yankees . 	 Mariners interim manager Daren Brown
column5: who improved to 7 - 3 with the club
column6: did n't consider giving his 24 - year - old ace a shot at the ninth because he threw 117 pitches . 	 " Nope . Nope . I 've said it before : This kid 's valuable to our future . I 'd love to get him an opportunity to go back out if he could keep his pitches down a little bit
column7: " Brown said . " Hopefully sometime down the road the game will have a lot bigger meaning and maybe we 'll think about letting him go . " 	 Branyan also homered in the sixth off A.J. Burnett and drove in four runs to help Seattle win its third in a row . It was Branyan 's 14th multihomer game and second this year . 	 Hat slightly askew as usual
column8: Hernandez kept New York off - kilter
column9: striking out 11 . He was lifted for Garrett Olson
column10: who pitched a perfect ninth to finish the Mariners ' eighth shutout . 	 Alex Rodriguez returned to the Yankees ' lineup as the designated hitter after missing three games because of a strained left calf but was pulled after one at - bat
column11: a groundout . 	 Rodriguez told manager Joe Girardi he felt something pull during a swing . 	 " I would n't say it 's any worse
column12: " Rodriguez said . 	 Girardi said A - Rod will likely miss a few more games
column13: but did n't rule out the disabled list . 	 The Mariners needed just 11 pitches to take a comfortable 3 - 0 lead
column14: the most runs they 've scored when Hernandez started since July 16 -- three runs . Ichiro Suzuki singled
column15: Chone Figgins walked and Branyan hit a 2 - 1 pitch for a homer before Burnett ( 9 - 11 ) got an out . 	 " It 's a lot nicer to score early and watch him relax and settle into his groove
column16: " Branyan said of Hernandez . 	 Coming in
column17: Hernandez ( 9 - 10 ) was 1 - 4 with a 2.04 ERA in his five previous outings
column18: with Seattle scoring four runs . 	 " I thought [ it was ] real big with Felix jumping out and getting three runs on the board early
column19: " Brown said . " He had n't gotten a chance to work with that very often . " 	 King Felix pitched a two - hitter June 30 in New York and went the distance in Seattle on July 10 . He also had a complete game against the Yankees on Sept. 8 at Safeco Field . Toronto 's Dave Stieb went the whole way in four consecutive starts against the Yankees from 1983 - 84 . 	 Hernandez has n't allowed an earned run in his last three starts . Despite his losing record
column20: the right - hander lowered his ERA to 2.51
column21: second - best in the AL . 	 The Mariners added two more runs against Burnett with a parade of singles in the third and fourth . In the third
column22: Casey Kotchman followed Franklin Gutierrez 's hit and stolen base with an RBI single . 	 The restless New York crowd booed Burnett as he gave up three more singles and Suzuki 's run - scoring fielder 's choice to make it 5 - 0 in the fourth . 	 The Yankees ' bullpen remained quiet as the Mariners racked up 10 hits and two walks in the first five innings . 	 Burnett received a warmer reception as he walked off the field after a 1 - 2 - 3 seventh . He yielded 12 hits and six runs while throwing a season - high 122 pitches -- 77 strikes . He struck out four and walked three . 	 " He did n't have command of his fastball
column23: " Girardi said . 	 The Yankees loaded the bases with one out in the fifth but Hernandez struck out Ramiro Pena and Brett Gardner to end that threat . 	 Derek Jeter doubled with one out in the fourth for the first hit off Hernandez but was stranded at third . 	 Hernandez made several nice stabs on sharp grounders back to the mound . On one in the eighth
column24: he caught Gardner in a rundown between second and third for the second out . 	 Game notes 	  The Indians chose RHP Zach McAllister from Triple - A Scranton / Wilkes - Barre as the player to be named in the deal that sent Austin Kearns to New York . McAllister was 8 - 10 with a 5.09 ERA in 24 starts for Scranton . ... Yankees RHP Alfredo Aceves
column25: on the 60 - day disabled list with a strained lower back
column26: will throw three innings Saturday or Sunday for Double - A Trenton . ... Branyan 's last multihomer game was for Cleveland on May 11 against Kansas City . ... Before Hernandez
column27: Jamie Navarro was the previous pitcher to throw three straight complete games against the Yankees

column1: PHILADELPHIA -- With Roy Halladay on the mound
column2: the Phillies offense did n't have to do too much . 	 Halladay pitched seven shutout innings to lead Philadelphia to a 1 - 0 victory over the Washington Nationals on Friday night . 	 It was the Phillies ' 13th win in the last 17 games and kept them 2 games behind the Atlanta Braves in the NL East . 	 Halladay ( 16 - 8) won his sixth straight while lowering his ERA to 2.16 . He allowed eight hits
column3: striking out five and walking three
column4: matching a season high . It was the ninth time this season he has n't allowed a run and the 25th time in 26 starts he has pitched six or more innings . 	 " He 's having a special season

" They 've been kicking our butt

column4: this will bring some confidence because I think everyone had good at bats
